text: My go-to place to take friends. The spinach salad is fabulous. The curries are super tasty. The Thai basil chicken is defaulted to hot, so make sure to give a rating on the spice level. The lava shrimp are a must have. They renovated and expanded a few months ago. Love this place!

Food is good. Authentic Thai food, freshly cooked as you order them. I love their spinach salad. The place is a little small and cramped, so you might as well make a reservation if you're going in a group. Price is reasonable as the food are freshly prepared.

Upscale Thai with a unique menu and super cute Summerlin dining room... I realy wanted to like this place!  I notice some of the positive reviews say Nittaya's is hit or miss, but I can't bring myself to go back.  Servers here are awkward high school boys who forgot numerous parts of our order and brought things out in incorrect order (one of our apps came after we had finished entrees, drink never came, etc.), way strange for an upscale restaurant in this part of town.  Makes no sense.  Fried "famous" spinach salad lacked any kind of heat or flavor.  The coconut soup was boring and one note, again no flavor.  Nothing wowed us, and we tried a good assortment.  With SO many fab Thai restaurants in this city (ie. Lotus of Siam where they have an expansive menu of authentic and super memorable dishes), this should be last on anyone's list.  I'm guessing they cater to people with timid palates who want a quiet and cute atmosphere for date night and food comes secondary.  I cannot imagine a lover of Thai food coming here more than once.

Really 3.5, this place is super cute and cozy. Perfect for a date night, but keep in mind it's very small. Decent wine selection. The food had more of an Americanized Thai flavor, but still good. The Thai tea was waaaayy too sweet. I would stay away. They have great lunch specials. Service was ok, not great but not bad.
Everything we ordered was outstanding. The service was great as well. I'm not from Vegas but this restaurant will be on my list of favorites when I return.

5 Stars for sure!

The First Rule of Nittaya's Secret Kitchen
is you DO NOT talk about Nittaya's Secret Kitchen!
(Except to tell awesome people who love amazing food.
Always tell other awesome people.)

I heard it through the grapevine that this place was amazing, and oh-WOW-uh!
I knew before my meal was over that I would become a regular 
& will attempt to try everything on the menu, eventually.

Extremely intimate & cozy (for now), so become one of the initiated
before the word gets out and the expansion starts.

I'll say no more (for now).

One of the best tai restaurants I have ever eatten in.  Warm decor, great staff.  The food is amasing each time I go.  I am hooked on the coconut soup.  The spinage salad is fabulous and if you like pad tai, their's can't be beat.  It is a little expensive but quality food always cost a little more.  I love it!  Can't wait to go back and try the curry.

Love! It's small and intimate and the food is delicious. This is not one of the noisy "hip" places with overpriced crap on the menu. This is a place for food lovers. The decor is very nice as well. 

Everything we tried so far is excellent. But there is one thing that's to die for: the creme brûlée trio!! Chocolate, coconut and lemongrass. You may not think these sound so great but they are all absolutely delicious. Mmmmmmmmmmm!!!!
Another Thai favorite to my list. This is a hidden gem. Great tasting food and drink menu

This little gem of a restaurant has won me over after only 2 visits. Most Thai places I've visited feel too cold, too sterile, too kitschy. Nittaya is a comfortable space that feels elegant without feeling stuffy.

The food is the true star. Nittay's Secret Kitchen serves "Thai Tapas". I was skeptical that this was just another marketing term for "not enough food". I was pleasantly surprised. Generously portioned, beautiful and tasty creations graced my table. The World Famous Spinach salad is a revelation. Deep fried Avocado with panko crumbs and two sauces will make you swoon. 

I plan on eating my way through the menu :)

The fried spinach is heaven! I thought I've had good fried spinach before, but not even close.. Hands down, a must-try! Service was great as well, I wish I remembered his name but he was the bartender as well. Awesome guy with random useful facts!

Husband and I stopped in on a Saturday night without reservations around 6pm and were seated without issues, which was nice because we seemed to just beat the rush that happened at 6:30 to 7:00pm. The waitress was very kind and patient in explaining the dishes. It didn't seem to have come from some rehearsed dialog, as she genuinely cared about the food and service. We chose the chicken pad thai and tapas called Golden Pouches. The pad thai was most definitely the best version of the dish that I have had in town and was a spitting image of my memory of my Thai friends' family's home-cooked pad thai. The chicken was tender and the flavors were amazing! Earthy, fresh, noodle texture was perfect and not rubbery... We ate the whole thing and when we go back again, we would easily order that dish a second time. The golden pouches are potato and curry seasoning wrapped in egg dough that is fried. They are made to look like little pouches, and they are so good, crisp, hot, and spiced! Reminded me of Christmas... Those were off the tapas menu, and were big enough to be satisfying. 

The ambience was very nice, subtle decor, music from Massive Attack playing in the background... Did not have a chance to try any wines, but the selection was very decent given the size of the establishment. The bar section looked very inviting. Overall cozy feel and welcoming. Would certainly go back again to try more dishes, if only for the kindness of the staff, not to mention the quality of the food.

Fantastic place!

Small, intimate dining, with a nice bar.

Incredible food, with complex intertwined flavors and world class presentation. 

The service was quick, but un-rushed. Very attentive.  No bum's rush with the check when we were finished.

Simply the best Thai food in the Las Vegas valley

I absolutely love this place! The food is amazing, service is perfect and the atmosphere and presentation make you feel like you are at a 5-star restaurant but their amazing lunch combo is only $12! They have different infused water available each day, like mint cucumber, and it's always so yummy and refreshing. They just hit every single detail here and I could eat their drunken noodles every day!

Food was very tasty. We started with the tempura battered spinach that was served with a side of wonderful citrusy dressing. Delicious and a must have. I ordered the massaman curry, which was outstanding. They list it as a spicy dish, however I don't think that is was spicy at all. The flavor was amazing though, didn't miss the heat at all. My husband had a salad with beef, the name escapes me, that was good. 
The water is infused with strawberry and I want to say rose. Loved it. 
I wish the restaurant was a little more child friendly. My little one needs to be able to sit up in a highchair, which are not offered.
Amazing food! Wonderful, attentive staff. I tried the pad Thai and drunken noodles, both were spectacular.

I love this restaurant and have been there three times now. The first two times were really pleasant and we had a great experience. So I should certainly rate this with five stars. 

But last valentines day I reached the restaurant and had very poor service. Not only was the service too slow ( which can be expected on a busy night) but the food was extremely spicy. When we told the staff about our experience they started arguing. It's only when I said fine, we can't eat this just get the check and I'll leave did the staff agree to "add some coconut milk" to make it palatable. Not a fun place to be on a romantic night. And that's why it gets 3 stars.

We went with a big group, and although this restaurant is quite small, they accommodated us well!  We started out with a bunch of tapas...the best one was the spinach salad with tempura spinach (so unique!) that came with a chicken lime dressing.  The tempura was not overly greasy and paired well with the dressing.  The fried avocado was also very good, creamy on the inside and perfectly crunchy on the outside.  For our entrees, the green curry with chicken and penang curry shrimp were my favorites.  The flavors were excellent, and there was some definite spice to the dishes.  The chicken pad thai and pad Z-U were standard.  

The restaurant itself is very pretty inside, with low-lighting for a more romantic atmosphere.  Definitely give this place a try for a more upscale Thai restaurant!
The fried avocados and spinach salad are amazing. The service is wonderful as well. I need to come back and try out more of the menu. Highly recommend.

This has to be the best Thai restaurant I have ever enjoyed. We ordered the crab rolls that came with a nice sweet sauce, eggplant panang, koi-soi (with pork shoulder), and lemon grass soup. We loved all of it! Service was friendly and ambience was warm. The strawberry infused water was a good touch. I look forward to trying some wine on my next visit. All around 5 stars.

Took our dinner 50 min. To come . Lousy service. Will not come back.  Ask for Hot sauce, took 10 min, fish sauce, another 10 min. My husband was livid. Green curry was lousy. Padtai  noodles ok. They are really short of hands. Bad experience.

This place is exceptional. It's a small bistro setting and the food is excellent.  Customer service was first class.

Small portion size but gourmet presentation, and incredible flavors.

The night we went the house special was Ahi Pokey, OMG, delicious!

I've been here a few times and I must always order the spinach salad... so so good! who doesn't like friend spinach with a yummy cashew sauce?  I tried the fried avocados, not as amazing, the curries are delish! The restaurant is small and doesn't have a lot of tables so if you go on a Friday/Saturday be prepared to wait... but its so worth it!

Food this good should never be a secret. Me and my wife had date night with a couple of friends. As we walked up to the venue we noticed that a considerable amount of people were already neatly tucked into their out door bistro style seating. We went in and immediately to our left was this kickback bar with a wall decorated with various wines. To the right was table and semi booth seating. The ambience was great! It was a mix between a hip dive bar and chic and exclusive eatery. This is a very cool place to take a date. The menu has plenty to choose from. We tried the corn fritters which were yummy, super delicious chicken lettuce wraps, green curry, avocado steak, volcano shrimp that was soo good I can still taste it and I  special requested a coconut curry chicken. To my delight, my curry was served in a roasted coconut bowl with sweet coconut lining the inside of the shell. I love love love loved it! The servers were attentive and accommodating. I'm looking forward to returning. If you love tai food or are looking for a great first time experience you should totally go here. It has an upbeat atmosphere that's great if you don't mind crowds.

If you like Thai food, or if you're the kind of person that likes to try new delicious things, this place is amazing. A member of our party ordered the tempura spinach leaves for the table, which were great. I had the coconut soup to start with, played it safe with the chicken pad thai, then had the coconut creme brûlée for dessert. Everything was absolutely wonderful and I can't wait to go back and try the Thai Donuts!

I kind of wish there was a half-star rating, since Nittaya's falls between 3 and 4 stars for me. I rounded up based on the expectation that my next experience will be even better. 
We went to Nittaya's for dinner last night and it was quite busy. We hadn't thought to make a reservation (our fault) but there wasn't a long wait, which was nice. The dining space is tiny, but elegantly decorated and comfortable. You get quite friendly with your neighbors, which is good if you are social, or if you just want to look at their food. They do have some outdoor seating, which looked pleasant, and we'll definitely try next time. 
On being sat, we were offered a fruit infused water. I thought it was very nice, subtle, and something a little different. 
Before I go any further, I have to admit that I am NOT a Thai food expert. I have actually actively avoided Thai food for years because I couldn't handle spice. I only recently began developing any spice tolerance and  I was hoping a "fusion" place like Nittaya's would help ease me into a heretofore unexplored cuisine. I was definitely not disappointed on that count.
My husband ordered the fried avocado as an appetizer. Unfortunately, it took a REALLY long time to come out of the kitchen. We kept watching food for the table behind us whiz past while we could only stare longingly at it. Finally however, it did come out and oh, it was worth the wait! The avocado was a brilliant green, with just enough coating to give it a delicious crunch without being oily. The sauce that came with it was bright and flavorful and just a little spicy, perfectly cutting through the creaminess of the avocado.
For entrees my husband ordered the duck curry and I ordered the tofu curry, and here is where we came to another service problem. My curry came to the table roughly ten minutes before my husband's ever made it out of the kitchen. The waitress was extremely apologetic and offered us comped desserts to make up for it. Again, the food was totally worth the wait. The tofu was nicely seared (which many places don't bother to do) and the sauce, although a bit on the sweet side, was very delicious. My husband thoroughly enjoyed his duck curry, saying the duck was very moist, tender, and perfectly cooked. I tried one of the cherry tomatoes from his dish and though it was a little spicier than mine it wasn't overwhelming.
Then it was dessert. I chose the Thai Donuts, while my husband got the fried banana rolls. Both came out piping hot and absolutely delicious. The only complaint I would make about the donuts is that I would have liked a ramekin of some kind of sauce to dip them into. 
The waitress apologized again, and assured us that the kitchen normally runs much smoother. We told her we appreciated her candor, and that we would definitely be back. And we will!

The food and wine are so good. Everything is reasonably priced for quality that tastes like it should cost way more. The intimate atmosphere is perfect for a date or small celebration. My husband is not a huge fan of Thai food but the menu is varied so it doesn't matter. I usually get a curry with tofu and it's always delicious, the tofu is expertly cooked. The appetizers have been good as well and they do have a small bar so it's also a good place for drinks and apps.

Must try their world famous Spanish salad, it's probably not what you expect.  Thai tapas are usually what I try.  Love most of them, some even "just like mama makes it".  

I've tried curry which they ask between 1-5 and we had a 5 (which my friend asked for a thai 5 not a white guy's 5, since he's had some places skimp thinking he can't handle it) and it wasn't that spicy at all.  Although he did get the Duck Curry, which too spicy might overpower the dish.  So it's understandable.  My other friend got a 3 tofu curry.  TO DIE FOR!  I loved it and I am normally not a curry fan.  Although eatting a whole dish by myself I don't know (that's just not my dish nothing against the food)

I prefer Pad Thai.  They have tofu and chicken, but we asked for Duck.  They made it for us.  It was heaven! I would ask them to make it again!  

They also have wine there...and are pretty knowledgeable and will let you try some of the wine if you were interested in trying it.  ((We spent more in wine than our dishes...we had 7 people and our bill ended up being 150 for food and 170 for wine))  I say with that many people, it was a good deal :)

This is an update from my 3 Star review back in September of 2016.  First the food.  Like I wrote last year, the food at Nittaya's Secret Kitchen is exceptional.  When I wrote the review last year I was so upset about the service I really wanted to give the review a 1 star, but because of the food gave it 3 Stars.  Since September 2016 I have been back to Nittaya's six times and all six times the Staff has been really good, no GREAT!.  First they seem to remember us now.  Second, the indifference we used to experience when we walked in is gone.  Third, the Waitresses and Waiters seem to really care about providing good service along with the exceptional food.  The staff has improved remarkably and they truly seem to care about what they are doing and making sure their customers are completely satisfied.  This is a great restaurant and the staff have become professionals in their craft.  I highly recommend Nittaya's and want to thank everyone from the Bartender to the Waitresses, to the Waiters and most of all to Nittaya for running one of the best restaurants in Las Vegas.

We've eaten at just about every Thai place in Las Vegas.  Nittaya's is probably the best. Exceptional quality. Unique menu and flavors.  I've yet to find a menu item I dislike. Nice setting as well.  People always talk about Lotus of Siam, but this place is much better and more interesting in my opinion.

I love the food at this Thai restaurant. One of my favorite dishes is the coconut Seafood Curry. It is served in a coconut with Jasmine rice on the side so many different types of seafood in side the coconut with wonderful Curry coconut sauce delicious. I always love going back there to see what's new and on the menu so many wonderful things to try.

I found myself in Nittaya's the other day after asking Siri for Thai nearby me.  I have lived in this area for almost 8 years, and I am embarrassed to say I have never stopped by.  I stopped in and placed an order for take out, but was immediately taken back by the very intimate and sophisticated interior decor.  I know Thai, and this was much more White Orchid. Very classy, very inmate.  

For sure, there were still classic Thai accouterments adoring the walls, but it was not overdone.  I really wish I could rate the wine bar, because it looked above-average, and who doesn't want to rate a wine bar? 

I can rate two things: a few of the dishes and the service I received. 

I ordered Curry in Young Coconut, Basil Beef, and Tofu Pad Thai (always have to try the Pad).  The Basil Beef was excellent (similar preparation to Mint Beef), sweet and savory.  The Pad Thai was also excellent.  Not overdone, not too sauced, and the waitress asked if the included egg was OK - as a Tofu dish, I could see how egg may put some people off and this was a nice touch.   

The Curry Coconut?  Oh my.  It was the perfect dish. Amazing curry spice sauce, mussels, clams, scallops, and whitefish all roasted inside a coconut.  My son hasn't stopped talking about it for two days.  This is a definite must-do.

The service was very polite and professional and did not lack.  

I can't wait to go back after finding this gem for a proper sit-in dinner.  Maybe I will get  to review the wine bar, too.  For the sake of review only, of course.

I'm holding off on 5 (or 3) stars until I get a full sit-in experience.

Awesomeeee food, pineapple fried rice is the best ive had. All their plates r wonderful and great service. Id rather spend 50 $ here than anywhere else n know that the food is always perfect. Keep up the amazing cuisine chef! Aloha
Wonderful food and exceptional service. The spinach salad is a must have! Love the cozy ambiance.

We truly enjoyed this restaurant. We went in giving the Chef carte blanche with our dinner with the only requirement being that we are gluten free. He made a wonderful Salmon Eggplant green curry and lettuce wraps for appetizer. I enjoyed the ambiance. It was pretty quiet, but it was a Monday at 5pm, so I'm guessing it gets busier. Not Good for Kids at all....so don't bring them!

I had a pad Thai craving and headed out for this place. I had a perfect meal with a tasty wine and sat solo at the end of the bar with my kindle, enjoying every bite.  At first, it seemed a bit pricey, $17-$18 for pad Thai (usually around $10-$15), but then I got the dish and damn, it was worth every cent...I would gladly pay that, even more, again.  The bartender/server was super helpful with wine (offering to let me try before making a selection) and food recommendations.  I'll be back to try the infamous spinach "salad" for sure.

The food is delicious, presented in beautifully decorated dishes by Executive Chef Nittaya. They have an amazingly rich wine selection from wineries around the world. The employees are very friendly, providing quick, but excellent service. You will feel cozy in the restaurant's ambience with all wooden walls, tables and wine teamed decorations. This is a must - try place. Once you visit it for a first time, you will love Nittaya's Secret Kitchen.

Attentive and friendly staff. Josh, behind the bar, was my server.  Food is beyond expectation. I started with the coconut soap that was a surprise of perfect pieces of chicken. Then had Massaman chicken that is very good, stick to your ribs and filling. Ended with Thai Donuts that I thought I would not be able to eat them all but had no problem empting the plate. Small space for the well to do locals without busting the wallet. I will go back for more.

The food was tasty, however, the small portion size does not warrant the oversized price. $18 for a tiny portion of crab fried rice ......ridiculous!  There was so much sauce in our chicken dish but just a tiny portion of chicken, again, $18.  They have to lower their prices.

My boyfriend and I always drive by this Thai place always saying how we wanted to try it, well we finally did! 
The restaurant is very cozy with a rustic feel to it.
We went afternoonish so it wasn't busy at all, two other couples, so it was very quiet. Service we pretty quick with seating us and taking our orders, but again it was a quiet afternoon. 
We ordered 3 tapas dishes and 2 main dishes and it was way more than we had expected for just the two of us, but the more the merrier right?!
We started with the shrimp jalepeno poppers, crispy pork, and the stuffed chicken wings. 
For our entree we ordered the home style shrimp pad Thai and the drunken noodles.
I love when Thai dishes have a good kick to it, but was a little disappointed when I didn't get just that. The shrimp jalepeno poppers had maybe the littlest kick to them.
I also ordered my drunken noodles with spice and was more overwhelmed with the amount of basil in it. To be fair the menu description clearly lists the main ingredients as egg, chicken, and BASIL.
All in all, I really did like the restaurant and the food as a whole and would definitely come back! Maybe just ask for a bit more spice next time :)

My wife and I have been coming here for a couple years now, so I can't believe I haven't given a review yet! Honestly, Nittaya's is the best Thai food either of us have ever had. 

Nittaya's is definitely an elevated and more stylistic type of Thai: seriously tasty and satisfying dishes with a modern tapas flare. Deep and unique flavors in every dish and sauce. Even if you are the type that only gets a common dish like pad thai (like I used to...), you will love it, but I recommend branching out if you come here. The quality and taste equal that of the presentation, which you can tell by the pictures!

Food was VERY spicy... usually they will identify what is spicy or not.  Expensive for what you get.  $14 for Fried Rice on lunch menu.  Had ordered a dish and then decided to cancel before dish was served.  Owner insisted I pay for the dish even thou I had not received it yet.  Overall nothing special for the price.   If you don't like Very Spicy Thai, make sure you are careful what you order.

We had driven by this restaurant many times but never saw many cars and were hesitant to go in for dinner.  On a recent Thursday night we arrived there a little early,  which was a good thing since its a small restaurant with few tables that really fills up.  Our waiter was very helpful with the complex menu.  Her recommendations which included the fried spinach didn't disappoint,  the food was great.  The prices good, and the portions ample.  The atmosphere was also lovely, so unexpected from the outside.   We will defiantly make this a neighborhood regular

So earlier, I had a higher review of this restaurant (only 3 starts) but after a whole fiasco of incorrect credit card charges unfolded after my visit, I must give this place a much lower rating.

I went with my friend, and we wanted to split the bill down the middle, which is easy enough, but they double charged her and then were very rude about the whole thing, refusing to refund the money. 

This was to top of an already mediocre to poor evening of service.  I am so embarrassed to have invited my friend here for what was supposed to be a fun girls' night out.
Such a great place! Small, cozy, and intimate atmosphere. Food is superb! Every dish is so creative and unique from other restaurants. Try the spinach salad or volcano shrimp. They are delicious!

Fine dining Thai in Summerlin! It's a pretty small place but that just makes it so intimate..Everything I had was delish! Tamarind shrimp, lettuce wraps, and drunken noodle. We went on a Monday night and it was a full house. I suggest making reservations. It's a perfect spot for a low key date night!

Love this place - the food, the ambiance, the SERVICE and the food again! Just perfect. Ask for Devynn if you go! She's fantastic. 

This is an upscale place where you can either dress a little nicer for a great date night or a little more casual.

If you can stand the taste of avocado even only somewhat then get the Avocado Curry, it. is. a. mazing! I got the Avocado with steak (med-rare) curry and it was amazing. The other food is also really good and it's cheaper than what I expected such a fancy looking restaurant to be although I wouldn't say it's cheap either but it's worth it. Since I go with family and friends and we always taste each other's food I can honestly say that I have yet to taste a dish that I don't like. Service is good, they infuse strawberries with the water though so if you have an allergy to it TELL THEM. Overall though it was really good.

Probably the only Thai place in Summerlin that I know.
 I don't know maybe. I'm not an expert or something. But the food was decent for a Thai place. If you want real good Thai place  look up noodle house and pin kaow pretty good places.

This is one of our favorite date night restaurants!  They have great food, wine, and ambience.  We love the coconut seafood curry and the coconut shrimp.  We will definitely miss this place when we move from Vegas!
very small place. The food was outstanding. i will be going back. my wife and i loved this place everything we had tasted awesome

Omg Becky!  I am in love with this spot!  Everything on the menu is fabulous!!  Cannot eat here without ordering the World Famous Spinach Salad, Cilantro Steak Skewers & Fried Avocado!!!!  Those 3 are a MUST!!!!!
Absolutely, hands down the best Thai food. I enjoyed every bite of it. Great service!

I came here on my 40th birthday with my husband and friends. Very nice and intimate place to eat.  I had the Salmon which was tasty and delicious.  Everything we ordered on the menu was amazing! The pad thai, calamari, satay, pineapple fried rice and curry chicken was all delicious! They also have a wide variety of wine.  The mango sticky rice with coconut ice cream was a great finish to our meal. I would definitely recommend this to my friends and family!
Best Thai in town! The staff is phenomenal- especially the bartender. She always remembers us and has great recommendations. The food is amazing and never disappoints! Love Love Love!!!!

Have eaten here three more times since the initial review and the quality of the food has notably declined.  

Today one in the party ordered Pad Z-U beef.  I thought it curious that there was some wadded up plastic wrap under the rim of the plate, and removed it.  It seems that dish was refrigerated and re-heated (possibly in the microwave given the plastic wrap's texture).  It didn't look good, and our companion, having had the Pad Z-U two other times here was very disappointed.  It was served lukewarm too.  

The other two dishes:
-eggplant with basil sauce and added tofu was fine, though tastier on prior visits

-eggplant with peanut sauce ordered mild, but came more medium-hot, but good

-an order of brown rice was a bit undercooked and about 1/4 of the quantity of the dish of white rice, not quite enough for one person  

-waiter was distracted and a bit grumpy and was the same way last time too

The place wasn't very busy at lunch and perhaps the declining food quality and service is to blame, especially when their prices are in the higher category.  Quite a disappointment.

What a secret!  I can't help but tell everyone about Nittaya's.  A very small, cozy space that is stylish yet casual.  Each dish is carefully thought out and executed beautifully.  The dishes are layered with flavor and it is worth making many visits to get through the menu.  Tapas & Thai, two of my favorite things done very well!

The Secret Kitchen is all about secret family recipes from Thailand. The restaurant offers Asian cuisine served tapa's style and a regular Thai menu. The restaurant serves beer and wine. The service is outstanding an very attentive. The desert menu is delightful. Try the old style rice pudding. This is one of the BEST Thai restaurants in the Las Vegas area. I know I am hooked. They do have carry out service. The restaurant is small, clean and very romantic. I suggest you make a reservation on the weekend. Absolutely marvelous!

This is the mother
"The hair that I gave your server was in the food that was served to me. I pulled it out of my mouth. The hair was grey, not blonde! I then placed it on the tablecloth next to me to give to your server. We did not expect you to comp the entire meal. We did expect you not to try and charge us for the dish with the hair in it. Not only did you charge for the dish, you offered us a free dessert and yes, we ordered two. So what did you do? You gave us the cheaper one for $7.00 and charged us for the dish that cost $12.00. The right thing to do would have have been for you, the chef/owner to come out, apologize and make it right. We have enjoyed our other meals at your restaurant and have recommended it to our friends. This kind of experience leaves a really bad impression and does not excite us to come back or recommend you. With such a small venue, it seems to me that you would want your customers be leave happy. As an aside, my dish was shrimp with baby bok choy as was my daughters. Both dishes came with broccoli (substitute) , with no discussion or notice from the server! Sincerely, the mother who had the grey hair in her mouth."

Great ambience and atmosphere. Small cozy restaurant with great decor. Very welcoming service staff. I was introduced to this restaurant by a good friend of mine who is Thai herself... and when she says the food is delicious, it it must be good!  We went for lunch, (it was a total of five of us) for a birthday celebration. Even though we made reservations, it was nice to go when we didn't feel rushed by a dinner crowd and the food came out very quickly.  I will definitely be back! Worth a try, I would highly recommend coming.

The Spinach salad is actually more kinda like Spinach "nachos" -- spinach dipped in tempura so they're like crunchy chips that you can dip in a delicious sauce. The tofu Pad Thai and Beef Pad See Ew were also good. The prawn tapas was a little dry / not recommended.

Love this place!  The spinach tempura salad is one of the best appetizers I've eaten in years.   The interior is small but cozy and would be perfect if you are on a date or meeting with friends.  It's not pretentious but it does however have a sophisticated atmosphere.  I would rate Nittaya's right up there with Archi's Thai or Pin Kow.

Amazing food and service! Very nice ambience. We had the secret potstickers, tempura spinach salad, shrimp curry, pork green bean curry, and the bread pudding and everything was delicious. So glad we finally tried this place, will definitely be frequenting!

My friends and I decided to have dinner at Nittaya's  as we wanted to try a restaurant we had never been to before and Nittaya's menu of Thai inspired tapas was intriguing.

Nittaya's is a small, nicely appointed restaurant on the corner of Rampart and Lake Mead.  The restaurant has a long bar with comfortable looking leather stools and just eleven tables set with little oil burning candles, white table clothes and fresh flowers. When we arrived on a Monday night, at 5:00 pm, we were the  first guests to be seated, but by the time we left two hours later, the place was nearly full.

Service was wonderful.  Our severs were friendly, knowledgeable of the menu items, prompt, and unobtrusive.  Our server even asked if we'd like to sample the wine we decided on before we committed to order it.

Nittaya's has two menus, one for traditional choices of appetizers, salads and entrees, and a tapas menu featuring a vast selection of Thai inspired little dishes. The restaurant also serves a decent selection of wine and beer. My friends and I decided to order several dishes from the Tapas menu and share them.  

We ordered the "World Famous Spinach  Salad", bbq ribs with five spice, curry potato puffs,  mango shrimp, beef jerky, pork egg rolls, and crab wontons.  The true winner in all of those selections was the spinach salad which wasn't really a salad.  It was tempura fried spinach leaves served with a tangy sauce that contained cashews and chicken.  It was absolutely delicious and I highly recommend anyone who dines at Nittaya's to try it.  The beef jerky was also good and not like traditional tough dry slices of beef.  The jerky was tender, tangy marinated pieces of  beef with a good amount of heat.  I enjoyed this dish very much, but one of my dining companions thought it had a little too much heat.  The mango shrimp were ok.  They were small size, shelled shrimp wrapped in bacon and served with a creamy mango sauce.  They were good, but would have been better if the shrimp were bigger and the bacon a little less overpowering.  The crab wontons and egg rolls were good but did not stand apart from those sold at chain take-out restaurants.  Two of the dishes we had were disappointing, with the ribs having a nice flavor, but being so tough they required a knife to eat, and even then took a little work to get the meat off the bone, and the curry potato puffs (curry flavored mashed potatoes, shaped into little semi circles, battered and deep fried), being so sweet they bordered on being candy.

For dessert we tried the Thai donuts and coconut ice cream.  Both were heavenly.  The donuts were little fried rounds of fluffy light and incredibly delicious dough that was not overly sweet, and were served with a caramel sauce which added  just enough sweetness to make them one of the most delicious donuts I've ever eaten.  I would love it if Nittaya's sold these exceptional little bites by the bag full with a generous dusting of powdered sugar as I would.buy them daily.  The coconut ice cream was served in a pretty little covered pewter bowl.  The  texture was  somewhere between an ice cream and a sorbet, and was so delicious and bursting with coconut flavor that I wished I could have bought a quart to take home.

The price for dinner for the three of us, which included several rounds of wine and beer, was $130.  

Overall, I liked Nittayas and will return to try other dishes on the menu and to have those incredible donuts and coconut ice cream again.

The interior of this restaurant is very elegant, but the furniture is too big for the small space. All tables are way too close to the others, leaving little room for some privacy. Altough the decor might be called intimate, it appeared a little to dark for my taste, with black table linen. Service was excellent though and restrooms were immaculaty clean.
The food was tasty, but not extraordinary. Avocado rolls were delicious, but so are those at other places (Cheesecake factory, BJ's in Henderson). The spinach salad was fried, but that was our mistake as we did not check. Komol serves a similar dish that is just as good. Drunken noodles (flat noodles with ground chicken and veggies), was great, although Dangee Thai on Pecos makes them better. 
Overall a very enjoyable lunch but the Eastside of town has just as many enjoyable places. Komol is great, but StickErice is still my favorite Thai!


Update: I received a nice email back from the owner, explaining some of the dishes I tried and I really appreciated the effort. It showed they really care about their food and their customers. Maybe a second try might be worth it when I am in Summerlin.
This is the most romantic Thai food spot we have found in Vegas.  Were making this a monthly location. :-)

Best Thai food in Vegas!  In my opinion way way way way way better than Lotus of Siam, puts them to shame actually.  Satay, Tao, and Lemongrass is also very good, but I like this one the  best, not sure how it was rated 10th and Lotus was #1, other than the god awful press in this town barging about it.  Honestly if you have not tried this place, give them a try, great food, good prices, however it is very small and sometimes hard to get a seat inside.

I really enjoyed the tapas. We ordered the fried spinach, fried avocado, steamed mussels, bacon-wrapped mango shrimp, and chicken with peanut sauce. The first two dishes were novel and served with excellent dipping sauces. The mussels were fresh and maybe just a tad over cooked, but still pretty good and without that stale salty taste.  The shrimp and chicken were also delicious.  The one aspect I would recommend is to order the food a little at a time because it came to us quickly, but it was a Tuesday night.  I can't wait to go back-and I've lived in NYC and travel abroad (including Paris) and so I recognize a good thing when I taste it!

Delish! My boyfriend and I tried 10 tapas, including 2 desserts. Here are the outstanding:
Spinach salad: OMG. Must try. Fried spinach with cilantro lime dressing, diced chicken, and cashews. Our favorite.
Secret stickers: delicious pot stickers with house dipping sauce. These are hard to explain but amazing
Golden pouches: potato purée, sweet golden curry, deep fried crispy pouch. Must try.
Mango sticky rice: fresh mango slices, sticky rice in a sweet coconut cream. To die for.
Mussels: steamed mussels in coconut broth with lemongrass sauce on side. Must try! 

Still good, but not favorites
Crab wanton: needed more crab and maybe a little bit of green onion.. Still delicious
Esaan sausage: little sausages, good flavor but not the best
Naked shrimp: shrimp in a Thai sauce, a little too fishy
Sweet corn fritters: our least favorite, needed more corn. Mostly ground pork with corn here n there deep fried. 
Thai donuts: large order! 5 donuts per order. Still very good but could have used another sweet component. 

Service is amazing.. Best I've gotten in a really long time.
Excellent cuisine with a friendly staff and owner.  The dessert menu is aptly titled "Happy Endings".  For a Thai restaurant, its utterly hilarious!

Wow!  I'm in town for business and I wanted something different. I love Thai food and thought I would try Nittaya's Secret Kitchen.  The service was amazing and the food was even better!  I asked the server, James, to just "feed me" whatever he recommends. James brought me a tapas plate of deep fried pork belly with a sweet chili sauce for a starter. The pork belly was cooked just right and the sauce was spicy hot but I couldn't get enough of it. For my entree I was served curry steak with avocado. The curry sauce was fantastic!  I refrained from licking my plate but I managed to clean the plate using the steak, eggplant, and rice. 
Great recommendations James!  I can't wait to visit again. Yummy!

I was thoroughly impressed! Great service. Superb food. Ambiance was great. We had the chicken curry (hot), this was super tasty. Perfect sized serving. The spinach was TO DIE FOR, the sauce was just the cherry on top. I will be back, for sure.
Amazing! We must've tried 8 tapas and a red curry, all were delicious.  I can't wait to go back.

I liked this place, but it is TINY as in you have to literally squeeze by the table next to you, to sit down. The Thai food was more Thai fusion, the presentation was beautiful the prices a little high. Is it the most authentic place I have eaten? no. But it is a nice place for date night (don't let the price point fool you). The food was good, but I cant get over how cramped the tables. I think in reality it deserves a 3.5 rating.
Very nice atmosphere. Our server was delightful. We only had tapas on this occasion and found that Four items were plenty for the two of us. Each one was tasty and well presented. We will be back.

Oh yeah gurl, you want to go to there. 
*Calamari Lemongrass Salad
*Spicy Green Bean Pork
*Crying Tiger Steak
*Spicy Catfish
*Green Curry
*Eggplant with Thai Basil
*Fried Banana

I didnt eat all of that myself. I went with 3 other people and my 13 year old daughter. 2 of the guys own a world famous restaurant and they were super impressed as well. We brought a bottle of our own wine and they allowed us to do that and we were glad to pay the nominal corkage fee. We even ordered a bottle(or two? ) from their better than average wine list. 
The wait staff was amazing. My daughter kept saying, "Hey Josh, could you bring us some lettuce bowls for the pork? Can you bring me some shishito peppers?" He catered to her like the foodie queen that she is. That in itself was impressive. Most waiters approach teenagers with a bit of awkward disdain, glancing at the mother before they feel the child's food request is valid.. Josh was amazing.  
They are willing to accomadate almost any request to the best of their ability. Helpful, not hovering. It really is a secret, special place.

First me start by saying this place is definitely a 5 star restaurant. The only reason I removed a star was due to the limited menu but I assure you everything on the menu deserves 5 stars. The spinach salad seems to be everyone's favorite and with good reason. I had the pad see ew, fried rice, and spicy basil chicken. This place seems to only use the freshest ingredients and the customer service was excellent. It is indeed a bit pricey but that should be expected from a place that serves only the freshest produce on its menu. The atmosphere was intriguing with the mood lighting being very dim. The comfort was tight but not crowded. I will definitely be returning back because they certainly know how to treat their customers unlike some of the other local businesses in town that I posted negative reviews for. 

Make sure you check those reviews out and stay far away from them!

came here for valentines day. had a lovely evening. the restaurant itself is very small, cosy and intimate. perfect for a romantic meal. the service was good and the food was really nice. I had the basil beef and it was very tasty. portions arent too big, nor too small,just right. recommended.

Very friendly staff. I've been there 4 times now (every weekend) since I found this place. Very authentic Thai food and the staff is great. I would recommend you make a reservation because the restaurant is a bit small.

What a great find for lunch and luckily we got there before noon because it filled up fast. We sat at the bar and received great service. As first timers we wanted to try several dishes knowing we could take home what we couldn't eat. We tried the dumplings (great) and satay (excellent) and then I had spicey pork noodles while wife had the bbq ribs. Mine was good but hers was Outstanding. We had one of the coldest Sapporo beers ever. A perfect match.
We'll go back. :)

I notified the waitress that I had a severe allergy and inquired if they could accommodate it and she said "yes" and would let me know what dishes I could eat. Long story short, she was very busy between other tables and seating tables so I had to ask other servers passing by about the dishes to ensure they did not contain shellfish.

Somewhere along the line there had been some cross contamination as I had an allergic reaction. When I later called to speak w a manager about my frustration with the poor communication and/or execution of handling food allergies, they apologized and said there's nothing they could do but would like to offer me a free desert. 

I understand not all restaurants are able to accommodate allergies and that's not the problem as long as that expectation is set in the beginning.
Great hidden spot.  They have an excellent happy hour also. The mussels are absolutely delicious.  Pretty great wine selection also

I almost don't want to say how great our dining experience was for fear I will never get a reservation . It's small and a little hard to find but for those who persevere they will be rewarded with great food, great service and flavored that will bring you back time and time again.

The atmosphere here is top notch and the food is delicious!! Totally random, but one of my favorite things to do here is to eat the orchids that garnish the plate. First off. This restaurant taught me that orchids are even edible. But secondly I was shocked to find they actually taste really good.

More generally though, the food here is all top notch. Flavored well. Delicate and rich flavors. Good ambiance. Everything is top notch.
Food is great; tastes fresh and authentic.  The curry is amazing.  The service is great too.  The average price per dinner is about $21.

We have started to add this restaurant in to our rotation.  Most nights there are tables available but if you are with a big crowd I would suggest calling.  The food is very good.  Our favorite dishes are the spicy catfish (we get it not too spicy and it still has a kick to it), grilled salmon avocado curry (this dish is to die for and I will steal this idea of crispy grilled salmon in a green curry sauce with avocado on top and try to make it at home),  crab fried rice.  We have gone with friends who have enjoyed the pineapple rice, fried avocado, chicken satay.  I have not gone on thursday nights but they have all their bottles of wine at half price.  The restaurant is small but I like the decor and the wait staff is good.  Definitely a good addition to the neighborhood.
Great service, excellent happy hour, very nice selection of wines, and an extremely unique and inventive menu. Try the Riesling and mango shrimp.

Fabulous first experience! 

Wine is quite pricey. 

Tofu lettuce cups are yum!

Service is friendly and fast.

MUST TRY: "World Famous" spinach salad --- tempura spinach?!  YESSSSS!

Love this place. I will be back! I will be bringing friends!

I eat there all the time food is very good ... this time I decided to order to pick up .. got home the food looks horrible, dressing to the salad is definitely reused looks like a threw up . I called them and the manager was so rude and hung up on me .... I would never recommend this place to anyone that

This is hands down, our favorite local restaurant--not just for Thai food, but in general. The food is great, consistent, and the menu selection is awesome. They recently remodeled to be larger, which was a must because they used to get really cramped. It's still tight but the decor is adorable and cozy.

Menu faves: beef jerky and crab rangoons (both from the tapas), and Massaman curry.

We did not eat here so I can't rate based on food, just our experience. We stopped by on a Saturday evening unaware that reservations were needed. The hostess, while not super friendly was willing to accommodate us if we promised her we could be done in an hour. I was happy they would accommodate. Unfortunately, I have a one year old and there are no high chairs in the establishment. They clearly don't want families dining there with younger children which I found extremely disappointing. We might give it another shot for just the adults, but the experience left a bad taste in my mouth. It's also as incredibly small restaurant, on a busy night like we were there, you feel very crowded. Definitely not a romantic atmosphere when you can't enjoy a private conversation.

Cozy, Relaxing & Intimate Spot, Perfect Place To Enjoy A Glass Of Vino! 

PROS
Fried Spinach Salad With Chili Lime Dressing - YUM!  Also, the ahi tuna appetizer was delish. 

CONS
Drunkin' Noodles - Most disgusting thing I've ever tasted. Has a licorice flavor, I couldn't even finish a single bite.  

Overall, this place is great if you just avoid the drunkin noodles.
Delicious mango desert. Enjoyed lunch with frie nds. Staff is extremely friendly. Great selection of wine.

This charming restaurant has a nice ambiance and serves tasty meals. We were drawn to it, because it uses organic products.  After a day of hiking, we decided to give it a try.  Upon entering the restaurant, we felt our clothing was a bit too casual since most existing customers were dressed in business casual attire.  Nonetheless, we were greeted and received above average service. We did not have a reservation; however, due to the size of the restaurant, I would recommend making one.  The shrimp pad Thai was phenomenal!  It was the best I've ever eaten.  My husband raved about the eggplant curry, and our friend thought the basil chicken and crab fried rice were awesome.  The only reason I can't rate the restaurant as five stars is I asked the waitress to omit the egg in the shrimp pad Thai, but the meal was served with egg. Outside of that, the restaurant has great ambiance, clean restrooms and delicious food.  We have found out new favorite Thai restaurant in Vegas.  We WILL eat there again and again and again.

I love everything about this place. From the edamame appetizer to the different dishes that make my mouth water. I can't wait to go back!!! My sister found this place and when she visits we go every time.

Everything was so good. The pad Thai, bbq ribs, spinach salad (best spinach I've ever had in my life), and the pork & vegetable egg rolls were all delicious. We showed up at 9:30pm, which is 30 minutes before closing, so I can understand why the service wasn't the best. The staff was still very friendly, though.

Honestly one of the worst food experiences I have had! Ate here when it first opened and was not impressed, sub par Thai tapas. After many people telling me I have to give it a second chance, I did. Worse than the first. Yes the spinach salad was good, but you can fry a sock and it would be tasty. Got the seafood madness and that is exactly what it was. The frozen shrimp tasted like mussel and the mussel tastes like shit! The restaurant should spend less money on flower garnish and more on fresh ingredients. And that was only my meal my husbands was pretty bad too.

Unfortunately my family and I didn't get a chance to try the food. So I can only speak on the service we received from a hostess over the phone. We called to make reservations the hostess initially said no problem but after she found out we were bringing our 1yo daughter she then said that the wait would be really long and that they didn't have high chairs for children!!! (I guess they discriminate on children)Then quickly got off the phone. I will never eat at this place. If you have a family save your money and go to DW bistro where the food and service is always top notch!!!!

I went here to celebrate a friend's birthday. Didn't really know what to expect except I heard that it was fabulous. Believe me. It lived up to the hype. Absolutely delicious. Fried spinach and corn fritters are a must. Shrimp Pad Thai was one of the best I've ever had. The drunken chicken was outstanding. Highly recommend. Btw. We had reservations. It's a small (adorable) place so I'd suggest making them before hand.

We've eaten here several times as it is in our neighborhood. However, they have a strange way of turning away business. Every single time we've gone, no matter what the time, we are asked if we have reservations. We do not. We then get a very confused look and told that they are booked - when the place is empty!! I actually laughed one time & they sat us & we enjoyed a full dinner with only two other tables being sat the entire time we were there. Not going back.
This place is hands down one of the best spots in town. Visit Josh at the bar, he's the man.  #baconwrapedshrimp #catfish #springrolls

Wow! This is not a Thai restaurant, it's a Thai palace! I am originally from Vancouver BC, and this is the first time I have experienced authentic, delicious Thai food since I left that city!! And on top of it- it's a wine bar!! I was in heaven! My husband and I ordered the fried spinach which came with a spicy/fish sauce dip (delicious). It was an unexpected treat, so tasty!! Warning- it's enough for four people, so it was a big dish for the two of us! We also had a dried rib appetizer, which was very good. The big surprise was their curried avocado salmon. OMG!! Out of this world! The ambience was super cozy, clean and beautiful décor... right down to the fresh exotic flower popping out of wine crates. Very friendly, knowledgeable service. The menu was very extensive, and good wines by the glass. So excited to find this gem! Can't wait to go back, and we will be back a lot!! I LOVE Las Vegas!!!
AMAZING! When traveling you search for the accommodating bar with interested people and delicious food. You found it! This is the best thai food in Vegas
The food was outstanding - perfect really. Had never been here before and so glad we came. And the portions were very larger -- we took a lot home.
Ate here a few weeks ago for my gf's birthday. Food was amazing. Service was great. Will definitely coming again.
I enjoy this restaurant and am glad that they expanded. Be Forewarned that the website is not updated and they are CLOSED on Sundays.

Pleasantly surprised....you must try the "World Famous Spinach Salad" no other Thai restaurant has this!  I've eaten Thai food in the best city(San Francisco) and the food at Nittaya's is really that good! Try the Spicy Basil Tofu or the Seafood Curry prepared in a real coconut (my partner had this one)

Don't just take my word for it...go there you won't be disappointed.

Best Thai restaurant we have ever been to! Went three nights in a row. Tried half the menu and loved it all! 

Must have Starters: coconut soup, spinach salad, crispy pork belly, secret stickers, 

Entrees: the grilled skirt steak avocado, Pad Z-U noodles (incredible), Panang chicken curry. Wow! 

(Special mention to the wonderful servers. So thoughtful and helpful. 5-star service too. 

Prices are excellent. You can't go wrong.

This place is really hit or miss.  

My friends and I were invited by John's uncle.  And he even told us this place was really hit or miss.  

And we ordered a lot of different tapas.  I mean, it's a tapas place.  You've got a large group of people.  So of course you're going to order a lot of different dishes.

So we got the fried tofu, the fried avocado, the summerlin rolls (chicken), the fire cracker prawns, the steamed mussels, the famous spinach salad and some salmon dish that I don't see on the menu now.  What was interesting.  The spinach salad was really interesting.  It's like tempura spinach with a dipping sauce on the side.  Really unique taste.  And I've never had crunchy potato-chip like spinach.  So it's pretty fun to eat.  The mussels weren't bad.  The sauce it was cooked in was a little bland but the mussels were perfectly cooked.  Fried tofu is good.  But I love fried tofu.  But then again, the fired tofu's not amazing.  The fried avocado is different.  Not bad.  Never had fried avocado so if you like avocado-I definitely recommend it.  The salmon dish was possibly the best thing we had.  Excellent.  Made me wonder if ordering tapas might have been the wrong way to go.  So what was terrible?  The summerlin rolls.  Garbarge.  The fire cracker prawns, almost tasteless.  Pricey.  Worth it?  Meh.  Food wasn't bad but I wouldn't go back.  Too many misses and not enough hits.

This is one of the best kept secrets in Las Vegas.  The spinach salad is unique as it is fried in tempura batter and served with a cashew dipping sauce that will knock your socks off!  Im going back here!

Cute little spot! Rustic winery feel. Very friendly wait staff that checked on us frequently.  We shared a few plates so we can try a variety and we all thought the boat noodle was a little too salty. But the red curry was delicious! Also the sauce for the spinach chips and the raw shrimp was very flavorful. Would definitely return and recommend!

I research asian restaurant by Rampart and Lake Mead in the internet because its close to where I live and I'm craving for Asian food and Nittayas Thai Restaurant pop up and read good reviews from yelp. I went tonight and when I came in, the restaurant is full and the place is so small....I wish it is bigger....So I end up sitting in the bar...While looking at the menu, they only have list for wines, liquor and beers for drinks..I order Home Style Shrimp Pad Thai, it tastes okey and this place is expensive...Definitely not coming back....Archis Thai taste better :)

My mom was overly jovial when we left the restaurant and this is a rare sight to see. The service was quaint, cute and on-point.  The food also delicious of course. Attention to detail, cleanliness and relaxed atmosphere.... I would undoubtedly recommend

Our favorite hidden local gem! We love the bar service and date nights at Nittaya's. You know this place is good because I once called for a reservation and Nittaya herself answered the phone! Thanks for the delicious food and wine pairings!
Great food, excellent Service  ... LOVE it So much, specially I like avocado salmon curry , it's really wonderful, and for the appetizer I would recommend spinach salad or beaconed shrimps

This quaint place has the perfect small RESTURANT atmosphere
Food was excellent too

This is absolutely hands down the best Thai place in Las Vegas. If you know Vegas you'll know that means something. While the location is in Summerlin and a bit of a drive from the Strip, I promise that it is totally worth the drive.

The decor is chic, contemporary and service impeccable. I come for both lunch and dinner and it's always extraordinary. My favorite things to devour here is a long list but take note you'll want to try every thing.

So here it goes:  Coconut soup, citrus steak salad, papaya salad, shrimp pad Thai, crying tiger steak, drunken noodles, cashew shrimp, catfish, eggplant, FOB rice, the beignets, Thai donuts and creme brûlée. I'm sure I missed a ton of other things but trust me when I tell you, you will be back.

LOVE THIS PLACE!
Best Thai I ever had , lamb chops delicious, crispy spinach brilliant , service excellent, will be back

Everything  I read about the place was true, small, intimate,  beautiful artwork, just fun.
The food all was so delicious except the sa uce that went withe Ribeye too salty.  Other than that Awesome I will go again & again till I have tried everything!
Thank you for a great time guys!
This is a restaurant I wish I could keep Secret!  VERY GOOD food! Small, quant and a di-lish neighborhood dining establishment. Always take out of towers here! A+

Worst customer service experience ever!!
My sister and i went to have lunch here, everything was good, server was good. But one of the lunch specials tasted off, the chicken tasted almost not fully cooked. We told the server, and he acted weird about it. We didn't have time to wait for anything else, and had a two year old. 
And not to mention, he offered us to have dessert like in replacement for the meal. During us explaining to him our issue... He was never sympathetic or tried to say sorry about what had happen.. I'm sorry but if chicken doesn't have a right texture I won't eat it nor will I give it to my 2 year old son. So I sent it back.. Never was asked to remake it... Nothing was said ... Just if we wanted anything else or the dessert.. I get the bill & I'm still being charged for the whole meal... So I walk in there to ask why I'm still being charged for something I didn't touch and he tells me that "there is no return policy" "it was still made" "the chef tasted it and said its fine" so I walk out feeling very frustrated.... & my sister goes in from the patio to talk to a manager.. She was so rude!!! She said she would not take it off the bill what so ever and that the chef tasted it and it's fine... & if we want they can box it up for us ! WHAT? After your chef tasted our food and I just told you the chicken wasn't right! We will never come back ever again! I had this dish before here and I know this one wasn't right. And the server should think about how he handles his customer problems and maybe find a different job because now it's hurting him. So here's your warning... If it doesn't come out right, they simply don't care....

Greatest sliced poke tuna lunch salad I have ever had before. Luckily my friend Ernie took me there after he tool me what criminals health plan of Nevada and united Healthcare was and had me enjoy one of the best lunches of the year. Kudos to nattayas and thanks.

Very good Thai food. Slightly differs from a traditional Thai menu but in a delightful way. After hearing about this place for years, I finally tried the secret Thai kitchen and was not disappointed. Our waitress recommended the "favorites" fried spinach salad and secret dumplings as starters. We tried both, I would not get the spinach salad again. Each piece of spinach is deep-fried although the lime vinaigrette is tasty this was extremely heavy and not my thing. The dumplings were OK but I probably would try something different next time as well. However we did order the chicken lettuce wraps and they were so flavorful and fresh definite must for next time. For Main's we got the Panang chicken curry and the rain forest  rice both were knockouts! The curry was light and flavorful slightly spicy and creamy. We will be returning here again!

This is my FAVORITE Thai restaurant. If you are looking for some amazing Tapas and Wine, this is the place to be. Highly recommend their worlds best spinach salad, served with an awesome sauce with chicken and cashews (can be substituted with tofu for the veggie lovers) Some great veggie tapas choices are golden pouches and curry puffs. My husband loves their Phuket poppers, with shrimp jalapeños and cream cheese. The main course has all the traditional Thai curries, very good portions. I ordered spicy basil tofu and it was excellent. 
Every Thursday they do half price wine by the bottle. They have a select menu to choose from and has a really good selection of wines. You can get a nice bottle of Chardonnay (original price $36 for $18!!) it's a steal. 
The service is always awesome. For extra heat I request their Thai chilies which the staff is happy to serve.

You must try Nattaya's, and give your usual restaurant hautes a break.  This is for the guys, if you want to impress your wife, first date or someone really special, take them to Nattaya's.  

You'll feel you're at an exclusive establishment, and only you and a few friends were invited.  The food is amazing, so work your way through the menu as I have on three visits.  The staff is very professional and polite.

It is what dining should be, relaxed, inviting and not forced.   You will lose track of time there, best dining experience I've had in years.
Spinach salad is a must try. That alone should make anyone a "return customer". But give the menu a shot.
Loved this place so much- great local little hideaway with great food, excellent presentation and great service. We will definitely be back!

Im not sure if they're thinking or can afford to upgrade to second or larger location but typically when I review a good place, their business booms and they go crazy with fortune

This secret is mine.  Can't tell you about it.  Shhhhhh 

It's just a really nice Thai restaurant 

888

Amazing Thai food, had the shrimp with red curry and it was delicious. Also i tried the papaya salad and crab fried rice garlic ademame and curry potatoes dumpling everything was excellent and we will be back.

This is a great place to come have some wine and food during Happy Hour, the atmosphere is great, I loved this place the decor is perfect and the Wine & Thai mix theme very interesting concept unique place for sure, I will be visiting again soon for Happy Hour

This place is AMAZING!!! The food is out of this world! Every dish is bursting with flavor and the presentation is awesome! I love how small and quaint the restaurant is! I love the ambiance! The staff is very friendly! This place is definitely a hidden gem here in Las Vegas! Must try the Famous Spinach Salad!! I love the sangria! This was my third time here and it was just as amazing as the first time! I can't wait to go back!

Nittaya's is a great neighborhood Thai restaurant that's cozy with delicious food! My friend and I went for her birthday and ordered alllll the food bc we are hungry little monsters. We got the fried spinach thingy, calamari, emerald fried rice, and pad see ew. BETWEEN 2 PEOPLE. I know, girls can throw it down. 

The deep fried spinach thing as interesting but delicious. It's literally deep fried spinach. They deep fry each leaf. EACH LEAF. How long does that take? Sheesh. Anyways anything deep fried is delicious so this is an A+ in my book. Would I eat it every day? Probably not, my family has a history or heart disease and diabetes. Would I get it maybe 1x every 2 months? Hell yes. 

Calamari also deep fried. So can't go wrong. Pad see ew, is the same as every other Thai place. Can't go wrong ordering this either. Out of everything, I probably wouldn't order the emerald fried rice again. I mean it was good, but it just kinda seemed like green curry with rice but without the saucy part. Does that make sense? Like why would I order this when I can just order the green curry, is what I'm saying. 

Anyhow, other than the waiters constantly trying to take our food away, it was a delight like always!

Food: Food was wonderful, the curry we tried was the green curry Avocado with Rib eye steak, and the  tapas has a different  take on thai food. The crispy spinach was good, the dip made a huge difference  on the dish. The calamare and the ribs that we got from the tapas were savory.

Ambiance: The decor and how the place is arranged in a way that creates a cozy dining experience. The restrooms are very clean. Definitely do a reservation before dining at nittaya's. They have a bar which is good for get togethers after work, and also has al fresco dining. 

Service: Service is pretty good, the waitress was very knowledgable in the foods that are popular in the menu. If you like thai food, definitely try this place out. It is Nittaya's Secret Kitchen after all.

Super cute place. Have lived in this neighborhood my whole life and wish I found it sooner. Very intimate. Would love to come back and do a date night on Thursday when wine bottles are half off. Kinda pricey other than that no complaints. Had the drunken noodles soo good!

This was such a tasty place, with really nice ambience. The massaman curry was fantastic, the best I've ever had. We also tried the Thai donuts with rum caramel sauce and homemade coconut ice cream. Both delicious:)

If you just walk in, you wouldn't know this is a Thai restaurant.  You would think a wine bar with it's decor.  We walked in and there wasn't anyone to greet us, though we entered during an off hour.  There was one table that had guests waiting for their food.  

We had the crab fried rice, chunks of crab meat all over, not salty at all and full of flavor.  It wasn't dry either which was a bonus.

The pad thai was not the variety with ketchup or very little ketchup so it was very welcomed.  I don't tend to like ones that are on the sweeter end, I prefer this one which is browner on for the noodles.  Very enjoyable.

Asked for water, it's infused so bonus!
Excellent....the garlic edamame was fantastic.  Kale salad was a first and I loved it. Everything was so fresh and cooked perfectly.

The food honestly looked extremely promising and my friends and I were so excited to come and dine in for our first times. Judging by the other reviews and word of mouth from friends and family, the food is absolutely amazing. Unfortunately after being seated and told by the server that he would be right back, we never encountered  another colleague again. 

Maybe it was because we chose to be seated outside but several other guests who were seated outside well after us received their waters and menus immediately whereas we only received the menus from the hostess who sat us. Our server was nowhere to be found and when he eventually came out, he proceeded to provide service to another couple that had just sat down. 

It is a shame that we were not able to taste the food, but the lack of attention and bad service quality were too much to bear for us. After 15 minutes of waiting and even as we walked out of the restaurant, not one service person batted an eye. 

I am sure this restaurant will continue to be successful but I don't feel inclined to return if this is the type of treatment that even only a small percentage of guests will receive.

First look, it's a nice cute cozy little place. Feel nothing like your regular Thai restaurant. More relax. Staff are really nice, informative. 

We ordered fried Spinach tempura salad. The sauce that comes with it makes it awesome and balancing the tempura taste. 

We dined for two. So we ordered "Crying Tiger"-ribeye charbroiled then sliced up with this Thai amazing sauce. Also Thai Basil Chicken, this is a Thai style, uses ground chicken. Portions are generous. If you like to try something new, order the garlic rice to go with your entree!

I can make this really easy: if you like P.F. Chang's, you'll like this place. It's good food, don't get me wrong, but it's not stand-out. The place is really small and we had to eat at the bar, no biggie, but it filled up quickly and we were lucky to have gotten seats. Make reservations if you want to try it out!

My fiancé seemed to enjoy this place much more than me, and she holds it in a higher regard than P.F. Chang's for sure. 

I ordered my meal 5/5 spicy, and extra spicy if he could do it. To me, not spicy at all. My lady took one taste and started coughing and downing water. Sooo...depending on your tolerance level.

I ordered the Panang Curry with chicken instead of shrimp, flavor was pretty good. I also got the spicy chicken fried rice. Also tasted pretty good. But like I said, it was just P.F. Chang's quality, nothing special. 

Definitely lost a star for being as expensive as it was given the food quality, but it'd be a solid 4 if the food came up a bit or the price went down.
By far one of the best food experiences I have had in a long time.  The food was spectacular!

I had the fried avocado, steak skewers, chicken satay skewers, a shrimp tapas, pork pot stickers and shishito peppers. Everything was delicious, but I could have done without the pot stickers since they were nothing special, but they were well-made if you like them.

I came in here thinking it was just a good Thai place to stop by for a quick lunch, but was surprised to see that it was more of a classy establishment. I considered leaving due to time, but I'm glad that I stayed and will come back again to try the rest of the tapas menu and the entrees. 

Yummy!

While staying in Summerlin over the summer on our last night in town we discovered Nittaya Secret Kitchen Thai restaurant. What a fabulous find. This is the best Thai that I have had in a long time. We had the Coconut Seafood curry and the Drunken Noodles with chicken. Both excellent. It's a really nice restaurant, the service was terrific and the waiters were great. We will definitely be back.
Just love this place. Consistently excellent food. We had the spinach salad the drunken noodles and the Penang shrimp. All delicious. Best Thai in town

We eat here on a regular basis.  The food is ALWAYS outstanding.  The service is ALWAYS outstanding.  The wine is great as is the ambiance.  These are all the reasons why we are regulars. Some highlights:  the tempura spinach salad is a must!  The green curry salmon or steak is amazing and not something you'll find anywhere. Glass noodle salad is great.  All the rice dishes are very good. Lamb chops are to die for!  Basil chicken is another great dish. Too many to list. The only disappointment is that Nittaya does not come out of the kitchen. We've been coming here for years and we don't know her. Otherwise amazing place. Need a reservation in advance, especially on a Thursday, Friday or Saturday.

One of the best experience I had with all the restaurants I have ever been in Las Vegas.

Tempura Spinach Salad was the so good, when you eat them, you want to order another.

The best item of the night was the dessert, home made coconut ice cream, the dessert was served in a whole young coconut shell, warm sticky rice inside of the coconut, home made ice cream on top to melt into the rice. The creaminess of the ice cream and the chewiness of the rice was the perfect mixture of texture and feelings  The ice cream was also the most expensive item of the night. But I think it was totally worth it.

My friends and I decided to try this place out tonight. I thought it must be bigger at first when we arrived, because the parking lot was 2/3rds full. So while we're waiting for our 3rd, we step inside and see a podium that isn't being manned. The place looked cramped, and they had a table everywhere trying to maximize the space. So I looked around real quick, there's no one ready to step up to the podium. Someone is performing bus boy duties 3 feet away from us at a table, but he can't even look up to us. So, turning around to see the bar tender, she makes eye contact and then wanders down to the farthest point of the bar, away from the door. The two of us stood there for close to 5 minutes, and actually turned around to leave when we were boxed in by 2 more customers coming in the door. Now the podium is right in front of the door, and there's a table in-between the bar and the wall, so there is no where to go. 4 people at the front, and the area is so small, we can't even shut the door. 
Finally, the bus boy walks into the back, and our waitress/hostess finally comes up and asks who was first. My friend and I took her attention and asked to sit outside while we wait for our 3rd to show. A table we wanted outside was unmanned when we arrived, but had yet to be cleared off. She said it'd be 3 or 4 minutes for them to clear, and so offered to step out to wait. After those 4 minutes, she brought us a menu to look at, but the table still wasn't cleared. (I really hope they had half the crew call in or something, because she was all over the place.) After dropping off the menu, the waitress/host steps back inside; finally coming out a few minutes later to clear the table herself as the guy who was performing bus boy duties before is now nowhere to be seen. So she tells us the table is ready, and we take a seat. 
Our 3rd person shows up right after the waitress brings us water, and then we waited. And waited. About 15 minutes have gone by, we've all looked at the menu 3 times, and she finally comes back and asks if we wanted drinks. So, not to miss out again, we place our drink and meal orders all at once. And then it seemed like ground hog's day, because we waited some more. And more. Almost 10 minutes later, the other 2 with me get their meals, which was surprisingly quick for meal prep considering how slow everything else had been. About a minute after that, the bus boy finally makes another appearance by trying to give our 3 beverages to the couple sitting next to us (who are almost done already, mind you). And then we waited some more. I still haven't gotten my food. My friends and I have been talking for about 5 minutes now, and I still don't have my food. I finally tell them to start without me, and then after nearly another 5 minutes, my meal finally arrived. 
Now, I have to say, the meal was awesome. The dish presentation was on point, and the food tasted better than it looked. But for the 3 of us there that night, only one of us got rice with our meals, even though the menu showed all of them coming with it. And once you start eating hot, you burn through your drinks, so they couldn't get refilled fast enough. Our latecomer to dinner mentioned her curry was much hotter than the menu suggested, and mine was as well (luckily, I prefer hotter.) We ended up being there for over an hour and a half, and once we finally got our rice, we had to get up from the table to ask for drink refills after about half an hour had passed without an employee in sight. 
We finally got to see our waitress come by again at closing, and she asked if we wanted any deserts. We declined and just asked for our check, and then we saw her right back. Not surprisingly, they're making a mad dash now to close the place down. We had our bills inside of two minutes, and before she can turn around, we put our cards in and handed them right back. The bus boy decided it was time to make another appearance, and he starts clearing off the cushions from all the outside furniture while we're waiting for the cards to be processed. We chatted for another minute or two after signing our receipts, and you can see he's getting impatient for us to go so they can clear the table and snatch off the tablecloth. I quietly suggested to our friends we should go, and before we can step off the sidewalk to the parking lot, the table is cleared of all remnants and he's back inside the door. 
All in all, the food was amazing. But as I hopped back into my jeep for the short drive home, I was relieved I came here with friends inside of bringing a date. I can't say it's a place I'll ever go back to unless they decided to move to a bigger location and hire some more staff to help.

I do love this place, the flavor, the service, the interior decorations except it's really salty and on greasy side for me.   I am assuming most restaurants are like this unless I request other wise.  But the reason for the 3 star is because this is also not authentic enough.  The dishes are on sweeter side.

The restaurant is rather small and constricted in space for the tables but we managed to squeeze in one of those side tables but another customers chairback was right up against mine.
The menu resembled a clipboard with a number of papers attached. Half the menu was dedicated to the food and half  dedicated to wines.
our interests were focused on the Chinese dishes advertised and those were presented as tapas rather than like dim sum which in a Chinese restaurant they would've been.
