We ended up having three tapas plates and one entrée dish. Each of the Tapas plates were tasty and imaginative. The entrée was a smartly presented dish of fried rice with pineapple chicken onions and cashew nuts.
I think the key to the Tapas dishes is to make sure you have the proper sauces to accompany it with. In most cases, the default sauce worked well but I would recommend asking them for whatever other kinds of sauces you happen to prefer like a soy sauce or a hot sauce.
The entrée dish was a pineapple fried rice with chicken onions and cashew nuts. The dish was presented in a pineapple half shell which allowed you to take it home and eat the remaining Fried rice and cut some additional pineapple from the edge. My wife loved it.
in closing, I would recommend coming early because it appears to be a very popular nighttime get together place. It's a little pricey with each of the Topos dishes being about $10 each and the entrées between 11 and $18. I will be coming again!

Ask for Dante Marcy, he's an adult blonde male. He will service you so good and hard you'll be begging for more. We once toured the Italian countryside together sharing wines and cheeses as we sunned ourselves along Tuscan country roads. But what is sweet in life is fleeting and impermanent. Such Is life. He soon grew tired of me in favor of his lover Pablo and I was cast aside like day old scones in Vatican City. Heartbroken as I am I would still request him by name to wait on me and fondle my taste buds into a world of ecstasy so rapturous and sinful even the most hedonic among us would blush. Tip him generously, but as you do whisper the name Juan Pablo.

It's for me, the best thai restaurant I've been to here in Las Vegas. So many thai restaurants in town but this one is so good. Very cute and cozy,  more expensive than the other thai places in town but who cares when the food is delicious?....I don't care to pay more if the food is worth it.
My boyfriend and I got the fried rice which was absolutely wonderful, very tasty and not greasy! and also the shrimp curry and their awesome pad thai......They served water infused with fruit which was uhm uhm uhm...This is like a gourmet thai restaurant so don't expect big portions. I looove this place!
Loved the beef jerky and the Spinach salad!  Great lunch specials too.

The reviews don't lie! I came here for lunch with friends and we shared the following:
-crab fried rice (not my favorite among the dishes, we didn't even finish half of it)
-drunken noodles chicken (yumm!)
-chili basil chicken (the best!)
appetizers were spare ribs (waiter suggested this but there was barely any meat and I just didn't like it) and the fried tempura spinach (who would ever think this could be so good!)
-homemade coconut ice cream-wonderful
-lemongrass creme brûlée-could barely taste the lemongrass and it was too thick
 Service was great. The inside is very dark and I highly suggest not sitting by the door like we did. I was blinded by light every 3 minutes and someone entered and exited.

I unexpectedly found this place on yelp, I didn't know what to expect but I was optimistic. As I entered it was a quaint and cozy place. The staff was very accommodating and friendly. I ordered the tempora style spinach, ( not sure of the name) but it was absolutely amazing, crisp and delicious the sauce was to die for. I also ordered the basil rice and the Mah Thai rice which was also delicious. It's seldom I give anyplace top billing, but if you like great service, delicious food at a reasonable price... this is your place. Bon appetite!!!!
Expensive but really good! Go there for happy hour so you can experience their cuisine without breaking your wallet. Spinach salad is an absolute must.

Spectacular Thai food. It definitely beats the hell out of Lotus of Siam. And the wine selection is superb too, specifically the Pinot Grigio by the glass. The Panang Shrimp dish was super. Ordered it at five, which is their spiciest level, and Nittaya certainly delivered. The chicken satay was excellent too. Great Thai food in Summerlin is always fantastic to find.  Highly recommended.

Upscale Thai food 

I must admit that this place appeals to me from the outside alone. It's a great way to set the mood and prepare you for what's about to take place inside. 

The decor is beautiful and I'm the type of person who really appreciates the little details like fresh flowers at each table and complimentary infused water.

The food is fantastic, packed with bold flavors. I'm a big fan of the sweet & sour coconut soup, pineapple fried rice served in an actual pineapple and the famous spinach salad! I could drink the dipping sauce straight for the salad! I also appreciate that every dish is so beautifully prepared. 

Prices are higher here and of course you could get cheaper Thai food but no other Thai place looks like this one. It's about the overall experience here and it's a great one.
Awesome dishes and consistent everytime!  Service is impeccable plus the restaurant is decorated tastefully!!  Make sure to make reservations for dinner on weekends.
This is a good Thai restaurant. Prices are on the high side.  They serve  dinner only and are not open late. The menu is limited.
Nice, small, cozy place. Has dinning room seating as well as a bar. Food is fantastic with good portions as well as good service.

Went out of their way to set up outside seating for us since we had our puppy with us. The food was on point. You pay for what you get. The servings were large, spice level was perfect, and everything tasted fresh. Servers were incredibly friendly. We would definitely come back.
We ordered a few apps and the drunken noodles. All were so yummy. Perfect amount of spice! Service was great and the atmosphere is so cute and quaint. I'll definitely be coming back!
As usual the best or nothing, first time at lunch and what a great deal. Had the green curry chicken salad and appetizer $11 I'm happy!

Fantastic food, great wine list, exceptionally priced and nice ambiance.  The portions are nicely sized, ingredients are fresh and the variety of choices is not overwhelming but enough to satisfy anyone's pallet.  The restaurant and bathroom were clean which usually means the kitchen is too. The staff was very friendly but not pushy, they weren't constantly checking to see if we needed more wine but stopped by enough to check and refill our glasses.  By the way if you like wine with your meals this place is great because that's all the serve not hard liquors or beer.  Would definitely go back again but make sure you reserve your table, they're a busy restaurant and you could end up waiting for a one.
This is my new favorite Thai place.  Everything was great including the service.  I will definitely be back!
Great for lunch! They make a delicious green curry. Their fried spinach salad is absolutely delicious. Just don't expect authentic Thai food, this very modern and Americanized.

Ate here for the first time yesterday.  Service was prompt, got seated immediately for lunch.  It was a typically hot Vegas day, and they never let my water glass get empty. Food was excellent.  I'm a wimp about spicy foods, so I was pleased to find lots of non-spicy selections on their menu. I had pot stickers - done perfectly, and served with a delicious sauce.  Then came the chicken fried rice, also delicious.  I finished up with a chocolate mousse dessert the called Pot of Cream.  I'll definitely be back, and plan to bring friends.

This is a fancy Thai restaurant.
We love the spinach salad!!
And the pad Thai . The atmosphere is nice welcoming . It's very crowed and a little small but other than that the food was pretty good .

I am a big fans of Thai foods . I was a regular customer in one of Thai restaurant around the corner for years . But since I found this restaurant I have been coming here . The foods are so good , place is clean and the staff are friendly

Very unique and tasty dishes! I love that they have tapas! The Tamarind Shrimp was awesome and presentation is great! We also ordered the Drunken Noodles, Beef Jerky, Garlic Spare Ribs and the Bacon Wrapped Shrimp. NOTHING disappointed!

This place was perfect in every way.  The service was the best service I've received in a long time. The  fried spinach salad is a must!  It is a smaller restaurant but I really liked that about this place. I'm sure on a busy night it's a wait to be seated but I don't mind..  I'll be eating here a lot more!

My husband found this great Thai place in our new neighborhood.  The atmosphere is cozy and service was impressive.  I really enjoyed the eggplant with basil and the Pad Z U was tasty.  The portions were large, so great to share.
Food is amazing. Atmosphere is amazing. Customer service is amazing 5 stars all the way... best pad Thai in Las Vegas... the ahi appetizers are to die for

This is a very comfortable, upscale, Thai restaurant. Decor and environment are nice. Wait staff is excellent. Food in general is quite good.  

We visited this place last nite. For a party of three, we ordered the following dishes:

Spinach tempura salad - great idea. Dipping sauce is excellent. Grade A. $11 each.
Volcano shrimp is excellent. Grade A. $12.
Avocado skirt steak is super. Meat is slighly over cooked. Grade A-. $24 each.
Crab Fried Rice is the best I have had. Grade A+. $15.
Shrimp Pad Thai is OK - shrimp is overcooked, not tasty. Pad Thai is too saucy and spongy ( over cooked ).  Grade B-.  $19. 

Pricing for this restaurant is on the high side. Can't really compare to the ordinary Thai restaurant.
Very good shrimp pad Thai. I'll be coming back. Nice atmosphere. Would be a nice date spot.

The "Not So Secret Salad" is one of my favorite salads in town! It's more of an interpretation than an actual salad, but I don't let that pesky detail get in the way. The dish is tempura-fried spinach leaves with a sweet-and-spicy dressing slash dipping sauce. You can dip the leaves as you go and eat it like nachos, or dump on the dressing and attempt to use a fork. Either way, your taste buds will be quite delighted. You can share this as an app or order it as your main, like I do.

Nittaya's Secret Kitchen has $11 lunch specials that include a salad and potsticker, as well as a Happy Hour (Mon-Thurs, 3-6PM). The Not So Secret Salad is also $11 though, so I find myself ordering that instead of branching out to try new things.

Small neighborhood place, classy décor and local art, lots of wines available. They have a small section of patio seating, and some day I'll actually try something else on the menu.

Really nice cozy place... The food was delicious and better than a typical Thai place, it felt more upscale and you can taste higher quality ingredients in the food.  The place has wine and beer also.  The service was nice and the waiter was pleasant.  The fruit infused water is a nice touch.  Definitely will be back!

I came to Nittaya's for a quick meal on a Friday night. We chose to sit outside on the patio & it was like out of sight out of mind because the service was painfully slow!  After 20 minutes I went inside to complain & it took another 10 minutes after that to be served! The inside was not even full & the service was so slow. The food was good but the service was so lacking I doubt I will be back!

Love this little local restaurant. Low key, great ambience. I love the appetizers. Pretty good wine not a huge selection but this isn't a huge place. Perfect way to end a date night. We have only done the bar experience but we found this is the perfect way to start or end a evening. 
I personally don't care for Thai food ( in general)but the BF loves it, and he enjoyed his entree there. As I said the Appetizers were wonderful
The best Thai food in Las Vegas. Food is excellent, service is excellent, and the decor is classy.

The service was exceptional. 
The food was okay, nothing special. It is pricey.
Good decor and ambiance.

We had the lunch specials which came with a vegetarian dumpling and small salad with house dressing. Both were good.

Our Lunch Specials:

Drunken Noodle, chicken: Good
Pineapple fried rice, chicken: Good
Cashew Chicken: Below average

We stopped in for Lunch on a Sunday. Nittaya's has a Nice atmosphere and pleasant knowledgable servers. On our first visit We tried Thai egg rolls, citrus steak salad, home style shrimp pad Thai, each delicious! 

Update: I've been to Nittaya's multiple times, although today was the worst! We stopped in for lunch on a Monday at 2:30pm. 
My main dish- Combo Pad Thai off the full menu not the lunch special arrived with egg ( I ordered without/ allergic) so..I sent it back, of course! (The exact thing happened on my last visit to Nittaya's as well). Both times my server didn't notice,  I had to point it out:( When my food finally arrived my husband and daughter were finished with their lunches! I also asked for a 4 out of 5 on the heat ( my dish arrived with no heat).
The most upsetting part: place was empty- not busy at all! 
No apologies
Paid full price 
Last visit!

Generally, I find the trend of fusion restaurants to be an empty fad.  Most of the time, one restaurant blending two culinary traditions simply fails at both of them, rather than creating something interesting.

So I walked into Nittaya's Secret Kitchen, which offers a fusion of tapas and Thai foods, with a heavy bias.  But I left pleasantly surprised because Nittaya's has mastered the art of juggling -- offering a wonderful selection of Thai and tapas fusion dishes that are often better than what you'd find in Thai or tapas restaurant.  

When we were there, we had the fried avocado for an appetizer.  It's the only time I've ever used the terms "airy" and "fried" to describe the same dish, but it really was an inventive combination with the delightful fried crispy shell surrounding the soft tastiness of a fresh avocado.  If you head over there, I'd put the fried avocado on your "must have" list.  

We also ordered the spinach salad, which was tasty, but not quite as magical as the fried avocado.  The spinach salad also comes with fried spinach leaves, which are tasteless on their own.  But dip the fried spinach leaves in the sweet cashew sauce provided on the side and it's fairly tasty.  A distant second to that lovely avocado, but creative in its own right.

For the mean course, we stuck with a more traditional Thai and ordered the red curry with chicken.  And kudos to Nittaya's for not dialing back the spice.  The red curry was spicier that I was expecting and super flavorful.  And they treat the ingredients right.  The vegetables?  Cooked and crisp.  The chicken?  Tender.  And they didn't skimp on the vegetables in the curry.

All in all, one of the better Thai places I've eaten in Vegas.  The prices are a little steep, but creativity doesn't come cheap in culinary land.

4.5 stars overall.

There's a reason why they take dinner reservations, this place is tiny. Also it's not very well laid-out. The food was ok, my dinner companions and I decided to do tapas but it took a very long time to get everything we ordered. Twice they sent us the wrong plates (figuring it's such a small place, it should have been easier to get out order correct!) and twice we had to remind out server what we were still waiting for. Gauging the value of the meal by balancing out service and atmosphere vs price leads me to conclude that I'll not be making another visit here.
Great service, awesome value lunch menu for 11 dollars with salad, potsticker and entree, red curry beyond amazing!  The best Thai in Las Vegas!

My measuring post for whether I return to a Thai restaurant is the Green Curry, so I ordered that as a lunch special. I found Nattaya's green curry chicken to be delicious, with a hint of spiciness, though not at all overwhelming. And here's the kicker...like many Thai restaurants, Nattaya uses ample bamboo shoots in their version, but like very few, they cook it in a way so as not to distract from the rest of the dish. Delicious!

All in all, I enjoyed my lunch, which also included a refreshing house salad and potsticker as part of the special. Their wait staff was very attentive and friendly, and this surely enhanced my dining experience. Will I be back - absolutely. Now that Nattaya has made me a believer with their Green Curry, I'm ready to explore the rest of the seemingly delectable menu, which includes ample "small plates" by the way.

My boyfriend and I drive to Vegas from Phoenix to eat here - often. Granted we're there to visit friends and stuff too but like, look guys: come with us to Nittaya's or get wrecked because we're going. 

The atmosphere is fantastic. It's a quiet place with low lighting and friendly staff. Basically everything I'm looking for in a restaurant. Loud, bustling, bright places are fine but I have to be in the mood to interact with large groups of people. The only thing worse than people is large groups of them, amirite?

No words I can say will do the food any justice. You just need to try it. Any of it, all of it. Each dish brought to you has a quality that is indicative of the fact that the person who created the dish loves to cook. Their passion for cooking shines through this food in a way that's enjoyable in and of itself. There's a profound joy in taking part in a thing that someone clearly loves, and this is the place to experience that. 

I really hope this restaurant is doing and continues to do well.

I went to Nittayas Secret Kitchen for tapas and drinks last evening.  It was truly a delightful experience from start to finish.  We were seated immediately upon arrival at the restaurant and were treated with respect by all members of staff.  It was clear that customer service is a huge priority for the employees at this establishment. 

In regards to the food, the crab wantons were incredible. They were perfectly crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. A great suggestion from our waitress. Also, the Bangkok Fried Rice was an incredible addition as well. It had an excellent combination of savory flavors.  

I would highly recommend Nittayas Secret Kitchen and will absolutely be back.

Great food! Great service! Great decor! Love this little gem.  Cozy and refreshing. Beautiful and simple. Nittaya takes great care of this restaurant and all the details. I felt comfortable here, no snootiness. Fresh flowers inside and as some beautiful well plated designs. A nice small patio. Feels like a romantic escape. Very flavorful food, great use of spices. All the servers were kind, helpful, and attentive. I will be back for sure!!!! :) 

I had the 5 Spiced Ribs, the World Famous Spinach Salad, a Thai tea, a Lucky Budha, and a water infused with stawberries and oranges. Can't wait to come back and try more.

Met some friends here on a Tuesday night when I was in Vegas (the restaurant is located in Summerlin, NW of the strip) & it was quite busy.  We made reservations and they are definitely recommended because seating is limited.  I had the tofu pad thai, spicy edamame, fried tofu & veggie pot stickers which were all spectacular!  The flavors were excellent, service was on point (considering how busy it was) & ambiance is definitely upscale.  

Definitely a worthwhile trip--good thai is hard to find in Vegas!

Nittaya's is the best Thai restaurant in Las Vegas.  I highly recommend this place.  I not only love the food, but the atmosphere is fantastic.  There is also a great Wine list.   My favorite dish is the Green Curry Salmon with egg plant and avocado.  Delicious!!! Crying Tiger steak is likewise fantastic.  Service is right there anticipating you needs.
Great Pad Thai, lettuce wraps, and pad See ew. All in all a delicious restaurant with great service hidden in a little strip mall.

Great place.

Excellent staff and service.
Cold cold STELLA beer!
Tasty dishes - all very yummy.
Great atmosphere
Highly recommend 
Go every week
So many amazing APPs....try them ALL!
PS - coconut ice cream is to DIE for!

We discovered Nittaya's about 6 months ago when we moved to Summerlin. We have been here 6 times since (would be more but we have small children) and every single time it has been outstanding! The atmosphere is more for date nights. It's a small, romantic and intimate setting not very ideal for bringing small children but we have! Our favorite items are the braised short rib curry, the avocado salmon curry and the whole coconut seafood curry. ALL outstanding. The secret potstickers and mussels on the appetizer menu are equally delicious. They have a 1-5 spice level you can request which is amazing because we love spicy thai food. Level 4 is perfect. You can sample different wines before purchasing which makes it nice. The menu is priced accordingly. If you want crap Thai food you'll pay cheaper prices for it. At Nittaya's, you get what you pay for! It is beyond extraordinary. We would come here a lot more if we could afford to, believe me. It's definitely a treat to come at least once a month for us. We are fortunate that we live so close. IF you don't live that close, it is worth the trip! Definitely make reservations on weekends because it gets busy. We have been fortunate not ever to wait too long for a table though. Service also is outstanding. Their infused water is so good. I can't say one thing that needs improvement here. Love it love it love it!!!!!

Food was not fresh, over seasoned, loaded with salt and with MSG, not authentic Thai food. This is American Thai restaurant. Look around you don't see Thai people eating here.

We ordered drunken noodle and cashew chicken. Cashew chicken does not even taste like cashew chicken. Not even a cashew in sight.  Flavors were off and had to ask waiter where was the cashew in the cashew chicken. Ask why cashew chicken does not taste like cashew chicken. Waiter said this is how cashew chicken taste like here. Major dehydration afterwards. Prepare to drink lots of water.


Ask waiter how much it was to substitute shrimp for chicken.  He said 2 to 3 dollars. End up paying more than three dollars to substitute the meat. Asked him why it was over three dollars( despite asking him in advance )he said it could be anything. 

I guess you should have him write it down on paper before substituting any type of meat here. They will charge you whatever they feel like. Don't come here if you don't want to get rip off for unauthentic Thai food and overpay.
It was so good. I will be back again and again. I have anointed this place as my LV Thai spot. I have been looking for my go to and I got it.

Everytime I go here, it never disappoints!!  The "Spinach Salad" is one of my favorite apps in the city..That dressing..OMG....My go to for lunch are any of the curry dishes or the drunken noodles.  Fantastic!!

Truly a best kept secret!!!!  The food is amazing and Josh behind the bar is an awesome bartender/server!!  Our favorite dishes are the beef jerky, Phuket poppers,  ruing tiger steak and my personal fav the chicken pad woon sen!!! They have a very eclectic wine list and the bar is cozy.  Whether you're on a romantic date or just hanging w friends the atmosphere is perfect and always good people watching!

Always such a great experience at Nittaya's!! 

Always start with the not so secret salad, seriously it's a must to try!! Game changer for salads!
Typically, I do the tapas so I'm able to try a few different dishes while I'm dining. Last night we had the crab wontons and firecracker shrimp. Both were amazing dishes! I really have NEVER had a bad dish at this restaurant! 
Always love their infused water, last night was orange and cucumber.. delish and so refreshing. 

Be aware that this is a very small and intimate restaurant. If you're looking to be loud, this is not the place to be. Also, make a reservation for dinner if you're hoping to get a table. Otherwise, decent sized bar to sit at without reservations. 

I will always recommend Nittaya's and will always be back for more! :)
Hands down, one of the best places in vegas! I recommend the salad, avocado steak curry, drunken noodles and bread pudding. Great place for a date.

I went in for a quiet lunch at the bar. My waiter James was great. The menu is given to you on a wooden clip board with a bunch of papers. I didn't like the concept it was hard to get a really good look at the menu. The decor had a really homey feel and love their wine board in back of the bar.
I ordered the garlic endame and basil chicken entree. The endame was good but nothing special. I would have liked a little more spices. The basil chicken was awesome! I ordered it mild so it had just a little kick but the sauce was just right. The plum wine was good as well. I wanna buy a bottle. Overall the experience was great and nice spot for lunch if you want Thai.

I am teetering between a 3 and 4 star review and because of the rocky start to our evening, I am going to have to go with the 3 star for the moment.

When we arrived on a Thursday afternoon, around 5:30p, this very cute and intimate restaurant was pretty much empty. However, the host asked if we had a reservation (we didn't), and said that he wouldn't be able to seat us because it was 1/2 priced wine night, and they'd fill up. Um..okay.... (looking around empty restaurant)... Well, can we sit at the bar? Long pause. How about outside? They hesitated, but said they'd set up one of the outside tables. That was a process that took awhile. Because it was a bit breezy outside, we asked if they could set up the outdoor space heater. Another process.  That finally being settled, we sat down at the somewhat shaky table.

From that point forward, things went well enough. The sangria is delicious and beautifully presented. We ordered the fried avocado, the veggie potstickers and the mango bacon wrapped shrimp. All of these offerings were very good and again, the presentation was lovely. Service was friendly and pleasant. 

As the evening progressed, the wind picked up, and even with the space heater, I was downright cold. I asked our server if it was possible to move us inside to finish. We went inside, and while it was busy, there was a small table right by the bar. She said that the reservation wasn't until 7, so we would have plenty of time to complete our meal. So...why weren't we just seated there in the first place?

The seating issues did put a bit of a damper on the meal, but I am willing to give Nittaya's another try.

The food is sooooo yummy!! The atmosphere is so comforting and chill as well. My favorite part was the Bangkok tea and how they served it in a cast iron kettle. The waitress was so sweet and helpful! I had no idea what I was doing or what I was ordering and she picked that up quickly and explained things to me/suggested things for me. She rocked!

Yum! Came here for a late lunch, and just in time for happy hour, and it was delicious! It is a secret kitchen because from the outside, it looks dark -- almost like it's closed. There isn't an "open" sign, so at first, I actually thought that they were closed. The door also sticks a little bit, so you really have to yank hard to open the door. I thought that I was the only idiot to get tricked by this, but while sitting inside, it looked like several others were also fell for that trick! Guys, the secret is that Nittaya's Secret Kitchen is actually open! 
I'm glad that I was able to make it for happy hour, as I got to try some of the appetizers. They definitely have more of the "common"/"less exciting" tapas on happy hour (e.g., dumplings), but I was satisfied with everything I ordered. For tapas, I shared the bacon wrap shrimp, the garlic edamame, and the fried avocados. You can't really go wrong with bacon-wrapped shrimp, but I was pleasantly surprised by the size of the shrimp. They definitely weren't shrimpy shrimp! The garlic edamame was REALLY good. It was really garlicy and had a nice kick to it! I think that they might have pan fried it, instead of steaming it, to give it an extra crisp. The fried avocado was really good! Again, most things are good when fried, but what really made it above and beyond was the cilantro sauce. 
I also got the kao soi to share for an entree: the kao soi is really good! It's a bit pricey, but the portion is generous. I was worried that there wouldn't be enough to share, but there was plenty. The curry had a rich, spicy, coconut-y flavor, with a few large chunks of pork. 
I ended up sitting at the bar. The bartenders were friendly and willing to make recommendations and help explain some of the items on the menu. 
I would have loved to see some of their other more tapas on the happy hour menu.

One of the best Thai places I've been to in Summerlin area. The food was absolutely delicious. We have the chicken basil entree which was fantastic and perfect flavors. Opted for level 3 spice, which wasn't too spicy and would probably increase next time. The garlic rice with the chicken basil... you must try! The spinach tapas was really good along with the garlic edamame. There was no wait on a Sunday night at 7:00pm. Service was just okay. The server forgot one of our entree orders and bartender brought our bottled beers over, offered and suggested we use one of their cold beer glasses, we said yes.. then he never came back. It's okay though, it didn't change the fact that the food was delicious and I'd come back just to fulfill my Thai food fix!
Very good Thai food, thought I didn't think it was amazing, it was still really good. the Atmosphere is all really nice and cozy. I would definitely go back.

This is best Thai food I've had since moving to Vegas a year ago. So far I've tried the pad thai, mussels, basil eggplant, and fried avocados. I don't have a single complaint about any of these dishes. Pad Thai is usually the dish I use to determine how good a Thai place is, and the flavor is on point. Great balance of flavors, perfect portion size, just the right amount of crumbled peanuts. It's quite s treat.

In addition to the food, the ambience is quaint and perfect for a relaxing meal. The staff has been nothing but exceptional on each visit. I will definitely be coming back many times.
Small, intimate, great service. Good selection of wines. Spinach salad and soft shell crab are my favorite dishes! The small plates are all delicious and great for sharing!

To begin, I am not the biggest fan of thai food to begin with, but this place was great.  We went with another couple and seemed to order everything on the menu.  I don't like spinach, but they got a spinach salad that was great, the lamb was excellent too.  I would make a reservation if going for dinner as it was super packed and the place is relatively small.

Had an amazing dinner here tonight. Intimate restaurant - completely non "Vegas" - like. Cozy ambiance, delicious meal. Restaurant was packed so definitely make reservations.

Highly recommend the spinach salad and lemongrass soup. 

Also, my compliments to the staff for handling a VERY rude couple a few seats down from us. They had one thing wrong on their meal and threatened the owner with posting a scathing Yelp review. Restaurant staff did what they could in a packed room, and honestly it wasn't a big deal.
Had reservations for a Saturday night.  Great food and great service.  Had some small plates and one entree to share.  And hen dessert.  You must see and taste the dessert menu.

I went here for lunch.  I walked in and the waiter was extremely nice and seated us. They had some wonderful infused water.  The waiter explained the items on the menu and gave us his recommendations.  I had the red curry, my girlfriend had the pad thai and my friend had the drunken noodles. I tried them all and they were all excellent.  You get to choose on a scale of 1-5 for spice level and it can get very spicy.  I can't wait to come back and try more items off their menu.

From the million items on the menu to the soft indie oldies covers, I was smitten. We got a million things to share, and each was p dank. We ended up getting two orders of the tempura avocados. Who knew breading avocados could make them 10x better? It seemed pretty expensive with all the small plates, but if were being honest, I didn't pay the bill, so I didn't really care. This is a perfect third date spot - the one you go on when you're expecting to get laid. Loud enough for pauses to not be awkward, but quiet enough to have nice convos. 
They also last-minute put together a bunch of tables to seat all 8 of us in a rather small restaurant, so that hospitality is greatly appreciated. Oodles of pescatarian options, many could be veg if requested. Not that I am, but just so ya know!

I dream of the green curry. This place is super tasty. I wish the dishes were a tad cheaper for sure, but overall very yummy. Everyone I have taken has very much enjoyed it. 

I can not order above a 2 for spice- and I'm not a spice chicken by any means... this mess is HOT! Husband ordered the pork and green beans at a 4 and it was so hot I could barely eat it, but so yummy that I sure kept trying! 

Definitely worth a try!

What can I say, I really like this place.  It's not traditional Thai, but what do you expect with Thai tapas.  Everything I had was really, really good and inventive.  

My husband and I were starving so we started off with three "tapas" - the shrimp patties, stuffed angel wings, and spinach salad.  I love the spinach salad!  It's tempura spinach leaves served in a big cone (like French fries) with a yummy dressing on the side.  The shrimp patties and stuffed angel wings were also very good, but the spinach salad stole the show.  The shrimp patties were pretty much what you would expect.  The menu says "Thai spices" but the patties aren't spicy at all.  Decent size and the plum sauce drizzled on top tasted great. The stuffed angel wings are a little different than what I'm used to, but still yummy.  A lot more chicken than "stuffing" and with cilantro.  

For entrees, we had the spicy green bean pork and the basil beef.  Their spice rating system is from 1 to 5.  The spicy green bean pork can only be made a "2" or higher.  Hence the word "spicy" in the name.  We got the pork as a "2" and the beef as a "4."  The "2" was just perfect for me and the pork with green beans was delicious.  The beef was also good but I could tell it had more oil on it and I would probably break into a sweat if ate too much.  The entrees come with white rice, which was cooked properly.  All the plates come with little orchids on them and are served family style.  I liked the presentation of all the dishes, especially the spinach salad.

For beer, they have Peroni, Blue Moon, and Coors Light on tap. We ended up having two Blue Moons, which went really well with the food. They do have some more interesting beers by the bottle, such as a Joseph James stout.  They have a very nice selection of wines but all the red wine is stored on shelves, so it might be too warm.  But they did have a sign outside offering 50% of wine by the bottle on Thursdays so I may have to check that out.  They also carry some sake.  

Most of the desserts have coconut.  It's a Thai restaurant so I expect that.  We ended up having the Thai donuts, which were really tasty.  The caramel sauce is supposed to have coconut in it, but I didn't taste it.

They took my restaurant.com certificate, no problem.  Service was great - very attentive and helpful.  

Small, cute place.  A little dark, especially in the bathroom, but the décor is nice.  Looking at the reviews, I think this restaurant has been paying attention and making adjustments because I didn't have close to the same experience other reviewers had. This restaurant is definitely going on my regular rotation.

I went to Nittaya's twice before and my wife and I sat at the bar. The food and service were both good. We recently went back with another couple and sat in the dining area. The food tasted different but that was not the problem. It was the service in the dining area. Everyone was nice and helpful but management apparently has them stepping over one another. The servers take the orders are are knowledgeable.THEN, they are basically finished as the bussers deliver the food! So what - right? No, not all right because the bussers don't know who ordered what and have to ask everyone what they ordered and are not able to answer questions. God help you if the order is wrong. They need to get the server to solve the problem. I feel bad for the bussers as they are not trained on the menu and shouldn't be expected to be knowledgeable on food and wine. Others in the room had quizzical looks on their faces as they tried to get answers before their food got cold. Too bad really. I won't go back with a party of three or larger.

My husband and I had some good friends in town, and wanted to take them somewhere for dinner that they couldn't experience where they live. Nittaya's certainly fit the bill!

Speaking of bills, I'll start there - we were shocked when the bill arrived, and were anticipating it to be about 30% more than it was. For $120 (before tip), we ordered:

The famous tempura spinach salad
Corn fritters 
Wontons 
Spring rolls
Shrimp pad Thai
Chicken pad Thai
FOB rice
Emerald rice 
a Thai iced tea

If you've been here before, you know that is a lot of food! We took home leftovers for sure!

My friend is a pescetarian, and our server was happy to have our dressing for the spinach salad prepared without ground chicken. She also pointed out that the corn fritters contained pork when she brought them to the table, which I thought was nice since we were sharing, and my friend hasn't seen the item description. 

My heat level here is 1-5, I ordered a 3 and was happy with that...their 3 would be a 4 at Le Thai. My FOB rice was astounding - full of tender chicken, and juicy pineapple. All the shared tapas were fantastic also! 

Our friends have been to Las Vegas many times, and we love taking them different places each visit, but they have already requested we come back here on their next visit this fall! So glad we decided to let them in on one of Las Vegas' best Secrets.

We went there Christmas Eve on the recommendation of friends who love this place. I would recommend reservations, as the room is quite small. One of my companions and I split tapas of beef jerky and egg rolls. The jerky was quite good, but the egg rolls seemed pretty standard. The spinach salad is amazing, and as I live close by, I drop by frequently to pick it up at lunch time to go. The entrees we had were very good... just the right amount of "bite" in the items that were supposed to bite. 

A couple of downs that kept me from giving it a fifth star. First, the room is *really* dark; so much so that my 17-year old couldn't see the menu, and he can read the Lord's Prayer off the head of a pin. The manager told me they'd had a few comments about this, and may invest in some penlights to help patrons. Since the menu is eclectic, it really helps to be able to read it. The second thing was that two of my companions are vegetarians, a fact of which I made very clear to the waiter when we came in. One of my companions ordered the Tofu Pad Thai, which she said was quite good until she was about a third through it and found that in addition to the tofu, it contained... chicken. Buzz kill. They were very apologetic, but this should *not* happen, ever, and it was exacerbated by the fact that the restaurant lights are so dim that it is sometime hard to discern what you're eating. 

Overall, I thought the food great, the service acceptable, but the ambience too dark.

That's just my opinion. I coud be wrong.

My sons took me here for Mothers Day, food was excellent. I had the duck curry and it was so tender it was like sweet butter melting in your mouth. The flavors  were rich but not overpowering! I think I had a glass of plum wine which I would highly recommend as it complements the curry magnificently.

It's my favorite restaurant in Vegas, it is a true hidden gem.  If you like great food and a great staff go here.  Their happy hour is super inexpensive but it doesn't matter what time you go the food is always going to keep you coming back.
Highlights of the menu: "beef jerky", served with a side sauce that is to die for, spiced edamame. no idea what all is in the seasoning but it will make your mouth happy, spinach salad is great, it's all over reviews but it's the dressing that makes the dish, you could put it on anything.  The staff is pretty fun, Lea is our favorite but everybody is super helpful and good spirited.
One more note, this is an all events restaurant, date night, yes, family dinners, yes, dining with friends yes.  There isn't an event that wouldn't work here.  Call ahead for a large party would be the only tip.

Had lunch there the other day. Had the drunken noodles, fried rice, pot stickers, and chicken satay. The food was decent, not greasy, ok flavor, but a bit overboard with garnishes everywhere. Just that non of the dishes made me say wow. For me the ambiance was a little off putting, to dark, and missing the traditional thai feel I'm used to. Feelt alittle rushed to eat and go. Just wasn't all that impressed, seemed like a overly priced thai restaurant with ok food. With all the good comments I expected more.  Probably won't go back, I'll stick with my thai mom and pop restaurant.

The atmosphere is wonderful. The employees were very friendly and  great at providing serve.  They make you want to come back.  The food is delightful.  I was there for lunch and I had so many excellent choices I had to solicit help from another customer. I will be going back very soon.  Forgot to mention the most important part..... Fabulous selection of wine.

What a total surprise.  This place came highly recommended but I didn't know the Thai food background of either person recommending the restaurant.  I have had Thai in several countries including those down under.  Just had exceptional Thai in San Diego soooooo when I got here I anticipated a good Thai meal & instead I had a meal that beat all the others.  The drunken noodles we're with broccolini & ground chicken (thought it wasn't going to be a good choice). This was cooked to perfection!  The eggplant dish was so good though I'm not a vegetarian I'd come back to just have this.  The red curry chicken was so flavorful & smooth.  While we were stuffed you simply can not leave a message like this without Mango & sticky rice....WOW.  oh I forgot to mention the infused water was refreshing.  Gorgeous atmosphere & I'd absolutely make sure to come back.  Hell I'd drive 6 hrs just to eat here again!

Gf liked the boullabaise, spinach tempura interesting at first...fish cake rubbery but flavorful.  Very nice decor. Great napkin folding.  Waiter hawked a phlegmball just as we were taking our first bite in an otherwise quiet restaurant.

This is a small intimate restaurant. Great food. Great wine selection. One of the top Thai restaurants I've had. The duck breast curry was a little tough but delicious. The service is great. The prices are moderate but the portions are very generous. I had a great experience. Next time I have to try the spinach salad. It looked very delicious. 

This is definitely a hidden gem in Vegas! 

Oh yes and half off wine bottles on Thursday!

I was visiting my boyfriend in Las Vegas and instead of acting like tourists on the Strip, I thought it would be fun to have a culinary adventure around town.  I had read an article about Nittaya's Secret Kitchen in a local magazine and decided to give it a try.  The atmosphere was great and the food was delicious!  As an appetizer, we ordered the "spinach salad" and the potato pouches in curry sauce.  Both were amazing.  I had never had tempura spinach before and I quite enjoyed it, especially when dipped in the accompanying sauce.  I think the measure of any Thai restaurant can be found in what their curry tastes like, and this one did not disappoint.  I look forward to coming back and ordering a curry entree next time.  The third dish we ordered was the drunken noodles.  It was a little on the sweet side, but still very tasty.  The reason why I knocked off a star, despite the phenomenal food, had to do with the snooty attitude of the hostess/waitress as we walked in.  My boyfriend and I decided to bike to the restaurant (so we were both in casual/sporty clothes) and the hostess/waitress seemed surprised when we said we wanted a table to eat there.  Nittaya's has a nice, intimate vibe, but I don't think we were so out of place as to deserve that reaction.  Especially since two women in yoga clothes walked in ten minutes later.  Despite that setback, I would definitely return to enjoy more delicious Thai cuisine!
Excellent cuisine with a friendly staff and owner.  The dessert menu is aptly titled "Happy Endings".  For a Thai restaurant, its utterly hilarious!

This is a hidden gem in this town,  ten tables,  elegant and romantic atmosphere,  amazing food  great service.  This is one of our favorite go to spots. , me and my daughter had date night tonight and we had their signature spinach salad and it is literally one my favorite dishes,  I can't come here ever without ordering it,  you must try!!!!!!  We also ordered the shrimp padding Thai was amazing and the mango sticky rice for dessert, wow now that's what a mango should taste like,  warm,  sweet,  tender served with sweet sticky rice  yum!!! I have tried Alot of the dishes on menu  drunken noodles,  garlic spare ribs,  the curry   you really just can't go wrong here,  you will add this place to your favorites too!!

Incredible, loved everything about this restaurant from the servers to the food and everything in between! Do yourself a favor and go. You will be so pleased that you did! One of the very best restaurants in all of Las Vegas! It is very small, so call ahead and make a reservation!

There food is decent however for the price it's not worth it. As well as the customer service, they triple charged me which added up to around over $300. Not impressed which is unfortunate, I had high hopes.

Being from San Francisco I've grown accustom to the down home style cooking of Thai restaurants back there. Since moving out here (5 yrs ago) I've been so disappointed with every single supposed Thai restaurant I've come across. 

NITTAYA'S SECRET KITCHEN is the answer to all my food prayers. Her food gives you that warm feeling inside like it was cooked especially for you & makes you want to give the Chef a hug for such great food. 

A must try is her "WORLD FAMOUS SPINACH SALAD" its the most DELICIOUS thing I've ever tasted. Individually tempura fried spinach served with a chicken larb... OMG! i could seriously eat this everyday. 

You should also give her Pad Thai a try... its not your typical "sour, orangie looking pad Thai" It has the perfect balance of sweet, salt & sour 

I could honestly go on forever about this place but you guys should check it out for yourself. If you're all the way on the other side, it worth the drive!!
I don't know how I didn't hear about Nittaya's sooner. I loved the atmosphere. The service was good the food was quality. I'll definitely be going back.

The place was so much smaller than I originally thought, but we came after the dinner rush so it wasn't too crowded. We made reservations and they saved a nice booth in the corner for my boyfriend and I. 

We ordered the spinach salad and a large sake to start off with. For our entrees we got the salmon avocado curry and garlic basil lamb chops. Sooo flavorful! Although we were pretty full we decided that since we don't know when the next time is that we'll be able to stop by, we might as well try their dessert too. It was mango coconut rice with Thai mangos that are only in season for a few months. Next time I want to try the banana chocolate beignets! 

Overall, I was thoroughly impressed with everything. Food, atmosphere, and service. I would definitely suggest this to others.

This restaurant has good service but no AC in the hot summer of Las Vegas heat!!! It was a 110 degree day. My husband and I were sweating profusely during  dinner. We asked the waiter to make it cooler but he said the AC was  at the maximum setting. It literally felt like we were in Thailand .

I've come to Nittaya's over a dozen times for lunch now and have yet to have even a mediocre meal. The staff are friendly and attentive, and the restaurant itself is clean, sleek, and modern with a wine bar and two intimate dining rooms. Both the red curry and basil chicken burst with flavor, also be sure to try the spicy garlic edamame. Bottom line, if you're a fan of Thai food, you're missing out if you don't try Nittaya's. While not inexpensive, prices are still on the reasonable side and the return in the quality of food and service is evident and well worth it.

This is a good Summerlin find, especially if you're a Thai and wine fan (thats me). 
They have a great selection of wine to choose from, along with some really good red sangria. I definitely recommend the sangria. 
I ordered the basil chicken and the muay thai fried rice. I liked that the basil chicken wasn't over sauced and had a bit of a kick to it for me. I can't handle too much spice, so this was just enough. But you can step it up asking for a spiciness from 1 - 5. 
I liked that the fried rice had a bit more to it, with peppers and basil. 
Overall, this is a good place for lunch or dinner, or just a glass of wine. 
ProTip: on the weekends, be sure to make a reservation for dinner.

INCREDIBLE !!! 
The service , the food , the vibe .. 
Just perfect for a date night .. If your into real Thai food not watered down versions then this is the place to be .. Thursday 1/2 off wine is a big plus ..  The volcano shrimp are made to perfection crunchy but not oily and the sauce  full of flavor not just spicy .. Oh wait almost forgot the lemon Grass soup the best I've ever had at a restaurant ... Last but not least I Totally recommend the spinach salad .. Now back to my date night with my wife before she kicks my Ars lol . 2 thumbs up and a slap on the ass :)
spinach salad is awesome! Lunch specials are affordable which includes a small salad, gyoza and entree. Tried almost everything in the menu and so far not disappointed at all.

Five stars everytime!  We've been coming here almost weekly since we found out about this place.  Never had anything I didn't absolutely love and the food is always consistent! Amazing service, small and intimate.  Nittaya's cooking is an art form.

Not bad, but other nearby places offer better bang for the buck. Ugh- and the skinny white chair was extremely uncomfortable- not ideal for dining out. The seat of the chair had no padding and was too thin. A rethink of the chairs are a must and should be made an immediate priority.

The food was very good as was the service. I enjoyed the tamarind shrimp for an appetizer (although I would have loved if it was served with a small salad or garnish of rice or vegetables). I also had the pad see ew, which was very tasty and hot when it came out. The only downside was it got cold before I could finish it because it was on a plate. It wasn't as good cold. The service was also very good.

This is a pleasant little restaurant close to our Summerlin community. The food was adequate, however the hair in my salad was a bit of a disappointment.  When I showed it to our server, she said she was really sorry however no offer of a replacement was forthcoming.

The only suggestion I can offer to those who wish to go there is that they inspect their food carefully before eating it.

"To be alive is to totally and openly participate in the simplicity and elegance of here and now." - D. Altman

Nittaya is one of the sweetest and nicest owners that you will probably not actually meet. The secret on Nittaya's has been out for a long time...almost as soon as she moved up Lake Mead, transitioning from take-out to one of the nicer Thai restaurants in town. So, unless you knew her from her previous incarnation years ago, or you are a true regular at Nittaya's Secret Kitchen, then the amiable chef and owner is probably the only secret left at Nittaya's.

The World Famous Spinach Salad with tempura spinach, lime dressing, and chicken has lived up to its name. I had loved Nittaya's curries before, but this was the dish that brought heightened interest and demonstrated that there was a lot more than traditional curries and noodles  to be had at Nittaya's. It used to be a staple anytime I came and I will still return to it from time-to-time.

These days I am just as likely to branch out and try something new, or return to something that I haven't had in a while. One of my favorites is the Salmon-Avocado Curry--green curry with eggplant, avocado, and zucchini. I don't see myself getting tired of this dish anytime soon.

Nittaya's can hold their own against most of the Thai restaurants in town. Certainly one of the better options, but what separates them is that they are one of three elevated Thai restaurants in town that incorporates great food with a lovely ambiance.
I really like this place I have been here many times. Food is tasty and atmosphere is cool and in the summer you can eat outside .

Wonderful experience. The staff from the hostess, to the busboy, food runner and server was outstanding. The atmosphere is dim lit and very romantic and comforting. They start you off with a strawberry mint water which was very refreshing. We started with the spinach salad because it was so highly recommend on yelp. No idea how they fry and tempura loose leaf spinach like that, but it was very good. A little heavy and a very large portion for two people, so we barely dented the plate but it was still delicious. It was served with a special sauce that is rich and decadent, so be sparing. The Thai tea was a must have. And we split the green curry salmon which was served with an avocado on top, eggplant and zucchini. It was large enough to split for two. We were stuffed but had to order the mango sticky rice for dessert which was in season, and which I will probably be craving for the rest of my life! It was superb! I appreciate the fact that They only have it on the menu when the mango is in season and is just right. To me, that Really shows that Mrs.Nittaya is very dedicated to her menu and her beautiful creations. I would love to meet this fantastic chef. Every plate was divine. Decorated with flowers and special care. I highly recommend. My favorite curry is yellow, or massaman,  but I had to try something different. I look forward to going back for their lunch specials and also the happy hour!!
Shawndee was fantastic! Kept us entertained but still allowed us to have privacy. Food was fantastic as always. Couldn't believe how good the mussels were!

This is one of the best little gems in Las Vegas! Quaint, charming, intimate setting with incredible Thai food. I have always been a lover of Thai food but Nittaya's is taking it to the next level. It is inventive, creative and sexy! This is a great place for date night or to come have Thai tapas with friends and enjoy their happy hour. ($5 tapas $5 glasses of wine) You MUST try the spinach salad. It's individually tempura fried spinach leaves with an amazing Thai cashew dipping sauce! Also the Basil Tofu is fantastic as is the Coconut Curry Chicken! WOW I cannot say enough great things about this place!

I mentioned this restaurant for a business meeting, I had eaten here before many times, as we had dinner and it was the worst experience I could have ever dreamed of. The bacon wrap was dry and so were the crab cakes.
The service was super slow, one of the members of our party asked for a steak, and it did not come out until we all had finished eating. The gentleman ate his steak, and the rest of us, having finished, just sat with him. Then, the server came out with a salad they insisted we ordered, and we had not! We had all finished eating!
We had to pay for the salad, they never offered to pack up for us to take and charged us for it! That salad went back to the kitchen and guaranteed, they served to the next person that ordered it!
Will never recommend them again, or will I ever eat there again.

The service here better than we expected! They had a beautiful seating area outside. We were served infused water. Definitely very fancy, fusion Thai food!! Our server was very informative and full of suggestions. He really made us feel welcomed.

Great atmosphere, but more on the high end quiet restaurant type vs take out. I prefer it, but opted not to bring my 3-1/2 year old grandson (to spare others). 

My first visit there was a great experience, the food was tasty and cooked to perfection. We did have some miscommunication on the level of spice in my Pad Thai however. They offer a level of heat between 1-5. When I asked my waiter her opinion of the heat, she wasn't of much help and kind of insinuated that they don't make their food too hot. So I ordered a 5 (I like my food hot), but not so much that I can't taste the food! That said, I requested a 5, and told her if I wanted to go hotter, I could always add some in on the side- sort of determine that level on my own.

When she returned with my food, she said, "I ordered you a 5, but I had them add extra to spice it up". Hmmm. Well, that extra spice they added made the food intolerable. It was beyond what any restaurant should serve if they want their patrons to actually taste their food. It wasn't enjoyable at all (and I can eat hot chili peppers for breakfast) :)

Overall, the other food we ordered was very tasty. So we returned another night for take out. This time I ordered a level 3 for my Pad Thai. The second time around was not as impressive as the first. The Pad Thai had almost no flavor, spice or otherwise. Even after adding an entire container of chili paste they provided on the side. It was just bleh. 

The eggplant dish was absolutely delicious though, totally worth trying!

Second time in two months I had lunch with a friend at this restaurant and once again, same bad service.  First off, seems if you order off the lunch menu, they assume you are in a hurry and rush to place the order and bring out the food.  The problem is that the food arrives before the salad and potsticker that is included in the lunch option. The food was not very hot either.  Asked the wait staff about the salad and potsticker and they just gave a rather blank, "huh?" kinda look.  Five minutes later, the salads came out and were strangely bland with a lot of vinegar on the lettuce.  

Another issue is that you are given two forks and a napkin, no knife.  So because we ordered noodle dishes, we asked for knives, again, blank look from the wait staff.  

We were not in a hurry, we do not work, bad assumption on the part of the staff, however, no excuse for the lack of manners and bad service for the second time.  We will not be back, ever!
This is a great place for a date night out. The tapas are great. Thursdays are half off select wine bottles. Reservations are a good idea.

I have spent a lot of time in Northern and Southern California where there are big Thai communities and the restaurants work very hard to be the best in their food genre.
This place is cute and they worked very hard to make it look amazing...which it does.
The waitstaff is awesome. They are attentive and they are friendly.

The food is Thai food for people who haven't had real Thai food. Thai food should have layers of flavor all working together. 

For example..we ordered the Coconut Soup and the FOB Rice (Fresh off Pineapple Boat). These items were tasty, except the chicken that is being used for this was cooked in such a way that they could use in in both dishes. These means that the chicken has to be cooked with no discernable taste. Although the soup and the Rice were really awesome, when you get to the pieces of chicken, they haven't been able to develop any flavor and they are extremely bland. This takes a potentially awesome dish and kills the awesomeness.

We did order a few appetizers, Curry Puffs, Secret Stickers, and Edamame. The Curry Puffs and  Secret Stickers are interestingly enough cooked in what seems to be a Bisquick-type dough instead of the typical Thai-style dumpling shao-mai wrappers. The Edamame had the layers of flavor and heat that I was looking for.

When I expressed to the waitress that I wished that the food was a little hotter, she did bring me three things to add to my meal. The first one was a dish of pepper flakes, the second was something that may have been sriracha and the last was the sriracha with the pepper flakes in it. Thai sauces should vary, not just be about heat but should be about traditional Thai flavors.

We also ordered 2 entrees, the Crying Tiger Steak and the Kao-Soi (Pork Shoulder).
The steak arrived cooked perfectly but cold. (This is why many restaurants will tell you that a plate is hot when they serve your food...a room temperature plate will lower the heat of your meal by 10 degrees or more by the time it gets to your table) and the Kao-Soi in this bath of really tasty but a sloppy mess of slightly overcooked egg noodles. The pork was cooked perfectly. All was tasty.

WIll we go back? No.
There are so many places in Vegas that we will only return to the ones that have memorable food...and there are a lot of Thai restaurants to visit. 

Secret Garden, thank you for the wonderful memory...but for us, it's .

This place was recommended by a friend of mine. I was a little skeptical at first, because my wife likes good, flavorful food. 
I was very impressed with the flavor, the PORTIONING, and the price. They also have a nice wine selection.  The service was great and Leah is an excellent waitress. I will definitely bring my friends here.
Very expensive for so-so food. Try the tapas but avoid the crying tiger steak. $24 for a small unseasoned ribeye is outrageous.

I hate writing a bad review but my experience was unpleasant and I felt compelled to vent. 

First let me start off with the fact that it is New Year's Eve and the restaurant was packed and I placed a to go order.  

The food is expensive for what it is, the portions are small but it tasted good (not amazing) based on the reviews I was expecting the best Thai meal of my life.  The total was $78.95 for potstickers, Bouillabaisse, Cornish hen, Pad Thai, bread pudding and fried banana.  

I was told that my order would take 1 hour to be prepared but since this was my first time driving there I wanted to make sure I was there with enough time.  It only took me 7 minutes to get there - so here is the breakdown I placed my order at 5:51pm and I picked it up by 6:27pm hardly 1 hour.  

The place was packed,  and the place is very well decorated.  I must say I'm a little bummed that I won't be returning because I really think I would have enjoyed my dinning experience there.  But coming from the service industry mistakes are all about the recovery. 

Ok now on to the negatives, my chicken Pad Thai was missing I called them right away to let them know and they said I can come back pick it up.  At this point I just want to sit and eat so I called them back and said that I was going to eat my food first so it wouldn't get cold and I would call them when I'm on my way so they could re make it.  Ok so this where I think it just went down hill for me, my food was cold!!!  The portions are already small for the price but the being cold on top of it?!?!   The Bouillabaisse was tasty but cold, the Cornish hen was a  dry but tasty, the potstickers were a little  raw, the bread pudding was hard and the fried banana was soggy.  Just a really expensive bad meal. 

So recovery--  hardly I call to them and stated that I just wanted my money back, the girl who answered the phone said she would give me a credit since they messed up, I told her that I most likely won't be returning and that I would like my money returned to my card.  She said that there wasn't a manager available tonight and she would take my information down and someone would reach out to me in the next couple of days.  As I was asking her for the managers name she had already hung up on me.  I tried calling back twice but no one answered.  

So unfortunately I have to give this place 2 stars and I probably will never return.  I read so many things and so many friends have recommended it that it truly breaks my heart that I am the one who had a bad experience.

Update went back last night to get my refund and a manager never came to talk to me, they took my card gave me the refund and ushered me out, no apologies.  I know that one bad review will affect the place but hopefully this won't happen to anyone else.

Wow, wow and wow. It has been years since I've been impressed by a restaurant other than one other. This place really deserves 5 stars. Every dish we had was excellent. You can see from my other reviews I'm not so easy to please. 
They do an excellent job of taking spices and adding flavors that are new and delicious without over doing it. I can't wait to try other things on their menu. This trip we tried the spinach salad (what a shock it's so good), the chicken masaman, the eggplant curry, a noodle dish that was top notch and the Phucket poppers (the most disappointing and still excellent). 
If I had one complaint it's time to replace the chairs unless it's just the one I had. It was extremely uncomfortable. No reason to downgrade restaurant, just a note. A little cramped, but hey, what can you do. It's excellent food, popular and limited in size. I own a restaurant and hope that my customers enjoy my shop as much as I enjoyed this one. I can't say enough about it. Thank you for a great night out.
The absolutely best food and customer service! The mix of fusion foods and flavors are incredible... make a reservation, seating is limited. This is a hidden gem

Great Great Great thai food. This place used to be a secret but seems like everyone knows about it now. You have to make a reservation or else good luck getting in. Drunken noodles, steak salad, pineapple fried rice, and deep fried spinach are all amazing. All of their food is amazing.

I was in the Summerlin neighborhood, and had this spot bookmarked, so thought I would give it a try!  I've read earlier reviews, and it looks like they have established themselves nicely now.  The interior is very upscale, which wine glasses and fancy wood furniture.  The dining area is small, but nicely designed.  Wine bottles are fancily displayed in wooden shelves behind the bar.  There is even a small outside dining area, which might be nice on a summer night.  The easy listening music would have touched my inner yuppie, if I had one.

I had no issues with the service.  I made a bit of small talk with one of the waitresses, and she explained that Nittaya's has only been open for two months.  My water was always full, and they asked me how my food was.  This also was the first Thai restaurant I've been to where the waitress folded my napkin over my lap.  I wasn't even with anyone!  Can't complain there. 

My order: Thai tea, Crab Wontons, and Curry catfish.  
Overall impression: descent, Americanized Thai.

Thai tea was average, very creamy, but not very flavorful.  I would go ahead and skip the Thai tea at Nittaya's.  The water though had fruit in it!  This is how my old stoming grounds, Thai Grill, does their water, and it makes for a very refreshing, slightly tangy drink.  

The Crab Wontons were a little bland on the inside.  They used some sort of either immitation crab, or low quality crab, mixed with cream cheese and a couple of herbs.  The fried shells were nice though, thick and well prepared.   They came with two sauces, a sweet sauce and a spicy one.  Both were good sauces, particularly the spicy one, and they made the crab wontons definitely more doable.  Overall though, I wasn't too impressed.  

The curry catfish was alright.. not great, not bad though.  The curry sauce was thick, and on the sweet side, but in this case that was ok because catfish is always a little better with sweetness to offset the "dry" catfish taste.  The portion was a little small for the $13 price tag.  The curry came with a nice change of pace though: baby bok choy.  This did give the curry a little bit of a unique taste, I and enjoyed it.  

Overall, due to the sweetness of the curry, and the not-so-thrilling crab wontons, I wouldn't go out of my way to eat at Nittaya's again over some of the better, more authentic Thai restaurants in Vegas (see my List), but it would be a good spot to bring a date or the parents maybe.

When we 1st got in it took like 5 mins before anybody acknowledged us although it was busy in this small space they had plenty of seating outside which was really a nice vibe. The service wasn't good at all the server lacked confidence and messed up the order and forgot to bring my friend his wine.  I love Thai food Tofu pad Thai is my favorite and compared to most places it was pretty GOOD but a little over priced. Overall I like the food and the decor was very chill just wish the service was better because If I'm spending $17 for a dish I would like the experience to be as good as the food. Also the infused water was really good was good and refreshing
This is the best Thai food ever :) amazing service and great atmosphere. Definitely will be coming here again

I can see what all the hype is about.

The restaurant has a nice cozy atmosphere, definitely a place to go with friends after work.

The staff was amazing. Everyone was so friendly and courteous, which can definitely go a long way to making a dining experience worthwhile. 

The food was good. It wasn't great, like some of the Thai places in Chinatown or Lotus, but it was definitely good. Nothing we had tasted bad.

We had the Thai beef jerky, the spinach salad (this, alone, would be 5 stars), crab fried rice, drunken noodles, and the Cornish hen.

What's great is that this is just off rampart and lake mead, so it's a lot closer than other Thai places. Will probably back again to try more of the menu.

Anyone who doesn't give them 5 stars is out of their mind. Seriously. This place rules. I am there at least once a week for lunch meetings and they consistently execute at a high level on every dish. 
My go-to is Red Chicken Curry. The sauce is so delicious and combined with the perfectly cooked rice makes quite a tasty bite. The chicken pad Thai is also the best I've ever had. 
Even if you're not into Thai, try them out.

I had been wanting to come to this restaurant since I moved to Vegas. I finally got to have dinner here last night, and it exceeded my expectations. Hands down the BEST Thai food in Vegas that I have tried. The restaurant is small, and cozy, nice ambiance, beautiful lounge music playing in the background tied everything together. The food was delicious, our service was great (our server, her name was boy, she was fantastic) and I will def be coming back again.

I'm so obsessed with papaya salad and had not found one to die for since I was in highschool in Oregon. I've been in Vegas two years now and just came across this place. I was happy to see they had the papaya salad on the menu (as many Thai places if been to don't) so I ordered it with sticky rice. You have to eat the salad with sticky rice, with your fingers....it's the only way in my opinion. Do it. It was perfect! The perfect amount of peanuts and spice. In love- so happy. I ordered the pad Thai, because---u just have to. And it was great- although I could only eat a few bites. Too stuffed from the salad. I am looking forward the trying the mango/coconut dessert and some curry dishes. When I first started eating Thai food those were the best...all I ever ate. So thankful to have found an authentic Thai place to eat. Ps- I just ordered take-out. The staff was super nice and it was ready right when I got there.

After a long day getting my home ready and a visit to the DMV, I was hungry but too lazy to cook for myself. I haven't had Thai food in a long time, and it turns out Nittaya's is less than 2 minutes from my house. So I drove there to get my grub on, only to find that Nittaya's is packed to the gills.

Fortunately, there was a spot at the bar that I was able to squeeze into, and had a good conversation with a Vietnam veteran that I had a lot in common with. Having been to Thailand, my favorite dish is a chicken massaman curry, so that is what I ordered. Plus, I got some chicken pot stickers to whet my appetite. I will say that the menu is quite large, and there is a whole lot to choose from.

The pot stickers were excellent. Slight crisp, juicy inside, and the soy dipping sauce made for a perfect bite.

Then came my curry. The portions were very generous, and included a big bowl of white rice. Everything tasted exactly as it should, and the curry was the right consistency and flavor. The only thing I could gripe about was that it was not spicy at all, and could have used some heat. Next time I was ask them to bring it. :)

Besides that, it's a bit on the pricey side for Thai food, but I enjoyed it and will come back for more.

I know this going to come off as Biased since I work here but I honestly mean what I say. I have worked here for 5 years and the food is so amazing that I have yet to get burnt out on eating it. The flavors are incredible and the menu is huge! I am not a fan or steak, onions, lamb, and duck typically, but Nittaya makes all of these in a way that I really enjoy. She is very talented and puts hard work into every dish! So it is for that reason I am going to give this place 5 stars and review it as if I were a guest that came here for 5 years!

Very impressive food. A must for any Summerlin visitors craving Thai! Kai
Soi was great.

We come here regularly and we appreciate the consistency of good service and flavourful food. Wine pairing suggestions from our server and bartender were excellent. The garlic spare ribs were perfectly crunchy and flavored. The best salmon green curry in town and  flavorful lamb chops were simply delish.

I have high expectations when it comes to Thai food and how spicy it should be and this place is beyond amazing. You can order your dishes on a spice level from 1-5, I got soup and the catfish curry at a 4 and my scalp sweated, which is how I like it. Major thumbs up. Will always make this a must when I'm in Vegas.

BEST. THAI. FOOD. IN. VEGAS! I've been to soooo many and am a tough critic with thai. I crave their fried spinach salad often and their curries are great, the drunken noodles are my FAVORITE!! Wish it were closer to my house, open more locations!
By far the best Thai restaurant in all of Vegas. We are never disappointed whenever we go. It's a lot of fun trying different items on the menu.

All I can say is wow! I agree with the other reviews.  They did everything right the food was great so perfectly on the spot for taste flavor and seasonings. Half price bottles of wine on thursday with a great selection of fine wines.

Gently flavoured Thai food, not to much spicy also  with smooth of coconut pulp.
Good ingredients (I had seafood) but too persistent sweet sensation in any plate.
Service level fair.
Honest check.

Great curry dishes and atmosphere. I highly recommend the Thai donuts.  It is a bit small so you're cramped or you're "more intimate" which is either good or bad depending how you look at it. It didn't bother me that much.

Traditional Thai flavors with some modern culinary twists?  Hmmm?... could go very, very wrong.  But, the chef here blends it all together well. 

The biggest problem I have with this place is price.  $19 for a small serving of pad Thai?...steep!  Rent around this area must be a doozie. 

And sorry to say, but service  isn't always great.  

We tend to stay away from dishes that aren't anything special and that we can get elsewhere for much cheaper (like pad Thai).  

We do enjoy the Grilled Salmon-Avocado Curry
(in green curry with eggplant, avocado, & zucchini), Fried Spinach, Eggplant with Thai Basil, & Garlic-Basil Lamb Chop. 

Give it a try.  But expect to pay twice as much as you would at other Thai restaurants for small portions.

Had dinner at the bar. Although it took longer than expected to receive service, it was worth it. Great menu selection and friendly staff. Food was excellent. Look forward to going back as the menu has many great options.
Excellent food. Excellent ambiance. Excellent service. It reminded my husband and I of the best Thai food that we had while visiting San Francisco. I can eat here every week!
Absolutely phenomenal! Excellent customer service and food quality. Tried the lightly battered spinach appetizer and lemongrass soup. Excellent! Will definitely be back next time I'm in Vegas.

Excellent and creative Thai food.  The Spinach Salad was excellent and I am a bit veggie-phobic. Everything tastes great and presented nicely.  Service is efficient and friendly.  Setting quite nice although a bit cramped in some tables. Overall a great choice in the area. Definitely a level above even the good local Thai places around Summerlin.
Really liked this place. Great flavors. Decent pricing for tapas. Amazing service! And the desert was beyond yummy. Had the creme brulee trio. Go! Soon!

Amazing. Amazing. Amazing. Thanks Yelp! Just searched and saw amazing reviews and took a leap of faith & found a gem! 

An overall great experience from the moment we arrived. First off, this place is a very small restaurant. When we walked in they asked if we made reservations. Of course we didn't because we were first timers. But luckily there was seating outside and Mother Nature was being kind that day. 

Someone automatically brought out our Lemon & Cucumber infused water. Fancy? The best water I ever had in a restaurant. Did NOT taste like tap water like most restaurants. I pay attention to the waters! I can't stand when waters taste like unfiltered tap water. 

Our waitress, Devynn, was amazing. She gave us great suggestions on what to order. 

World Famous Spinach Salad $11- this is a tempura spinach salad with a lime dressing that has ground chicken, onion, cashews, and carrots. This is probably the most unique dish I have ever ate in my life. You can either toss the salad with the dressing OR eat it like chips and salsa. We went with the chips and salsa method so we didn't drown the spinach tempura. It is a MUST GET. They are famous for this! I ordered it and the beau finished it! Lol that's how delicious it was. 

Beef Jerky $8- bomb! It actually wasn't too jerky if that makes sense. You were able to chew it and not struggle. It came with a roasted chili sauce that added the right kick. 

Shrimp puffs $8- they were like wontons that had shrimp, cream cheese & curry mixed inside. This was probably my least favorite in the meal we ordered BUT still had a good taste to it. I honestly could not taste the shrimp.. 

Chicken Pad Thai $16- BEST PAD THAI in town, hands down. They have really good spices so we ordered it as a level 2 and oh wow it was amazing. Spicy but not too spicy. It was a large portion which was appreciated. The noodles were cooked perfect. Everything about this dish was perfect. 

The presentation of the dishes were beautiful too. They added an Orchid to each plate. How did they know that Orchids were my favorite!?

Highly recommend this place if you are in the summerlin area!
Great food. The spinach salad is great. Price is a little on the high side.
Delicious!  Salad and dumplings come with lunch special.   Tasty ginger salad dressing!   Chicken with mixed vegetables is my favorite    Also love the curry.
