Super good but expensive. I would give it 5 stars if it was a little less expensive. My go to for Thai is Basil Beef and Chicken Pad See Ew and Veggie Egg Rolls. I was not disappointed at all. Everything was great, hence the great reviews. I got my order to go so I didn't get the basque in the ambiance of the cute little setting and scenery that is so popular. The employees are extremely friendly. 

Everything here is great like I said before, just pretty expensive. I would just go across the street to Thai Style Noodle House and be just as happy for less money.

By far our favorite place in Vegas for Thai food. 
Incredible service, people and food of course is amazing. We 've been here few times and always enjoyed it. My wife is vegan and I am vegetarian so they altered their food as we requested and everything and every time tasted great.

When my book club suggested we try a new thai tapas place as the venue for our book discussion, my eyebrows shot up in excitement. Thai? Tapas? Two of my favs, together for the first time? The thought was blissful enough for me to trek it up to Summerlin for a taster (well, the intrigue of thai tapas and, of course, my fab book club!) Sadly, I was a bit disappointed.... but maybe it was because my expectations were set too high. 

The venue itself is a bit of a surprise... the dark, somewhat seductive decor and lighting are nice... but don't really spring to mind when you think thai tapas. 

Service was extremely slow, though the servers themselves (two servers kept trading responsibilities throughout the night) were very nice. 

The food itself was hit or miss. Hits: White Fish Cake (the dipping sauce was awesomeness), the mango coconut rice (the bomb), and a visit by the chef/owner to our table at the end of our meal. Misses: Papaya Salad (especially after tasting some of the other fantastic papaya salads that Vegas has to offer), Panko-crusted avocado, and crab wanton (oil factor was out of control).  We tried several other tapas which were MEH.  

To be fair, we went when this resto was only a few months old... so, maybe the kinks have been worked out since I dined there. I hope so because the concept itself gets 1 star!

Horrible horrible horrible horrible service. I like to think that I'm pretty patient and understanding but even this tested my patience. We came in with high hopes driving all the way from south Las Vegas to eat here. When we entered we waited about three minutes then we were seated. This is where everything starts... We waited 5 - 7 minutes for the server or anyone and nothing then a group of 3 came after us and immediately got water. We still hadn't received water or even eye contact at this point. About 13  minutes later I had to flag down the Asian busser to take our order he said he would bring the waitress again we waited and nobody came out. When the waitress went to fill the group next to us water she finally noticed we were staring at her and she came to fill our water. I had to ask her if she would take our order. So finally after all that we ordered crispy pork, crispy spinach salad, and avocado curry.. The group who came after us and ordered after us got their food. Finally when our food came it was delicious and we ate everything. But we had to flag the waitress down for EVERYTHING! Water, sauces, extra rice. Like wtf? Not even once did they come up to us and check us and make sure we were okay. We basically had to beg them to help us. Then later I asked for the check because once again nobody came to check up after they took all our plates away. I asked a white waitress for the check, then a group was next to us and water was spilt all over my purse and the group who was reviving the water. I mean that's okay but I had to clean up the water after he spilt it. Yeah.. Not cool. After another fifteen minutes of waiting for our check we had to ask another person to get it. Then we had to wait another 15 min to get our check and finish everything. I was so done by then. You guys were lucky we left I tip I felt like walking out and not paying because this was the worst service I have ever received in my life. I will not recommend this place to anyone. Food is not worth the hassle.
This place is awesome. Food service everything is on point. Try the spinach salad to die for!
Good food! Great presentation and customer service! Will definitely return and try out their other dishes!

The restaurant was clean and comfortable. The food presentation was beautiful.  And the taste was delicious!  We came in just before the dinner rush but the service was just as good, even when the restaurant filled up. The prices were reasonable and there were enough leftovers to enjoy the dinner again.

Another 5 star Thai place, in the desert!    This one is a small little place in Summerlin, but its stellar.   Great service, great food, some specialties here that are pretty yummy.   The fried shrimp with peppers is insane.  Pad Thai amazing, they have it down.  The other dishes are just sublime.  Get jiggy with it and check out Nittayas secrets....they are secret, and they work wonders for your thai loving tastebuds....mmmmm   5 star stuff here!

Wow. That is some damn tasty Thai food. 

Loved the tofu pad thai (our group of four ordered two plates!). Loved the eggplant drunken noodle. The papaya salad was crispy and refreshing. Nothing was overly sweet, which I find a little annoying at other Thai restaurants. Nice restaurant decor, too. It's an intimate place, so noise isn't a huge factor, and it's definitely good for a romantic night out. 

I only wish I could've fit more food into my already overfilled stomach. I am definitely coming back on my next Vegas trip.
I ate there for the first time last week. Excellent service nice quiet place. Great lunch specials, food was delicious and quick. Friendly staff.Ill be returning again very soon.

why would you want to keep this place a secret???

Naittaya is completely amazing. i went with some family has we had a few appetizers then each got our own meal. the fried avocado was amazing. i could have had that and left and been completely happy. but it continued. they also had some bacon wrapped items, OMG, perfection. we also got lettuce wraps which were crisp and tasty. I ended up getting the FOB (fresh of the Boat) rice. it came in a pineapple and had cashew and pineapple piece. it was delicious. my uncle and cousin got some steak that was delicious. we also got some dessert as well, they have a couple choice for ice cream and the green tea was the best in my opinion. i left completely satisfied. hoping to go back very soon.

As its name implies,Nittaya's Secret Kitchen is located in an easy to pass strip mall on Rampart near Lake Mead.

Their expanded dining area makes seating more spacious now and easier to get up and move about. Service at Nittaya's has been consistent for me for years...regardless of whether it's lunch with friends, a romantic dinner for 2, or a gatherings of a large group of people.  

On my most recent visit we ordered Red curry chicken with brown rice (+$1) and stir fried mixed vegetables with white rice from the lunch special. There are 14 dishes on the lunch specials  menu to choose from and all come with both house salad and a pot sticker for $11...a very good deal for a clean establishment, with yummy food, in a nice setting. 

As soon as you sit down, they will bring you cold, infused water with fruits and herbs...today it was with strawberry and cucumber...or you can go ahead order a glass of wine from their nice selection of wine.

I always try to make a reservation, even if it's two of us since Nittaya's Secret Kitchen's secret is out and well loved by locals. 

I thought about 5 stars for this review, but for me, it's a strong 4 stars.

Great Thai food here. It's definitely on the pricey end for Thai food but it's worth the extra couple bucks. Not he most comfortable restaurant to dine in because it's a small space, but if that doesn't bother you dine in. Otherwise their carry out is spot on. They even put items on the side that are supposed to be crunchy instead of putting it in the liquid of a dish. I enjoy their attention to detail.

Ate at our favorite Thai spot last night. Food was really good. Flavor, texture, temperature, of everything was perfect. My wife loves their lime flavored Tiger Cry steak and I love the buttery yellow curry chicken. Kids like the chicken fried rice. Very attentive and friendly service. Atmosphere is great.  It is a little bit higher priced than some of our other favorite Thai restaurants, but in this case you get what you pay for. We always pull up thinking it's closed because of the lighting and the way the front wood door looks...  well done Nittaya!

Although I love this place for its cute intimate decor, I think it's pricey. I've come twice now because friends love it. Ordered drunken noodles which wasn't bad. The pineapple fried rice was not good, too sweet for my taste. There's a basil pork dish that I really enjoyed, tasted like what I expect it to taste.

AMAZING food. We came for an early dinner, and were so delighted by everything we ordered. Spinach salad, without chicken, is crazy delicious. Mussels were gigantic and the coconut broth w/ basil was blissfully light and full of flavor. The squid salad outshines all Thai restaurants in the area. The soft-shell crab, with apple salad...dreamy!

It's a small but very well decorated spot. The menu was easy to read and went into enough detail so we weren't stuck asking 100 questions. The wine list was also very good and impressive. We sat outside in the middle of October. It wasn't very chilly when we sat, but as the night went on... It became rather cold. We asked the server to put on the heat lamps, but they were out of propane. The food was delicious. They were able to modify certain items and make them vegan for me. Everything tasted wonderful. The food did take quite some time to come out, close to 45 min. Luckily it was worth the wait. I thought perhaps they forgot us, but apparently they were just slow or backed up. My dad said the lamb was the best he has ever had. The seating was comfortable and the staff was nice for the most part. The bathroom was also clean and nicely decorated. I will definitely be back.

Nittaya's is another one of my staples I have to hit when I'm in Vegas. It really is a secret kitchen - tucked into a small shopping complex in Summerlin, it's a great place for locals to sit down for an intimate Thai dinner. The restaurant is very small, with only 6 or so low tables, a long bar that can probably sit 6 as well, and two high tables. Because of it's size, I highly recommend making a reservation. 

Their decor is spectacular and they have had many different large paintings on their back wall, I assume they change it out when it's been sold(?). I think it adds a bit of excitement to dining there, that you will typically see some new art. I can't rave enough about how much I love the atmosphere and staff at Nittaya's. It great for a date night, or dining as a family since ever dish is large enough to share.  

The food here is phenomenal! I am yet to be disappointed with anything I've ordered. I usually stick to the Pad Thai, Massaman Curry, Potstickers and Rain Forest Fried Rice. The Pad Thai always comes out spicy even though I usually ask for it more mild, so watch out for that if you're not a fan of spice. Other than that, the other dishes are normally served more mild.

Updating on my Nittaya's Secret Kitchen! I got the Fried Tofu, Phucket Poppers and Tofu Curry as my dishes. 
While I don't normally EVER order Tofu, the Fried Tofu is amazing, but I wish the Poppers had more of a kick to them. They were supposed to be quite SPICY (it had 3 little jalapenos next to them on the menu indicating their spiciness), but they fell a bit short. The Tofu curry was good though, but it also wasn't the best I've ever had. 
Overall, I still love this place. Will be back again once I'm on that side of town.

What can I possibly say about Nittaya's? Yes, it's a hidden gem. Yes, the food is SO good that I want to stand up, jump up and down, and shout to the whole world. But more so than that, it is divine. The food is perfect, and this is no exaggeration. This is the best restaurant to open off Strip in years. Worthy of note, everything on the menu, but especially the Whitefish Cake, the Lamb Chops, and the Cream Puffs. Service is outstanding, friendly, and attentive. My water glass never reached the halfway mark, and we sat on the patio. All that is left to say now is don't walk, RUN as soon as possible to Nittaya's Secret Kitchen, which as soon as word gets out, will not be so secret anymore. ;)
One of my favorite thai places in town. A little pricey, but perfect ambience for date night.  Thursday is half price bottle of wine night and I love getting different tapas. Try the spinach salad!

I love this place. Who doesn't love 1/2 price bottles of wine on Thursday. It's hard to get a table on the weekends, be prepared to get rejected if you don't make a reservation. And they are precise about their timing, don't show up 15 minutes late cause they'll let the next reservation have it. Why? Because they work hard at delivering an amazing experience and awesome food. Services is perfect here. Salmon in the Green Curry sauce is a favorite of my family. They have a small wine selection, but they've chosen them well to pair with the food. You can taste the freshness and feel the love from the staff. Keep it up, you guys are all awesome!

first time visit....small and quaint place on seats about 30-35..awesome for dating. ahi tuna was special, veggie spring rolls delicious, garlic fried rice oh so tasty. My love had the Bangkok fried rice and said it was good!! This spot was perfect except they need a tad bit of help w customer service. It was empty upon arrival. However, we were admonished for wanting to sit certain places because they were saving tables for "reservations".  Empty restaurant....paying customers on deck....no sit down...waiting for future customers...not cute.  That took away from their potential 5, but we will come back!  Fabulous presentation. So, give it a try for certain!

This place is pretty amazing.  So far I have ordered from it twice (to go) and eaten at it once. I'm hoping to eat at it again (hint hint :-)) I absolutely love the spinach salad which to me is more like spinach tempura.  I also love the Tofu Masamam Curry - I am not a big tofu person but my sister is and so I reluctantly tried this.  SO good! I have tried the Green Curry with Shrimp but it was too spicey for me (regardless I ate it but my mouth burned).  Their prices are a bit high but definitely worth it and I tend to be kind of frugal when I order food - but hey - this place is worth it.  Friendly enough staff (whenever I ordered my to gos, I chatted with the bartender) and pretty ambience - didn't take pics but it has a nice cozy feeling inside.   There is a main room with a bar then another room behind it that is bigger.  There is also wonderful art work around the restaurant by a local artist who's named I forgot (sorry) but he does beautiful and bright abstract paintings. Outdoor seating is available when the weather is nice - keep in mind that Nittaya's is in the middle of a parking lot but Nittaya's does a good job of having beautiful outdoor furniture with high surrounding bushes to distract you from that not too far places like Bank of America :-)

The Thai food here was nothing special and I expected more for the inflated prices. I stuck with the two dishes I normally order when first trying out a Thai restaurant which is pad Thai and yellow curry. The pad Thai was solid but like most Thai restaurants the chicken was chewy and dry. I wanted a yellow curry but did not see it listed on the menu so I asked the gentleman serving us. He said the yellow curry is the Massaman curry. I have been to ample Thai restaurants and have never had a Massaman curry that is yellow in color. Another thing I did not understand is why brown rice substituted for white rice that comes with an entree is the same price as a side of brown rice. This policy does not make sense and the quality and taste of the food I have tried does not warrant the high prices.

To start the food was decent once I got it .

I went to the bar to order it to go I proceeded to wait approximately 5 to 10 minutes for someone to acknowledge me. I placed my order and after waiting for 45 minutes I asked the bartender how much longer would it be he said he will go back and check he later came back and said that they were just about to make my food after 45 minutes either he forgot to put the order in or they purposely put my order at the bottom of list. 

As there was a couple next to me that ordered shortly before me but receive their food and was packing up there to go bag and paying to get ready to leave.

 Overall the customer service there was very poor I would not be visiting this establishment again I had better food with faster service in the Las Vegas area then to drive all the way to Summerlin for poor customer service
This is hands down the BEST Thai restaurant in town! The firecracker shrimp & spinach salad are amazing !!

I'm very disappointed. I drove here 40 min this evening in 5 o'clock traffic to find out when arriving they don't have high chairs at all ! Don't plan on dining here if you have a child ! Who needs to sit in a high chair ? What day in age is this ?

Have eaten here several times and everyone I bring absolutely loves it. Admittedly, restaurant is small and sometimes passing between tables is concerning, but staff is very friendly and caring.  Food plated in an absolutely stunning manner, with beautiful use of orchids and leaves.  

There are wine and sagria specials available, as well as Happy Hour.  Outdoor seating can be nice during the spring and summer seasons.

Eating tapas style is our favorite.  The pace of the meal is excellent and everything is flavorful and tasty.   Go to the restaurant's website to learn more.

So I walk in guy server walks right by me, no greeting. Lady comes to seat me because I'm waiting so long. I'm seated and waiting, another woman comes tonoffer me water with an apology. My server went to two other tables still no greeting. In fact he crosses my table to one that got to the restaurant way after me. He goes in the kitchen, back out and takes my order . Smh

The restaurant wasn't that busy, only like 5 tables filled, sooo

My food finally comes out, only for the server to take it to the wrong table  Seriously, I am writing this stuff as it happens. I can't make this stuff up.

My check comes, yep you guessed it, the guy server tells me he put in yhe incorrect server number so I will be charged twice! But dont worry because it will just fall off Let's get the service together, acknowledge your patrons.
Have I written about how expensive they are?  If not, you can go to any other Thai place in the valley and get double of what you will get here.  Check your Ferrari at the door.

I am completely enamored with this hidden jewel. It is the most contemporary quaint restaurant I have seen in Vegas. The restaurant holds about 9 tables and a tiny bar. You almost have to disturb fellow patrons when you are being seated to your table. The decor is very cute and they have art work on the walls that can be purchased. 

But, enough about the ambience. The food. Where do I even begin. The favors. The presentation. The aroma. It's all on point. This place definitely delivers a great experience. We ordered the Volcano Shrimp, Drunken Noodle, and the FOB Rice. The Volcano Shrimp was fried shrimp with Serrano peppers and a delicious sweet sauce. The shrimp arrive to your table on fire. Such a cute and fun presentation. The Drunken Noodles were noodle with chicken and basil. This dish has just the right amount of spice to it. Lastly, the FOB Rice was similar to fried rice but it had pineapple and cashews. I have always wanted to try this but thought that the cashews AND pineapple would throw everything off. Man, was I wrong. The presentation of this dish was absorbable! The rices was placed in the shell of a pineapple. For dessert we had the bread pudding. Simply delicious!
Interesting menu and tasty, but has small portions that are overpriced. No exaggeration.

I had eaten here years ago and was honestly not impressed but I was convinced to give it one more try and I'm so glad I did!  Everything was cooked and seasoned  to perfection. The one down side is that it's pricier than most other Thai restaurants BUT you're paying for the atmosphere so it makes it worth it. It's quiet and relaxing in this restaurant, something most other Thai places aren't. On top of that the servers are friendly and helpful. I will definitely be back again.
Cute mellow date night type of scene. Food was great and the Plum wine is a must have!

The food is awesome and a great place to both casual dine and have a classy get together. Their far and away best dish is there Kao Soi. It's just as good reheated in the microwave as it is there- delicious chunks of pork marinated in a beautiful sauce. Also, their charred shishito peppers are so cool and fun. The peppers are like a little lottery system - there's a small chance you might get a super spicy one! They're addictive and delicious. Their Thai donuts are also quite good. Overall, this restaurant is great for almost every occasion with delicious choices for appetizers, entrees, and desserts.

A group of us decided to try Nattaya's for Happy Hour. We found upon arrival that the Happy Hour menu for restricted to the bar seating. Since sitting at the bar is not conducive to group conversation we decided on table seating. 

The dining room is small and cozy. Seating is very comfortable. The walls are nicely decorated with art. The room was very conversation friendly. 

The menu has many choices of tapas as well as full size entrees.  Our server Josh was helpful in explaining the choices as well as his personal favorites.
We started with several tapas: 
Chicken Satay with a peanut sauce
Garlic Edamame which was a larger portion
Secret Stickers served with a side cup of soy sauce
Volcano Shrimp served in a bowl of sauce with sliced jalapeños

The entrée was Basil Chicken which was served in a platter along with a large bowl of rice. Also a large House salad with mixed greens, cucumber and onions.

All of the choices were perfectly prepared and had great flavor. 

The wine prices are a little high but on Thursdays bottles are half priced and is the way to go.

So disappointed, this was my second visit, the first time was great. This time the food was cold and the noodles in the pad Thai weren't cooked enough and we're almost crunchy. Two entrees and a pot of tea: over $50, so not worth it.

My fiancee, Amy and I have been coming to Nittaya for a long time because the food is outstanding!! However, tonight was even more special because of the absolutely outstanding service we received!! Our server, Zack (sorry if I misspelled) was outstanding!! He was very attentive to our needs and was always there to assist us. We told him at the table and I will say it again here that he is the best server we have ever had at Nittaya. Everyone should DEFINITELY request Zack!!

Also, we definitely have to thank Josh who works behind the bar. Like Zack, he was also very attentive and checked to make sure we were enjoying our wine and our experience. Josh and Zack are both extremely nice and humble guys who really cared to make sure we had an awesome experience!! I have to say that Amy and I visit a lot of restaurants and the service we had tonight is some of the BEST WE HAVE EVER HAD!! Thank you so much to Zack and Josh for a job well done. You both are amazing at what you do! Oh, and I also have to shout out Gus because he did a great job, too!! BRAVO!!!!

Was looking at apartments in the area and stumbled upon this little gem. 
When i first walked in, my initial thought was... "ah man... just another mediocre americanized/fusion thai place" but boy was I wrong. 

The pad thai here was great. It had lots of flavor and had good sizable portions. The green curry was a bit more on the bland side but the chicken in the curry was juicy and tender. I would skip the curry next time and stick with the pad thai. 

The service was great and there was at least 2 or 3 waitresses making sure we were good at all times. Most of the people here were a part of the older crowd with a few young people sprinkled in. 

All in all, a nice little restaurant to stop by for a date or if you are showing people around. I happened to be lucky and was able to snag a table before the dinner rush, but I would suggest making reservations beforehand.

Love this little quiet spot!!!! Tapas/appetizers are boss!!! Definitely one of our favorite "date night" spots. World famous spinach salad the best! Thai wings... Yum... Lemongrass soup...heaven... Coconut ice cream... Hit the spot Service is perfect.... Amazing job Nittaya!!!!!

This is one of my favorite places to eat at!  I have loved all of the dishes I have tried and their red sangria is amazing!  Not too sweet and just perfect.  I would recommend to anyone that likes Thai food!
Food was amazing!! I would order stuff with the intent in sharing. The food portions are very generous. You have to order the fried spinach and the off the boat rice!

Liked it. 

Super small place. Sat at the bar (didn't make reservations). Overall service was good. Food was great. Didn't really care for the Thai chicken wings but the mussels were delicious. 

What we had
Thai chicken wings
Mussels
Ahi tuna
Bacon wrapped shrimp

Over all good. I will be back. Bedtime with a reservation. Lol.

Nittaya's is very good, but with Thai food price is very important to me.  I don't think any dish should ever be more than $12 unless there's crab or duck or some expensive protein in there.  You can find outstanding Thai food in Chinatown or Eastside for less than $20 for a full meal.  At Nittaya's you struggle to find an item on the menu for less than $20.  Even the salads are almost $15.  

Now that I got the price issue out of the way, I'll say that the venue is quite nice and romantic.  The staff is great and there is even a nice outdoor area.  The food was hit or miss for me. The chicken panang curry was outstanding.  But the bok choy wasn't even cut in the dish.  The chef just threw an entire piece of vegetable, root and all, into the dish so we had to cut it ourselves.  The dish could also have been better with more veggies and less chicken in my opinion, but it was tasty nonetheless.  The papaya salad was a nice dish and had a good kick.  The drunken noodles with chicken were fresh.  The chicken had a nice larb taste to it and the noodles were slimy as I like them.

I don't think I'll be back.  Way too expensive when I can go to Chada, Arawan, Lotus, etc. and get a better quality meal for 2/3 of the price.

This place is dope af.  Im stuck on the avocado skirt steak curry, that gets the 5 stars all on its own. The crying tiger app was great also.  Have had the bacon wrapped shrimp, chili lime squid (?) and pork belly. Those were good but nothing crazy.  Try the first two dishes i mentioned and youll be set.

Reservations for dinner time, small place.

A Thai friend and I decided to try this joint out since it received such good reviews.  We went at around 5 pm expecting the dinner crowd but to our surprise there were only 7 people total in this place.  

This place is so small that the person sitting the farthest away can hear your conversation.  If you have any form of Claustrophobia, please stay away.  The decor is very dark, but suitable for a wine/beer bar.   This may be considered "hole in the wall", but its nothing close to that description.  Its located at Rampart & Lake Mead which has huge plazas at all four corners and a lot of traffic.

The wait staff was 2 young White males who had the attitudes of, "what time is it, and when can I go home?"  But what can u expect from kids who have no idea what customer service is about.  The other was a young Asian female who took our order.  She was very nice, but the language barrier came into play when asking questions.

The Food:

We had to try this "famous" spinach salad.  Ummm people, its fried battered spinach with a salsa sauce that tastes like the dressing for papaya salad.  Only in 'Merica can we take something healthy and ruin it.  Think of potato chips and dip people, there is no "Salad". 
 

My entree was Green Curry, vegan.  I asked for more veggies since im not eating any expensive animal protein.  That was not the case or (language barrier).  It tasted like plastic and was basically a bowl of bamboo shoots.  There was only 7 little pieces of bell pepper in it.  Why am I paying 15$ for this again?  When I asked the waitress about it, she got very defensive/annoyed, and did not even try to see my point of view.  I also chose brown rice (which is an extra charge) but it was too mushy. (Used too much water cooking it).  

My friend's entree was pad-Z-U, vegan, which was just as bad.  Swamped in oil even after asking to use smallest amount of oil.  Very little veggies that had no flavor.  it was also too spicy for her, but then again they never asked.

They never asked us how spicy we wanted the dishes...wow seriously?

THEY ARE NOT VEGAN FRIENDLY!

We did find out Nittaya's Secret though!  Its called charging a fortune for low quality bastardized Thai food...and then retire and laugh at all you suckers!


The prices are just silly...I dont mind paying 15$ for green Curry if everything is organic, but for a small bowl of spicy plastic, no thanks.  I just wanna know why am I paying this price?

Oh the "Tapas" ripoff idea....yeah so their tapas (very small) portions are the same price as a normal size entree from any other asian foodie place.  There is no reason to pay these prices.

WARNING: Although we voiced our concerns to the waitress and we only ate a few bites of each item, they never offered to to remove them from the bill (other than the mushy brown rice) which tells me they are all about the dollar.  They just don't seem to care

Most other Thai takeout is way better than this place.  Quality of food, service, and price.

Met up here with some fellow brokers for a work lunch, and I love the place. I tried the Crying Tiger Rib-Eye steak, and I loved it! Meat was cooked more on the rare side (it's the only way to eat meat right?), and it was fantastic! I thought the prices may have been a little steep per quantity served, but perhaps maybe that's just me being a typical over-eating American.

Also, love how they decorated the place. Creativity always counts! I'll be back for sure. Next time I'll probably hang out at the bar and check out some of their cocktails. Until next time!

The food here is AMAZING.  Haven't tried anything on the menu I didn't love.

Tiny but very pretty restaurant so I recommend getting a reservation.  But this place is all about the food.  Love, love, love, I go anytime possible.

And everyone must try the Spinach Salad.  It's not a salad - it's too much deliciousness to be a salad.

The love for Nittaya's is above and beyond. This quaint thai restaurant nestled in Summerlin is well worth the experience. The food, people, atmosphere, experience are superb. 

The spinach salad- NEXT LEVEL good.
The Avocado thai Salmon- dream worthy
Everything else- excellent. 

Keep up the great work Nittaya's!

I came here a few months ago for a pick up order in the evening. The lad who took my order was nice and very helpful, as I was trying to make wise food choices for being a Nat noob. Upon his recommendations and my own inclinations, I ordered the bacon wrapped shrimp with mango sauce, red curry, and pad Thai (had to, it's my guiding light for Thai food judgement). Total: $43.24. Bam.

The space is cozy and intimate, and you can tell it's a local's spot. When I walked in at precisely 9.54 pm to pick up my order, there were 3 people seated away from each other at the bar area, chatting away. Very cool. It kind of reminded me of DW Bistro.

On to the fooood.

Bacon shrimp was not as awesome as I thought it would be. I couldn't taste the shrimp, but I certainly got the texture of chewy shelled animal. The bacon was good because bacon is always good. Mango sauce? Good not great, not particularly sweet. I was expecting a great flavor, something like a bacon wrapped date gives you. But this one was lacking in the flavor and texture department.

Pad Thai was very yummy. Great flavors, just enough heat, and plenty of chicken and egg to beef it up. I also appreciate that it didn't have that weird red dye color from the sauces most places use. Yay for quality ingredients!

The curry was overwhelmingly spicy. It overpowered the delicious coconut and spices underneath, of which I caught glimpses. It had a nice mix of bamboo shoots and red bell peppers. The jasmine rice it came with smelled divine and tasted great with the curry. No weird hard bits. They know how to make rice.

I would certainly go back.
Looks good, smells good, tastes good! We had the full experience here and everything from the water to the wine to the starters to the entrees was wonderful. Will be back!

We were in town visiting friends and looking for an amazing Thai restaurant and this hit the spot dead on!

This place was delicious. All the appetizers to main courses had delicious flavors and had the right amount of spice.

The service was great as well. They continued to check on us and asked if we needed anything which is what I expect from any type of customer service. We will definitely come back the next time we are in town.

Best Thai food I've ever had; and I eat Thai food almost every day. Their Secret Stickers are amazing. I'm obsessed with the Avocado Salmon Curry and Pineapple Fried Rice. Soooo good. I crave it all the time and my mouth is watering writing this.

Great atmosphere, crab wontons and shrimp wrapped bacon on the tapas menu are delisious! Drinks also, one of the best neighborhood happy hours. Bartender is friendly and on the ball serving drinks and some awesome cucumber-lemon water!

This place was amazing. Decor and atmosphere are very fun. The waitress was very helpful in us picking a wine we like and even brought us some samples! The appetizers were great and the salmon avocado green curry is to die for!!!

We always love this place!!!
It's a small and cozy environment and the food is fresh and delicious!!

Horrible !!!!! We Spent my birthday dinner at this establishment even made reservations AND they were informed before hand this was my birthday   . I WILL NEVER DINE HERE AGAIN ! When I presented a $25 dollar dining certificate from Restaurant.com ( it was purchased a few years back but clearly  states it never expires)  , they refused it and came back with a manager. The manager called it for lack of better words COUNTERFEIT! Called a crook on my birthday...  fabulous. The worst part is, my husband and I  have spent many a birthday and anniversary here and have even closed the place down drinking and eating 100 year old
Eggs ( Thai delicacy ) with the owner a few times in the past . This looks to be a case of a place growing too big to care about where they are from and their original customers . I understand policies change however , if you were involved with a 3rd party business during the years purchased it should still be valued. And if NOT something else should have been offered .. I asked if their was anything they could do and they denied ... I then said I wouldn't back and they didn't care. DISGUSTED. Happy birthday to me .  Angry !!

Looking it up I thought it would be a lower-end Asian restaurant but Nittaya took me by surprise at how fancy they were.

The water they serve was infused with Strawberry and another fruit (can't remember). I could taste it a little in the first sip, but ultimately it's just iced water. Still, it was refreshing 

Half off bottles of wine on Thursday evenings; if I wasn't leaving the city that night I would've taken them up on it!

All the menu items sounded really good and authentic. Prices are slightly higher than normal but their lunch specials are really good deals (salad, a potsticker, and your entrée for only $11). After eating their lunch, I want to say their prices are justified. I guess I'll have to come back again to find out.

Service was also very good, water was refilled consistently and staff was very friendly.

I got the drunken noodles which came out with a small flower, cute. Flavor was solid, and meat was great. The chicken was minced into small bits, it was juicy and full of flavor; I almost thought it was pork! My only gripe is their spiciness is toned way down. I wanted it to be super spicy like many Thai dishes are so I bumped up the spiciness level to 4 (normally one). Unfortunately it was only a ~2 in terms of heat in my opinion. Besides that, this place was a terrific choice for a nice lunch.

Steak avocado curry amazing. Service was awesome and spinach salad amazing as well.  This place blows Lotus of Siam away!  You have to try this gem.  Probably get a reservation as the place is pretty small
Food delicious and exquisite.  Very clean.  Service very cordial. Thumbs Up!!

I hate to give only two stars but it's way over priced for the quality and quantity good you are getting. Plus the past two times we ordered to pick up. We ordered no heat & it's like they purposely made it extra spicey, so it was a huge waste of $$ past two times.
Bummer because this was a family favorite since the day she opened.
There is a great hole in the wall Thai place rampart/lake mead area by smiths!! Check it out!!

This is my absolute favorite restaurant in the Summerlin area bar none.  Nittaya's Thai food is exquisite.  The decor is lovely and the service is always good.  This was the first place I ever experienced dishes such green papaya salad, seafood prepared in a coconut husk, seafood madness or "spinach salad."  I could never be satisfied at a run of a mill restaurant such as Archie's again.  Pad thai and yellow curry seem so boring now!

Wow this place is amazing. It's a small hidden place located in Summerlin. It's so hard to find a delicious authentic Thai food, I love Thai food but most places I've been, I don't usually go back because they are not very clean. This place is just very clean, great fresh food and beautifully served. The detail is everything when they serve the meal. They are always very busy so make sure to make a reservation before going. (Not very cheap) If your a Thai food lover then it's a must try!
Delicious food and friendly staff. If you're in this part of town and want Thai food, this is the place.
Quiet, small, intimate restaurant. Dishes were yummy, not disappointed.  They have a lunch special which is more than enough, but we wanted to try out other dishes, so I'm over stuffed.

I came here for dinner solo and enjoyed myself quite a bit (I am good company!)
The garlic rice was delicious. Very very tasty. I would absolutely get that again.
Very flavorful, and the rice was cooked perfectly. I also ordered the steak skewers. Eh, wasn't super impressed with them. The flavor was Ok, but I guess it was the cut of beef they used. 
Service was excellent. Menu seemed a touch pricey however, l will return to try some other stuff again.

Arawan has been my favorite Thai restaurant for a while but I think I have a new favorite.

We ordered:
Chicken Satay
Chicken pad thai
Mussels 
Garlic rice
Mango and sticky rice

We didn't leave anything on our plates lol. Everything was so amazing. My favorite thing was the garlic rice and it was paired perfectly with the mussels! The broth on the mussels was so good by itself.

I would come here again and again and again. The decor is cute, food is great, and the service was good.

I didn't think I'd find a massaman curry better than the one at Chada Thai. But, I did at Nittaya's Secret Kitchen. Located in a small strip mall on Rampart, this is definitely no secret. If you come on the weekend be prepared for a long wait. The interior is tiny with tables too close together and a bar area that has almost no separation from the dining room. The massaman curry ($16) is excellent, as is their "World famous" spinach salad ($11). Crispy, light tempura batter covers a heaping mound of spinach. Add the chicken  and lime dressing to it and it's unforgettable. For more subtle flavors, the coconut soup ($9) is the way to go with a thin, smooth broth bathing chunks of chicken, tomatoes and mushrooms.

If you can get a table, dining at this modern Thai place is worth the trip to the westside suburbs. It may not get the press that other popular Thai places get, but they are more than capable of challenging the heavy hitters in town for the title of best Thai restaurant.

Went to this place for lunch today and I am glad I did! This place is really a secret because it took me about 5-10 minutes of driving around the parking lot to find the place. The restaurant name is small so it is easy to miss, but place is located on the corner of the plaza with the dry cleaners. 

Upon walking in, I was impressed with the decor and atmosphere. This place has a more upscale feel to it compared to other Thai restaurants. Kind of reminds me of a winery (and they do have quite the selection of white and red wine!). 

I ended up ordering the massaman curry with chicken (I don't think you get to change the meat, but I didn't mind) which came with a small salad and one vegetable potsticker. The salad was really good because of the light dressing and the ingredients were a nice change from just the standard iceberg lettuce with carrots (they actually had cucumbers and some other veggies). The potsticker was really fresh and I really liked how the outer shell was crispy which gave a nice contrast to the contents. My curry was really good as well. The potatoes were fresh and had a strong flavor which I haven't really experienced in other restaurants. The chicken was nice and moist (not chewy like some other places) and the serving was pretty good considering the quality as well. I also ordered a glass of thai tea which was pretty good, but not the best that I've had.

Overall I would definitely recommend checking this place out. It has a nice, intimate atmosphere and the staff are really nice and attentive. Their water is also fancy! Today the water was infused with strawberry and some other fruit which I thought was pretty neat. I will be back to try some of the other dishes! 

FYI, the lunch specials are around $11 which is a couple of bucks more than other places, but it is worth it! Do it and treat yourself.

Visited for dinner on a Thurs night. We chose to sit outside, as the weather was nice. The restaurant is very small, but I didn't feel that the tables were too crowded. We ended up ordering about 8 different tapas, and they were all delicious! The one standout was the tempura spinach. I didn't even know there was such a thing! It was light, crunchy, delicious, and worked really well. I will be back.

Have been here twice. So good. The go to place if you want great Thai food and a great experience. Always super busy. Make reservations. A little pricey but quality and well worth it. You will not be disappointed.
Excellent food and service, amazing place! Try the Spinach Salad, pad thai and Kai soi.

One of the best Thai restaurants you will ever find in Las Vegas,everything is good here and the owner and employers are very friendly and attentive to everything,the service is top!Just eat the young coconut curry my God so delicious.Thank you everyone I appreciate the great food and service :)

It's a cute, cozy romantic place in my opinion. My boyfriend and I came here for lunch today. We saw this place last night when we were at the French restaurant nearby. We love tapas so he surprised me by taking me to this place today.

We had three small dishes: Golden Pouches that's potatoes inside an egg pastry with curry sauce, the potatoes was fresh and I like the curry sauce;  E-Saan Sausage which is pork sausage with lemongrass in it. I love the crispy pork belly. The pork belly was quite different the way they were prepared. It had a thicker breading but nonetheless they were so crispy and mouth watering.

The service was good. 
We also enjoyed the hot teas. They have a separate hot menu so don't forget to check it out. They also have happy hour from 3-6, and half priced select bottles on Thursdays.

The only drawback is the place is very small with tables so close next to each other. We could hear all the conversation to our dislike. Anyhow, we enjoyed our lunch and experience.

Stopped in here for lunch and got their chicken Pad Thai lunch special.  It came with a pot sticker, a small side salad with this fantastic vinaigrette, a nice size portion of Pad Thai.  I also had a glass of Riesling to round out my lunch.

While it was nice outside and they have patio seating I sat at the bar for lunch.  Service was quick and pleasant.  Before I even ordered the bar tender had poured me a glass of their strawberry and cucumber infused water.   My order was taken and he poured me a little carafe of the wine and then poured half into the glass leaving the rest next to the glass.  The dumpling came out first and was a nice start.  the salad came out next closely followed by the main dish.

The only complaint I had was that the Pad Thai had a little too much soy sauce in it but it was still good.  I can definitely see myself coming back and trying some of the tapas and some more wine.

This place is a hidden gem in Summerlin, seating is a little cramped but that's what gives it quirky appeal. The Thai cuisine was amazing, with a Asian fusion twist. 
 
A+on the cool 'secret door', love it!!!

I just recently heard about this place and have been here once a week since. The first was with friends who recommended it, the second was with coworkers I recommended it to and the third was to pick up take out for my partner who has not eaten here yet. 

I am giving them 5 Stars not only for their delicious and incredibly flavorful food or the great atmosphere but specifically for their impeccable customer service. 

Tonight, after coming home and checking my take out order, I realized they had forgotten the dressing for the spinach salad (which I highly recommend). The dressing that comes with this salad is one of the best things on the menu and so I called to let them know it had been forgotten. I explained that it was a 40 minute drive round trip and coming back wasn't possible so this restaurant had one of their servers drive to my home to bring it to me! I have never experienced such a service! Thank you Nittaya's for making sure my order was right and going above and beyond. 

The drunken noodles, pad Thai, chicken satay, pineapple fried rice, chicken Panang, Thai donuts and mango sticky rice are all on my list of things you should try! 

I'll be returning soon!

This was the first and most likely the last time I would visit this place..When we first walked in there wasn't a host stand, very few tables and extremely tight..The look we received from the 4 people that were there and from the staff was very unwelcoming just because we had two young ones with us..it's like they were all judging us just because we weren't dressed up all fancy and had kids..One of the staff finally came up to us and asked if we had reservations and we said no..they were able to seat us right away which was nice..The server came over and he was informative about the menu and seemed pretty chipper..the busser on the other hand was extremely rude..While pouring our waters, ice cubes and water was going all over the table..Our food was as follows:

Spinach salad - something different..it was pretty good and probably the only good thing we ordered
Chicken satay-4 skewers stabbed in a pineapple..very bland
Lamb chops - tender but way too heavy on the sauce
Tamarind shrimp - tasted nothing like tamarind..more like shrimp in fish sauce
Garlic rice - it was decent
Bread pudding - I don't thing it was made with bread at all..had more of a rice consistency,  too dense and no flavor..The homemade coconut ice cream was made with too much water..it wasn't creamy at all, more icy because there was too much crystallization. Also had a piece of hair but we just let it go

$100 for a couple of tapas, one small entree, and a dessert. I wish I could say it was worth it but it wasn't. To say that they're fine dining is a joke. I work in the hospitality industry at a 5 star resort on the strip and our cafe people has better standards and much better personalities than these people. To the arrogant busser who hit my hand while clearing the plates the I so neatly stacked for you just because you're too good to say a word to us like "pardon my reach" or anything along those lines, you suck! To all of the snooty people who give dirty looks when children are around: children are not a disease so please don't treat them like one..I'm sure each and every person was an annoying little child at some point in their life..Some even stay annoying in their old age..The only good thing I can say good about this place was the server faked being nice to us just enough to make me not flip out while there.

I had never even heard of this place until we were specifically looking for Thai food one night nearby. I was really pleasantly surprised by how cute and intimate the setting was and how delicious and diverse the food items were as well. They have a good selection of beer and wine and I found their prices to be affordable for a pretty nice restaurant. I think it would be a perfect date night spot or even just a place for a casual weekday dinner or drinks.

My wife and I found this place a few years ago and always make it a mandatory stop anytime we're in Vegas.  It's small without a lot of tables, but we've never had any problems getting in with large parties . . . even up to 11.  I don't have the menu in front of me, so I may get some of the names wrong, but these dishes are always on our list...chicken satay for the kids...they even love the peanut sauce.  Garlic rice and the pineapple rice.  The coconut soup is awesome and all the other chicken and beef dishes have never disappointed.  Hopefully the Secret Kitchen will always be a secret...

Interesting decor , good foods. I enjoyed every dishes at the restaurant. But the only things that disappointed me was the coconut ice cream dessert. In the menu it say " coconut ice cream for family " so I thought it big or at least good for family like it said but it didn't . One plain coconut on the white plate ..if they just add  one flower on the coconut or an small Umbrella will make it look better. Little bit ice cream ( it's alright ) and sweet rice on the bottom ..it cost $13-$16 ( don't remember the price ) so OVER PRICE for just that. Everything else was perfect.

I love Thai food and I eat it a lot. I love Nittaya's. Service is friendly, food is absolutely amazing, and ambiance is nice and secluded. I would have never expected this place to be located in a Starbucks parking lot. Honestly addicted to their spicy garlic edamame! Love it here! By far my favorite Thai spot.

Food is excellent.   Service on most days is great.  However I came on a week where they sat us outside.   Service was horrible,  waiters rarely showed up, food was slow to get to our table and wrong order was given.   Servers was guessing which table ordered what.  It could be an off night or new employees.  Will come back maybe they can redeem themselves.

My girlfriend and I needed a girl's night out. I had never been here but had read good reviews.  It was a small place with less then 15 tables and a bar area. There is a tapas menu as well as a dinner menu.  We arrived around 4:45pm on a Friday evening- they did ask if we had a reservation (we didn't) but they said they could seat us anyways. 

They wine menu is not large, but some well chosen bottles. They started us with a strawberry cucumber water- very unexpected and refreshing drink.  We ordered a bottle of wine and some tapas plates to try different things since everything sounded good. We ended up with the garlic edamame, secret dumplings, Phuket poppers and steak skewers.  The garlic edamame were phenomenal.  I foresee ordering these for takeout often!!  The steak was good- nothing to write home about and the dumplings and poppers were delicious.  The portions were good size for tapas, but we still decided we wanted something a little more. We ordered the Pad Z U (pad see eww) from the dinner menu. It was delicious as well.  

The edamame was reason alone to come back, but the dishes that others ordered look delicious as well.  Thrilled to have found this hidden gem of a restaurant and look forward to my next visit!!

Nitayyas is one of our favorite places however, last night left much to be desired.  The person that waited on us did not present the service we are accustom to receiving at Nittaya's.  We did overhear him as he advised other patrons that he is the manager, if that was the case why was he semi-serving us?
It was ok. I order the lunch red curry chicken and it was mostly bamboo strips. The pour of draft beer was mostly foam. Don't plan on going back anytime soon.

Nattaya's never fails to be amazing.  Simply put, this is the best Thai food in Las Vegas!  My favorites are the spinach salad, crying tiger steak, avocado salmon.... and there is a special "off-menu" item that is made with clear noodles which may be the best thing at the entire restaurant.  Also, the soups and salads are amazing - particularly the lemongrass chicken soup.  Thursday's evenings are a bonus since wine bottles are 50% off!
And I'm not sure how below reviews say service is not outstanding; I've always received top-notch service at Nattaya's.

Great amostohere but kinda of dark.
Service is always on point.  Fresh infused water with fruit/herb every day
The avocado steak if AWESOME
The spinach salad is great but it's more like spinach tempura vs a salad, salad.
Spice level is only 1-5. So if you like super spicy you will be disappointed, but you can ask for the spice tray which has sambal, siracha, and cayenne pepper blend

Great place! We come here frequently, it's pretty much our go to in mid/north Vegas. The service can be slow if they are min manned but generally it's great. I recommend calling on weekends to see if there is a wait, weekdays are best. Also get the spinach salad and tapas! All are absolutely excellent! The currys and entres are great too!

Tapas were good, ambience great, i love the rustic/vintage theme of the restaurant. I just didnt like the Seafood Madness but i have yet to try their other main entrées. Im gonna bring my friends next time.

Sooooooo yummy!!!! 
Great vibes and atmosphere! Even better food, and I love the location. It's not to go for a nice a date, however it is on the smaller side so I wouldn't suggest large groups... 
but very very very good! 
They serve us fruit infused water to start, the famous spinach salad, 1 lamb entree and 1 salmon. Overall fantastic experience! And I will be returning!
Amazing food great service,  and wine specials that are priced so well, you will buy the bottle.

My girlfriend and I had an amazing meal at Nittaya's once again. We shared the Tempura Spinach and two wonderful entree's. The avocado ribeye and cashew shrimp. What a delicious combination to share and the service was excellent.

Just like their name, Nittaya's Secret Kitchen is a hidden restaurant that not a lot of people know about. I didn't know about this place for a long time until I found it on Yelp, probably because this part of town is not known to have a good selection of restaurants. My girlfriend and I were so impressed with the restaurant, we went back within a week. 
They serve fusion Thai cuisine. They have well-known Thai dishes like Pad Thai and some non-Thai dishes with their own twists. Either way, we enjoyed every dish that we ordered. Unlike a typical Thai restaurant, they pay a lot of attention on the food presentation too. Every dish comes out beautifully decorated. 
The service was awesome. Because it was our first time, we needed some help with ordering. Fortunately, the waitress was extremely helpful. She recommended some food with wine, and we literally like everything. She stopped by at our table a few time to make sure that we are good. It was a pleasant experience.
The restaurant is relatively small. It's better to make a reservation before you go. My reservation was at 6 P.M., and the restaurant was already almost fully occupied. The music is on the louder side, but not annoying at all. I don't think it's a good place to take kids because you have limited space for highchairs. It's a great place for a date though. 
You should definitely try Nittaya's Secret Kitchen!

Came here to dinner with great friends and the food was awesome! Had appetizers, the spinach was great. Then had spicy basil, spicy catfish, Papaya salad and they were all amazing. If you're lucky enough to get a table you're going to live it.
This intimate location has become one of my favorites. The presentation and quality of the food is excellent. The bartender staff could be more personable but the overall environment is good.
Great tapas and great lunch specials.  This is a nice little hideaway with great ambiance and great food.  I recommend the lettuce wraps and the green curry with chicken.

The BF and I went here for date night last week and we had a great experience. This restaurant is located in our neighborhood and so we thought we would give it a try. The ambiance is well decorated, cozy and nice. Good for a dinner where you'd like to have conversation and not have to talk loudly. We had the deep fried spinach salad which lived up to the hype of being a signature dish here. We split that as an appetizer, and we ordered the Kow Soi noodle entree. Our server mentioned that the entrees are big, so that should be enough for the both of us. And she was right. This entree was HUGE! Prices were a little more than your average Thai place, but you get your money's worth. We were too full for dessert but the items looked great. 

The only area of improvement I would suggest is that in the main dining room there is a huge chalkboard mentioning happy hour, yet we were told it was only available in the bar area. I would suggest maybe not posting it in the dining room as we were confused as why it would be in there and not maybe featured near the bar area. Just my two cents. Happy hour ends at 6pm and when we asked at our table they mentioned it was over and only in the bar. (The time was 5:50pm). Again, just a preference to ensure a great dining experience. Other than that, it was really good and we can't wait to come back.

If there is any one cuisine that I would say I could be considered a reputable critic on, it would have to be Thai food.  My fiancé and I visit at least once a year and I lived there for a short time a couple years ago, while doing a scuba diving internship.  I've taken a coupe cooking classes  there as well, with a wonderful teacher named Miss Ya.  I'm very fond of a couple dishes that I learned during my first course, one is one of the spiciest dishes there is....PAPAYA SALAD!  And seems to be showing up on more and more on menus here in Vegas recently and the other is Massaman Curry, and we get both almost every time we eat Thai.  

After reading about this place in the Weekly and then reading the reviews on here, I've been wanting to go.  Two of my favs, Thai & Tapas, YEA!  Our first impression, like a few others have mentioned, is that the decor was a little off.  After careful consideration, we decided that we should offer to donate some of our Thai artwork, perhaps in exchange for some food, lol! 

Anyway, here's what we got:
Papaya salad- my fiancé even commented on it being quite authentic
Lemongrass soup- was pretty tasty, but I needed to spice it up some more with leftover papaya salad juice :-))
Massaman Curry- we both thought it was savory and had very good quality ingredients.  Although it could've been spicier and we were never asked what level of spiciness we wanted on anything.
Spinach Salad - I had to save the best for last even though we ate this before the curry.  It was simply AMAZING!  If you go here, you have to get this!  SERIOUSLY, this is not to be missed!    

Overall, the food was all pretty darn good and I will definitely call in orders, but the atmosphere is a little funky, however we'll see if we can't help change that :-).   

Oh yeah, I almost forgot, I LOVE the fact that they serve fruit infused water, nice touch!

My #1 fav place! I know it's selfish and wrong of me to think about not telling people how great this little restaurant is, in fear of not getting a table, but that  would be so wrong of me.  So you should know that everything is great but I especially love the crispy spinach salad and the salmon with avocado sauce!

So this is actually a nice little restaurant i would recommend to everyone I know especially knowing a lot of ppl that would of enjoyed the food but I'm not because I had a bad first impression and I wouldn't want what I experienced  to happen to anyone else especially since everyone I know goes out in big groups. Tonight I came with my family for dinner a group of 14 ppl , while everyone was already almost done eating I was the only one still waiting on my food as they brought me my food I asked them if i can take it to go  since everyone was already done . There apology was donuts I didn't even get to eat my food and they gave me donuts so basically I get donuts instead of my steak to eat . I'm not that type that expects things for free but my family thought that was really bad customer service and that they should have at least comped that one meal instead they came up to me a took the food back after it was packaged for me to take. When they were asked so what are you gonna do with the food they said "well the owner will take it home " when we asked to speak to her they said she wasn't gonna come out . All we really wanted was an explanation on why that even happened and to at least hear it from her but that's not what we got so I just hope that this doesn't happen to any else and they see this review as something to help them not make the same mistake .

Very very delicious soft shell crab apple salad & amazing coconut shrimps!!! As for noodles, I loved their pad thai but their drunken noodle was okay (I'd like it a bit more spicy). But really, this place had a great servers & ambience, so I highly recommend this place to others!
Great quality, flavor and presentation! A very cozy location.  It's must if you're in the area.

Found another hole-in-the-wall in town I like!

Came here for a work dinner, and was a bit surprised that it only had about 6 tables, very small. Intimate and contemporary ambiance with a nice fully stocked bar off to one side of the restaurant. We ordered an appetizer and 2 entrees and shared. The food was hands down Thai Fusion done right. The avocado curry was amazing, not something you will find in Thailand but nevertheless very delicious.

Our Thai waitress was very sweet and attentive, and so was the bartender who served our drinks. Our dinner came out to be a bit over $100 for 2 people.

One of the best Thai places in the world! The unique twist on some of those dishes leave your mouth full of confusion yet completely satisfied. The flavors, presentation, portions and service top notch! Next time I'm visiting Vegas I'll definitely find the time to grab drinks and delicious Thai Tapas.

A few weeks after our initial visit, we came back and ordered takeout. which took 30 min after placing our order, Food was still amazing and 2 dishes was plenty to share with 2-3 people and have leftovers.  The fact they do take out this quickly is a game changer. It wasn't too much more than ordering take-out from another place that focuses on take-out/delivery.  If you don't have the time to dine-in or want something catered, I would highly recommend trying take-out. It'd be hard to find quality this good at most take-out places.

This is Thai food elevated to the next level. When you enter, it doesn't really have a Thai look at all, but it is still great, authentic Thai food. What really makes this place different is that they serve tapas, which are what the real stars of the menu. You order a bunch of little things and you will still end up full. We got the Volcano shrimp, which come to you on fire, the Spinach salad, which is just tempura fried spinach with a life sauce, the garlic ribs, the Pineapple fried rice, which is served in a scooped out pineapple, the chicken satay, and the curry potato puffs. I also got the Thai iced tea, which I think is one of the best drinks in the world. All in all, the restaurant had a great interior, great food, friendly staff, and I will come again.

Wasn't really a fan of their food. The actual restaurant is cute but that's it. We went for lunch and I wasn't impressed. I ordered my soup spicy and it was so mild my baby ate it. My husband ordered the pad Thai and it seemed watered down. We will not be returning.

I don't really eat Thai food but this was my friends lunch pick & it was a great one! I had the Pad Thai chicken noodle lunch special. Came with a small salad & pot sticker. Salad was ok, the pot sticker was amazing! The pad Thai chicken noodles was really good! A little sweet.
Chicken well cooked. Very flavorful! I also tried my friends fried rice, yum! The service here was excellent.
Very attentive. I'd absolutely come back!
Wish they had a LUNCH MENU!!! Would come all the time if it was more affordable to lunch here with my girlfriends

We decided to get the heck off of the strip for our last evening meal.  Best decision ever made.

We found Nittaya's based on decent Yelp reviews, hubby's choice, and he hit it out of the ball park again. (so far, all of his out-of-town Yelp food picks have been winners so I suppose I'll keep him around!)

Bulletted thoughts:
-Super tiny space, fills up fast, definitely make reservations even if they are last minute.  We did and got two seats at the bar (we're not picky, we're there for the food!)
-Great service, even sitting at the bar

We Chose Tapas Plates All Around:
-Avocado fries---Yes
-Spinach Salad---Hell Yes
-Beef Jerky---super salty/umami chewy chunks of beef--do it for something different
-Mango Shrimp--Yes

-Coconut Sticky Rice Dessert had some of the freshest, softest most wonderful mango I've ever put in my mouth.  (Probably because I live in Buffalo NY and the only mangoes we ever see are hard-as-a-rock, funky, nasty, bitter things.) Hell-to-the-yes!!!

-A must-eat if you're into Thai.  We will recommend this to anyone traveling to LV who wants a taste of life outside of the strip (read: much more reasonably priced food done by someone whose not a rock-star celebrity chef who likely has no idea what's going on in their corporate kitchen)

Thai is one of my favorite cuisines, this place did not disappoint. I'm not familiar with this area of town, and I had no idea Rampart was closed down to one lane, I had a 5pm reservation and I ended up being 45 minutes late and they were kind enough to still hold our table, I have an obsession with time, and I'm never late, being 45 minutes late to a reservation just about threw me over the edge. They were very understanding.

Onto the review. We started out with a pitcher of red sangria, not the best I've had, lacking some flavor, but the presentation was beautiful, topped with an orchid in each glass. There were so many appetizers that I felt compelled to try, but I settled on the Koh Samui Shrimp, only because I've been to Koh Samui, quite honestly that was the only reason, coconut shrimp usually doesn't do it for me, but this was actaully really good, I liked the dipping sauce. 

For my entree I ordered the young Coconut Curry, which was served inside a hollowed out coconut and served with the most amazng rice I think I've had. It was so light and fluffy, 5 stars alone just for the rice. My friend enjoyed her Tofu Pad Thai. 
For dessert, or as it's listed on the website, happy endings, we shared the Ginger/Lemongrass Creme Brulee, I'm a sucker for anything ginger and/or lemongrass, the flavors really came through. 

Yes you will pay a little more for the dishes here, you're not eating at Thai Food To-Go.

I love this place. Me and my wife are huge fans. It's a real small restaurant with a sheik ambiance. I love that the restrooms are really clean and decorated tranquil. But the food is what makes this place. We ALWAYS order the Spinach Salad. It's tempura spinach with some yummy Thai dipping sauce. It's a must. I also usually order a curry dish and a noodle dish. So far everything I've ordered is awesome. This is great place to take a date that you really want to impress. I recommend getting a reservation because it's a tiny restaurant. Also if you're into wine go on a Thursday, because it's 1/2 off wine night. This place is as good as it gets. Enjoy!!!

Nittaya's is a great date Thai restaurant with an upscale vibe. While the entrees are more expensive than your typical Thai place, the serving sizes are huge and more than enough to share between a group. 

Start off the meal with their famous spinach salad. As the parentheses on their menu implies, this is not really a salad, but delicious nonetheless. Spinach leaves are individually coated and battered in tempura and deep fried. It has a great spicy lime dressing dipping sauce that accompanies it. This dish is surprisingly large and filling, and probably should not be shared between only two people. 

For main courses, we shared the popular basil chicken, crabmeat fried rice, and drunken noodles. Of the three, I loved the crabmeat fried rice as it had a generous helping of real crabmeat. The drunken noodles also had ground chicken and basil, which made the order of basil chicken somewhat redundant. 

No meal is complete without a happy ending and the family style coconut ice cream is perfect to share. I love the house-made coconut ice cream, but the coconut sticky rice at the bottom became quite hard from the cold ice cream and I wasn't sure if that was the best use of sticky rice. But for coconut fans, you can't do better than coconut, on top of coconut, inside a coconut.

Not Lotus.
Not Komol.
But a nice addition to the Thai choices in town.
Decor is weird; sort of formal which does not suit the vibe.
And they charge $20 a bottle for corkage!
I do, however, love the name. It conjures up intrigue and exclusivity like the famous "secret japanese steak house" in Los Angeles.

I would go back, but it's a long drive and Lotus is just down the street.

Amazing Thai with a twist, great wines, went here twice over a weekend because the food was so good. Go early and book a table before you go if possible, this place is always humming and you could have a long wait if you don't. Also don't be shy, order a few dishes and try them all they are great and what you can't finish, box and take home, it tastes just as good the next day for lunch

We love this place - both for sit down service and carry out. Tonight we had carry out (and we drive 25 minutes to pick up) and it was fabulous as always. 

We ordered the green chicken curry, glass noodle salad, fried avocados, pad thai, and chicken fried rice. So good. So good!

After reading the reviews and menu online, my friend and I decided to try the restaurant. When we arrived and tried to order lunch, we were told that only dinner was served on the weekends. The dinners are almost double the lunch prices. This policy regarding dinners on the weekends was not mentioned anywhere on the website. Next, there was an issue on the price of substituting brown rice for white rice. The website said there was a $1.00 charge; the menu we were given stated there was a $2.00 charge; and then the waitress stated both those were incorrect. There is actually a $3.00 charge for the substitution. At that point, I was irritated, and we left. I think the restaurant needs to accurately state policies and prices, so there aren't surprises once seated at the establishment.

I've had a restaurant.com GC for this place for awhile, and my girlfriend and I finally gave it a shot tonight.  The place was a lot smaller than we had expected... it only had a few tables, and it was dimly lit.  The service was fantastic, though!  Our waitress Tatiana told us so much about the menu and about everything they do.

We tried to order the ahi tuna and another tapa, but they were out of those.  So we ended up getting the spinach salad, the minced shrimp puffs, and the shrimp pastry, as well as a dish of drunken noodles.  The shrimps dishes were OK, but not great.  The spinach salad was delicious!  No wonder this is their most popular item.  The drunken noodles was good, but the chicken wasn't in pieces and was kinda weird to me.

Overall, I was pleasantly surprised, and the service will probably get me back in through their doors.  Hopefully I can try their ahi tuna next time.  Mmmmm.

Amazing. Just go. Everything is delicious. My favorites have to be: Spinach Salad, Fried Avocado, Beef Jerky, Red Curry, Salmon Curry, and their sangria. Honestly, I have yet to have anything here that was less than excellent. Go now!

Went here with a group of friends and we all had a really great time.  It was very tasty and there was a lot to choose from.  Also the day they went they had a deal where certain bottles of wine were half off so if you were cheap you could potentially get a bottle of wine for like 8 bucks which is always a nice deal.  

The food was very good and there was a lot to choose from.  We had an assortment of  a lot of different foods to choose from because we all ordered something different.  Nothing I had was bad so if you want some good thai food then I highly recommend coming here.

This was our first time. We had 3 people and chose to sit outside. Small seating area but nice when the weather is good. Our waiter was a nice, polite young man.  We ordered our drinks and placed an order for 4 small tapas. We waited, waited...watched people come after us, order, eat and leave and we still had NOTHING. Our waiter said our ticket was lost in the kitchen so it will be right out?? 48 minutes after placing our appetizer order we finally had something to nibble on. By this time the entire patio was empty and the staff began to clear the table cloths, etc. Not once did someone from management even stop by the table. We had to wait again to place an order for dinner. We ordered the Shrimp Pad Thai with a level of 3 of 5. It came out Zero of 5. Absolutely no spice at all. If we had a spice tray we could have tried to add some flavor.  After 2.5 hours it was a long process. The food should have been much better based on all the reviews.  

We will give this one more shot but they will need to seriously step it up. The food (will post pictures of each): Phuket Poppers: Jalepenos,  stuffed with cheese, breaded and cut in half. It has 6 but size pieces which equals 2.5 jalepenos for $9, 5 spice Ribs: ribs were spiced nice but were tough and not much meat at all. Presentation was nice. Would have preferred tender meat and more meat than bone. Larb Chicken Cups: romain lettuce leaves with chicken larb on top. Needed more lime, a few more slivers of red onion and the spice tray. Volcano Shrimp: bowl of butterflied shrimp, breaded in a bowl with sliced jalapeno slices that are presented on fire. Presentation was nice but only 4 shrimp and again not a lot of flavor. Yum baked shrimp ordered spice level 3. 5 shrimp served on a bed of romaine lettuce in a sauce. Forget the sauce. This came with the most flavor of any dish. Pad Thai shrimp: OMG this was just a bowl of super slimy noodles, NO and I mean NO flavor and 5 shrimp, few bean sprouts and tablespoon of crushed peanuts on the side. Two of us took two bites and told the third person they could have it. 

All three of us were just shocked and out evening. Again not once did the manager stop by our table. We weren't sure if our nice waiter had screwed up with our ticket or if management is just poor. But either way. The food we ordered should have been better all around. When we received our bill we would have thought they would have at least comped our Thai iced tea or something but Nothing at all.

We will try again and update pictures and review. Hoping for the best.

love the small space and the food is good too.  similar concept to raku on spring mountain.    we started with the crispy spinach.  it lived up to the hype and the peanut dipping sauce is a nice compliment.  we then had the glass noodle salad.  I didn't care for the texture of the noodles and the taste profile was too similar to the peanut dipping sauce.  for an entrée we ate the salmon with green curry and avocado.  i'm not a huge salmon or curry fan but the dish was really good.  the curry had a nice spice.  the avocado added nothing to the dish, nor was it very eye appealing.  for dessert we shared the sticky rice with mango.  it wasn't my choice and I really didn't care for it at all.  service was good and the beer was cold.

Came here with a girlfriend- her recommendation. Wow- impressed! It is charming and has an attractive dining room and good vibe. 
Food was presented beautifully and was delicious. Cannot wait to go back!

I like to start off with the coconut shrimp or the crab wontons!
my favorite dishes are the green/red curry, pad z ew, the slow braised pork noodle dish, and the eggplant shrimp!!!!!!!!!! seriously soon soon good. A little pricey compared to other places but super clean and authentic. I spent a couple months in Thailand and have to say this is pretty dang close!!!!

The restaurant serves very small portions when it comes to the soups they have. The waiter said that it would feed two people and when my wife filled her small bowl up it was all gone. As far as the main course is concerned, mine was way too salty. The feel of the restaurant is nice in the inside, I just wish that they would have Windows that you can see out of. The whole thing is enclosed.

On the way back from DTLV, I stopped at Nittaya's for linner.  It was about 1 PM and during the time when the lunch specials were in effect.  $11 for a variety of lunch dishes that includes a pot sticker, and salad, and the dish of your choice from the list of noodle or rice dishes.

I opted for the green curry chicken with rice.  The menu had a notation that the dish was one of their spicy dishes--just what I wanted.  They did not ask for a hotness number I wanted such as a scale of 1-5 or 1-10.  It was made the way they make it.

First up, I was brought a pot sticker and a small salad.  The pot sticker was OK.  Nothing special and a bit soft on the bottom from the sauce on/under it negating the frying of the dumpling.  The salad was great with the flavor of rice wine vinegar being very prevalent.

The curry was very good and I was surprised that it had the zing it had.  Most places that indicate a dish is spicy with a small pepper or some other notation aren't really my spicy level--they're too mild.  This had a bit of zing. More would have been better but this was OK.
