Service was good throughout.  I had never been here before, so when I walked in and saw the bar, I sat there because I was dinging solo.  It was only after my eyes got acclimated to the darkened interior that I realized there were two rooms.  It's quite a nice restaurant.

Service was very good.  As other reviewers have mentioned, the lunch special pricing at $11 is higher than other Asian restaurants doing lunch specials and I didn't see anything different about the quality of my lunch compared to other places I've been.

Nittaya's is worth another try for the evening menu.  There are some good sounding items I need to taste.

Amazing, love this place, one of the best restaurants in vegas, 
Try the salmon curry, delicious! !!

This place is a hidden gem! Everything is so fresh and the flavors are unique with each bite. I would recommend the lettuce wraps and the Siamese egg rolls. Also , the island potato bites. The sauces are so flavorful that  they give you to dip your food in. The tapas are huge portions and over filled , which is great!  I saved room for the banana and chocolate crepe dessert..yes, it was yum..
Be careful! Yelp says this is a 2 $$ restuarant, but its a 3 $$$!! Food was delicious, but my family had to share entrees because it was so expensive.

THEY DIDN'T HONOR MY YELP DEAL-BOO

My girlfriend Jesse and I stopped by Saturday night just for a cocktail. 

We ended up ordering the signature spinach leaves appetizer and some red curry shrimp. Spinach was greasy and shrimp was too spicy.

Service at the bar was very formal and attentive but the restaurant was quiet and everyone was on a date night.  So we probably didn't pick the best place to come and have a girl's night. 

When we were waiting for the check I decided to "check in" on Yelp.  I usually check in after I leave a place and I noticed there was a Yelp Deal. 

One free glass of Sangria with check in woo-hoo! Right?  WRONG!  Mr. Four-Seasons Bartender suddenly turned Motel 6 and wouldn't honor it.  (He's the blonde guy with glasses) He said I should have told him that when we first got there. Huh? Just for that, I won't be back.

UNACCEPTABLE!

Finally made it in! It was worth the wait! 

I had tried to dine here previously but it was just too  busy. I did my due diligence and made a resi this time. The process was pleasant. 

Our reservation was respected and we were promptly seated. It was packed and service was notably slow. We were in no hurry so this was not an issue. I believe it was at least 30 mins before we even ordered apps. Plates were promptly cleared and water always filled so we were not abandoned but we barely saw our actual server. 

We had mussels, volcano shrimp, soft shell crab, and sausage. The mussels were life changingly good. The coconut broth was divine. They were perfectly tender and I literally ate remainder of the broth with a spoon. The sausage was pungent with lemongrass and very tasty. It was served in whole sausages but with all the fixings to make lettuce wraps. Yum. The shrimp were cooked nicely and tasty but nothing special. The soft shell crab was delightful. 

We had the signature fried spinach salad which was tasty and unique. 

We had the duck curry and avocado strip steak with green curry. I didn't dislike the duck but would not order it again. The combination of lychee, pineapple, tomato and curry ultimately did not work for me. I think warm pineapple freaks me out a little. The steak was phenomenal. The avocado, eggplant, zucchini and green curry were all perfect. The curry was the perfect thickness and texture. Absolutely delicious. 

We had a bottle of wine and our bill was just over $200 for 4 of us. We were uncomfortably full. My co diners had a dessert and a glass of dessert wine. I didn't partake. I would return tomorrow and order the mussels and steak and refuse to share. 

Go try this upscale yet affordable Thai treasure.

Last night we dined at Nittaya's.  The food was good but I did not leave "in love" as usual.  We started off with our usual-"THE" Spinach Salad.  The Spinach was light & crispy but the dressing seemed different-I can not exactly identify what was different.  I usually can not stop eating it but after 3 bites I was satisfied.  We also ordered the Fried avocado appetizer which was very tasty-the avocado was smooth and buttery and rich. 

I ordered the Beef Pad Z U (their spelling).  It just did not taste "right" to me (not bad, not horrible though).  My husband tasted it-thought the meat was chewy but declared it "ok".  We took it home.  He ordered the Duck Curry which he declared "pretty good".  One friend ordered the Salmon Curry which she liked.   Our other friend ordered the ribs which he loved.  

One con about this otherwise delightful place is the seating.  I am not a tiny person and have no one to blame but myself.  That said, the tables are so tightly placed as is the bar "area".  People generally will scootch their seat back and the people at the bar scootch their seat back.  Our party was already seated in the back and all avenues to get to our table were blocked with patrons having their seats back just a little BUT since the tables are so close together it was almost virtually impossible to get to our seat.  I noticed all of the very slender servers and staff having to turn sideways and such to get back and forth between the tables. (So of course my sizable ass was not getting through without a chair or something being moved).  After dinner we felt almost trapped at our table and did not feel comfortable trying to leave until the table behind us cleared.  

The service was wonderful as usual.

Such a romantic place! Small, intimate, and cozy. It was almost dream like. The prices are a little high for Thai food, but the portions are good sized and the presentation is beautiful. We had three of the small dishes: five spice ribs, secret stickers, and garlic rice. Each dish was very flavorful. The ribs were good sized and meaty and flavored with Chinese five spice. The secret stickers were much better than your average potsticker, stuffed with meat and spices, deep fried, and served with a delicious sauce. The garlic rice was buttery, redolent with the flavor of garlic, and a great taste of cilantro. I would have any of these dishes again. We went here on a whim and didn't expect it to be so pricey (the three small dishes were $27), but I would love to come back here for date night. They also have happy hour from 3-6, and half priced select bottles on Thursdays.

Good food, I liked it, very upscale. 

The service, however, does not even compare to a Podunk McDonalds. Service was extremely slow, do not come expecting a quick exit. Took 45 min after ordering to receive our meal. Took them 15 minutes to bring out a Pepsi. Seems like all the staff disappear into the kitchen and leave the lobby. Even the bar was unattended. I would not recommended this restaurant to any of my friends or family. 

The sad part is, there were maybe 10 tables full and one individual at the bar.

This is one of my favorite places and my husband and I always order the same things: mango grilled shrimp (normally I don't eat shrimp or bacon), chicken satay, and the chicken pad Thai.

I would give them five stars but although the service at the bar is always good, I think the restaurant is under staffed.  Nittaya - please hire more staff!  My second complaint is they don't offer any salads without meat.

I love the atmosphere - warm and cozy, kind of SF-isn

Between 4 and 5 stars.  Everything was so spicy.  Great flavors.  Especially loved the fried avocado! yum yum yum.  I believe the owner was taking care of us and she was super friendly and had great suggestions for a Thai novice such as myself.  

Wine was half-priced on Thursdays and we took full advantage of this :) We stayed for hours, drinking and munching on the appetizers we split.  This is a small restaurant and it was packed.  There are apparently a lot of people in Summerlin who love this place and for good reason: It was delicious.  Beautiful lighting too.  Don't let the strip mall location fool you.  Great for a date spot or happy hour with the girls.

So, we drove from my house(east-side) to Nittaya's to take pictures since my BF is building their new website.  After about an hour there, we were starving so decided to stay and try out the food.
I'm going to start by saying that I have had Thai food plenty of times in SF but will admit that I am not an expert, although, I will say that Thai and Vietnamese share a lot of the same flavors and herbs.

Let's start with the atmosphere, it's very quaint and has a very mellow vibe.  White table cloths and lit candles- lovely place for locals to have a "date night" away from the kids.

The menu has Thai Tapas- smaller plates/appetizers that range from $4-$8 a plate as well as a good selection of entrees as well as a beer/wine/sake bar.  Wish I didn't have to work the next day otherwise I would've had a nice sake with dinner.

Okay- so we ordered a few different entrees/tapas.  Here's the low down:
Chicken Satay- nice and moist, slight char from grilling (which I like) and peanut sauce

Lemongrass soup-reminds me of hot and sour soup(which I love) but slightly salty. Normally I would eat it with white rice to balance out the saltiness, still still good nonetheless with great flavor

Spinach salad- the BOMB!! hello, not like a typical spinach salad!! The leaves are individually dipped in a tempura-like batter so is very light and comes with a ground chicken larb. It was SOO good! This dish alone would bring me back all the way to the other side of town for!

Green Curry with chicken-again, since I am not an Thai food expert, it was good but a little on the sweet side for me.  I usually have curry Indian style so am not used to the slightly sweet coconut flavor but the vegetables were perfectly cooked.

Combo Pad Thai-again, slightly sweet but nothing a few lime wedges and some sambal can't cure. 

We finished with the coconut sticky rice and sweet mango.  Loved the coconut sticky rice but wish it was a little more moist. Mango was perfect, sweet and ripe.

Overall, A+ for me, will definitely be back to try the other dishes on the menu!!
Outstanding food, and my man Bank is an excellent server.  The chili lime squid is superb. Love this place.

Looking for a fancy night out with some thai food? This is the place! When I walked in I was not expecting it to be super dim and so pretty. The workers there were super nice! We ordered quite a lot of food and shared it family style. We ordered pineapple fried rice, which came in a pineapple, papaya salad, green curry, catfish curry, and pad thai. The curry was probably my favorite just because it had the perfect amount of spice to it! Everything was super yummy, but each dish is a bit pricy.

Very good spinach salad.  
Wife thought was very romantic. 
Would go again ..










Like the fruit infused water too

Epic!!! Tapas are incredible! I love them all! Spinach Salad is a must order. I think the Massaman Curry is the best Curry I have ever had. Also love the Green Steak Curry Avocado!

Everything is Incredible! I would fly from Roseville just to go to this restaurant. Best Ever!

Fried spinach is delicious. 
Pad Thai, Drunken Noodles, and Seafood madness were excellent!

I can't believe I have lived nearby for years and just tried this restaurant.  My wife and I came in for a late lunch and upon first impression of the interior of the place was it was tidy, quaint and pleasantly decorated.  The soft lighting brings you into an atmosphere private dining.

Many things sounded good to me but my wife is a vegetarian so she stayed away from the dishes that included meat.  I nearly ordered the FOB Rice (Fresh Off the Boat pineapple rice) - which after speaking to someone about the place later found out is awesome, but I decided to try the chicken satay and the cilantro beef skewers.  The Chicken Satay was very good while the beef as good, but nothing to write home about. 

My wife had a spinach salad that had tempura battered spinach and a citrus/cashew dressing sauce on the side.  I should point out that this dish normally comes with chicken but they told her she could elect to have it with tofu instead or without either entirely (which she elected).  I tried it and it was very interesting and tasty.  

We also ordered Garlic Edamame which was fantastic.  It had a great garlic flavor and they put in Serrano peppers as well in there which is a twist we had not tried before.

That waters served were infused with flower and strawberry very lightly- which gave it a hint of flavor and I had also ordered a Tropical Iced Tea which was great.

Overall, a very pleasant dining experience for about $20 for each of us.  I am definitely coming back.

My favorite Thai food restaurant has always been Kung Fu Thai, but now I have another favorite! I love their Angel Wings and their Pad Thai was cooked perfectly. Not too sweet and saucy, just right. They have a great lunch special variety for just $11. My boyfriend ordered green curry and that was good too. Can't wait to come back for dinner. I want to try the Avocado Steak Curry and the creme brûlée trio!

How can I keep this restaurant secret but still write a review on Yelp about it?  OK, I'll pretend I didn't write this review if you pretend you didn't hear about it from me.  Deal?  

Let me just preface this by saying that I've been around my share of delicious Thai restaurants.  I mean, I'm from Hawaii, where we have an abundance of delicious Asian cuisine and Thai food restaurants galore.  With that said, I have to tell you that this place is a little gem.  Everything from the decor of the place where it has a nice, intimate setting yet plays pretty hip background music, to their furniture and coziness...just adds to the experience.  

I've had some dishes here that I have never had any any other Thai restaurant.  Sure they have your typical pad thai or Tom Yum Soup but the delicious tempura spinach salad was truly magical.  This place is definitely a place that I'd like to come back to again so I can try even more of their dishes.  

Shh...now go erase my review from your memory because I didn't write it.  ^_~

Food was excellent. Service is friendly and fast. We ordered the spinach salad (a must try), pineapple fried rice, skirt steak with the avocado on top, loved it!!! The bread pudding was ok, but we were full! Great place would definitely come back.
The food was delicious and prices are very reasonable! One thing I noticed was the outstandingly friendly service from our server Leah. Thank you! We will be back

I have long been a fan of Las Vegas' Lotus of Siam, often cited as the top Thai restaurant in the US. Years ago a friend recommended, Nittaya's Secret Kitchen... and I discovered the West Side's best kept secret.

Nittaya is located at Lake Mead and Rampart and is a west side local favorite. The decor is thoughtful and warm with wood and fabrics and an intimate even romantic feel. The restaurant feels small with two adjacent dining rooms and a wine bar.

The food is undeniably delicious with the usual variety of a top notch Thai restaurant. As good of Thai food as I have ever had, including Lotus and Thailand! While I dine here alone at the bar or as a couple often, I prefer going with a group so I can over order and get deeper in the menu.

My favorites are the citrus steak salad and the Kao Soi. The FOB pineapple rice is a great addition to any meal and the chicken dumplings are excellent. Actually, everything is delicious.

The service is warm and friendly, Josh has been there for years providing exceptional service. Thank you!

The wine list is decent, I highly recommend a bottle of Reisling to compliment your meal. Try the Schloss or Monchoff. Thursday, they have 1/2 off wine bottles.

The food was amazing!! Service was great.  We went in their for lunch and everyone loved every dish except the Tofu dish which they asked to be on a heat level of a 4 and it was not very hot.  I did not try that dish because it was not what I normally eat but there was 10 of us and I tried 8 of the dishes and they were amazing.  The spinach appetizer was fabulous.  It was like the best French fry you could imagine with a secret sauce that was out of this world.  When back in Vegas I would love to go back to this restaurant and try more dishes out.  You will not be disappointed.
The food here is amazing. Very expensive but fresh and very very good. Best Thai food in Vegas.

I had high hopes for my take out!!! First off when I called to put in my order, the girl who took my order didn't ask once what level of heat I wanted on any of the entrees. Second she didn't give me my total, she just said our order should be ready in 15 minutes. When my mother and I arrived for our order. No one greeted us as we entered. I said I was there for a pick up the lady behind the bar went to get our take out. She came with a receipt and with her had out expecting the payment without even telling us our total until we asked. My mother handed her debt card. She returned with the receipt and didn't even say thank you for coming and just handed it like "sign and go about your day" with no words! 

The food was decent for Thai food. It is very overpriced for the amount of food. 

The service I expected for a place with such great reviews what totally unacceptable!

ouch $8.00 for an order of edamame !! ouch highway robbery
other than that food was good.

This place was AMAZING. It's a hole in the wall for sure, very small but the food was so good. I don't think they do any take out or delivery, not that kind of place. Very much a fancy Thai place, maybe even fusion? Either way it was great, but don't expect greasy takeout style food (not that there's anything wrong with that). This is a white linen tablecloth kind of restaurant, without being snooty. Would probably be great for date night too!
The best thai around! Love this little gem

To start the water is strawberry and orange flavored, The vegetable egg rolls were fried to perfection with crisp vegetables inside accompanied by the right amount of spice, the House duck sauce was amazing ! I ordered the chicken pad see ew as my entree and the chicken was tender noodles were cooked to perfection and it was plated beautifully. i will surely be back

This place has some of the best Thai food ever.  The restaurant is a little small and can get noisy when full, but the food is totally worth it.  I'd suggest trying all the appetizers so you can get an idea of how good it is.  The fried spinach plate is incredible, if you want a starter, that is the one.  I've tried about 60% of the entire menu and most of it was incredible.  The only dishes that were average were the short ribs and braised beef.  Some of the items come with a spicy sauce, but medium has a nice kick, not too hot.  They have a nice wine selection as well.
Enjoy!

this place is phenomenal for a sit down Thai meal. the service was paced a little slower but it was a nice change from the hustle-you-out-the-door you can get at a lot of chains. would definitely suggest a reservation, we got lucky to find a table as walk-ins.
Food was very tasty. Large portions . Great value . Loved the decor . Small but VERY charming . Service was good until the end. We waited a long time for our check.

The edamame seems overpriced if you eat it as much as I do, but it's dressed up nicely here. 
YES to the avocado curry thingy. Sounds gross, I know, but just go with it. It's interesting. But I'm an avocado freak. I enjoyed their version of Drunken Noodles, and the Pad See Ew with chicken. 

It's a small and quant place and perfect for a date night or lunch date. Soft lighting and mood music.

Our first visit was on a weekend. It was good. Food was tasty and server (female) was attentive. On the second time, we went there on a Thursday. The restaurant was quite full. We waited to be seated, but servers went by without a word. 5 minutes later a bus boy finally acknowledged our presence and said he would seat us. Another 3 minutes went by and we were still standing there. We left, and we would not return to a place that could not provide the most basic service.

I've been to many Thai places in Vegas and this is by far the best. From appetizers to main course and desserts all have been exceptional. Clean and classy as well as more seating room then traditional Thai restaurants. Great wine and bottle specials. Plum wine is inexpensive and sweet great starter drink. And their infused water is so very refreshing on these hot vegas days! Nothing bad to say five stars all the way!!

Went there for lunch recently.  When I first walked in, the decor, music and ambiance got my attention - in a positive way.

The service was fast and excellent  - they even flavor the ice water with fresh citrus fruit. I don't know how they are able to make it so the pot stickers don't leave a thick greasy residue on your fingers but they succeed.  The basil eggplant had so many different and wonderful flavors that I almost forgot that I was having a vegetarian meal.

Overall great food, service, beautiful decor and you can tell that Nittaya put a lot of thought and care into the restaurant. Kudos!

Ate in this place many times but noticed that they are not keeping the same quality. The food is expensive, but not enough food. Brought chicken green curry and there were no chicken. The same with the salmon. Last time I ate at this place for lunch, I got super sick. I still trying to feel better but my stomach and my belly hurts no stop. Not sure what was in that food that made me so sick. I will never go back there again.

There is no restaurant in Vegas that makes me happier than Nittaya's. From the intimate setting to the incredibly tasty dishes, they consistently hit it out of the park. If you like Thai food you have to try it. We go here for every major celebration that comes up and the spicy catfish and Thai donuts are a must have. Call ahead though, or you may not get a seat!

I took my sister to Nittaya's Secret Kitchen for dinner.   Thursday is half price wine night, but we were already looking forward to their delicious fruity red Sangria.  We had the charred shishito peppers  - sweet, salty and delicious.  I had to have the spinach salad - the lime dipping sauce is a perfect compliment to the crispy tempura shrimp.  The coconut shrimp with mango pineapple was our third pick.  The shrimp were large, firm and flavorful.  Another great night at Nittaya's!

OMG!!!! 

What happens when Thai food meet AMAZING? It's Nittaya's Hidden Kitchen.  This small local restaurant is a pleasant surprise!!

I got the Shrimp Pad Thai. The shrimp was rubbery and didn't taste fresh at all.  Also, $20 dollars is overkill. 

I didn't know that this was a fancy sit down place.  They looked annoyed when I asked for something to go.  Overpriced food, extremely small, and full of Summerlin snobs.  I don't recommend going if you're a family or want to have an experience that was worth every buck you earn.

Love this place! Food has always been excellent and it's a great place for a date because the atmosphere is cozy and trendy. Make sure to get reservations on the weekend because it is very tiny and fills up quickly.
I ordered pad Thai with chicken and fried bananas and coconut ice cream to go. Will say that the food was 5 stars but the pad Thai portion was a little too small for $18

OH MY GOSH. So happy I yelled nearby restaurants when I was bored! The food here is seriously amazing. Not like oh I think all Thai food is amazing. Like truly amazing. The spinach salad is the most ridiculous thing I've tasted could eat it all day! Penang curry was great! Papaya salad, coconut shrimp, crying tiger anything! Can't wait to go back!  One complaint is it's very busy usually. Be prepared to have a bit of chaos in the restaurant.

Great great place.. Must try tapas.. Spinach salad is spectacular..Although this place has the traditional thai dishes.. This place is has the tapas.. It's not a typical size tapas.. its more like appetizers, so 2 is more than enough.. They also have an fruit infused iced tea.. excellent service.. must try if you're in the area..

We went here a few weeks ago, wanting Thai food and after reading the Yelp reviews deciding that this looked good.  Let's just say we were blown away.  We had the best server/bartender that was beyond helpful!  He helped us with recommendations and led us to a great meal.  We had the spinach "salad" which was amazing!  We also had the pineapple fried rice served in a pineapple boat and chicken pad thai!  Everything was beyond our expectations.  We cannot wait to return again with friends!

Very authentic Thai food! The service was great and the food was delicious. The decor inside is very elegant, upscale, and Contemporary. My only thing is it's a bit pricy for the portion size. 

We ordered
Basil beef 5/5 stars
Pad see eww, chicken 4/5 stars
Potstickers 5/5 stars
Egg rolls 4/5 stars

This should be kept a secret so that no one has the terrible food I had.  There are many great Thai places in Las Vegas and there is no need to eat here.  

The only plus is that the tiny dining room is cute.  Hopefully this bodes for them going out of business and someone who can cook can come in.  

Firecracker prawns were deep fried breaded shrimp with some sauce drizzled on, really would a ramekin of sauce kill you?  Normally I am used to prawns in yummy egg roll wrappers. 

My husband sent back the drunken noddles because it had eggs, which we have never had in any Thai restaurant ever.  He then got a very unremarkable basil chicken which was had so much gristle he had to spit it out.  

My crab fried rice either had fake crab or really terrible crab. 

The only okay thing was the chicken satay we ordered for the children.  The water was infused with fruit, that wasn't bad. 

The presentation was all stick on a slice of pineapple.  Either figure out some new plating or serve it family style.

Had the take out for dinner tonight. Everything was delicious! We got the chicken potstickers, the chicken pad Thai, basil chicken and steak! Everything was great and the portions were larger than I expected. We had plenty of food leftover to enjoy tomorrow. I haven't experienced dining inside, but it's pretty small and intimate inside. Will definitely be back again.

I found this romantic and intimate gem via Yelp! I was reluctant to drive 30min to it given the abundance of food places in Vegas within 5min of any location. Well, this is a true GEM. The food was amazing - everything was fresh, prepared to perfection and served with great presentation. I loved the short ribs and the drunken noodles. I also had the lemon grass soup. This is not your typical Thai place. Every dish has an added detail that you would not find in single $ Thai places and there are plenty of unique dishes that add to the authenticity of this restaurant. I cannot wait to go there again.

I am always focused on the quality of the food and the level of services but there one more detail that makes this place superior. The interior is very well decorated and adds to the the experience of submerging you in Thai culture. It is just perfect. Perfect for lunch or dinner.

One thing to note is that the restaurant does not have high chairs. I would not call it child unfriendly but it sure made it hard to keep the kids from digging in all the yummy food.

Did I mention that the mango sticky rice is not to be missed?!

Sooo delicious. Pretty expensive for thai food, but it's well worth it. The pineapple friend rice is delicious and served in the pineapple. The curries are delicious too. Honestly there isn't one thing on this menu I wouldn't eat. Love love love!

One of the best restaurants I've eaten at in Las Vegas. The atmosphere is very nice, the service is attentive and quick, and the food is delicious. We got the tofu lettuce wraps, Siamese corn fritters, and fried avocado. All of it was great, but the tofu lettuce wraps in particular was incredible.

Some of the best Thai food in Vegas. We've eaten here many times and will continue to visit. Lunch yesterday was excellent as expected and the service was spot on attentive. The Secret Salad is fantastic (cue the dipping sauce... and one to go please:) as is much of there delicious & creative offerings.

Amazing amazing amazing. I highly recommend this place. It was so good. They have great inside and outside searing. I had the Massaman chicken. It's the best curry I've ever had. The service is a great and the food is outstanding. Go try it!

Have you ever eaten at a place and loved it so much you didn't want to review it to prevent others from finding out of your little secret. In comes Nittaya's Secret Kitchen. This place is phenomenal and during every bite I knew I had to leave nothing but outstanding remarks. 

It's in a little corner barely visible from the street but when you walk through it's false door you enter a space that captures an atmosphere all it's own. 

For starters, I recommend the Lemongrass with shrimp soup. It it to die for. If this is the only thing they did well, I would keep coming back for it. However, that's far from the truth. Everything we had was fantastic. Truly a restaurant I hope to see expand. 

Kylie ordered the citrus steak salad. She wasn't in a spicy mood but thankfully, there are plenty of options for those who either lack the pallet or the tolerance for spicy foods. The steak came out perfectly cooked to medium rare next to this beautiful bed of salad with a citrus sauce along the bottom. Never too overpowering.

I've been in a seafood kick as of late. The polite staff recommended the seafood madness mix 3. Although, a huge fan of spicy food, I decided to not over do it the first time to keep the balance of the dish. A simple 3 on their 1-5 scale of spicy is sufficient to keep most happy. Out came a wonderful presentation of mussels, shrimp, and fish next to a flower and a plate of steamed white rice. Dig in because you won't want to share. 

On the drink side, they offer wine by the glass or the bottle. 

I highly recommend this place.
Lovely and tasty food. A bit pricey for dinner in this area, go for lunch instead. Fresh ingredients,  flavorful spices.
The food quality was good, not excellent. We did order pick up, I'm sure the ambiance of the place was great. Since we only ordered 2 entrees and it was $50+ Too expensive and not enough food.

Nittaya's Secret Kitchen won't be a secret much longer, as this tiny neighborhood gem in Summerlin has a lot of potential. Tucked back in a small strip center off Lake Mead and Rampart, it is a little tricky to find, but is worth the search. They describe themselves as a Thai tapas restaurant, implying there may be some fusion going on, but in actuality you can just expect a lot of Thai appetizers - really good Thai appetizers - and some traditional favorites. Most things on the menu taste healthy and clean, and there are plenty of vegetarian dishes. The tofu preparations here are better than most, and the eggplant dishes aren't heavily saturated with oil as they often can be.

You can't leave without ordering the unique Spinach Salad ($9). This isn't really a salad at all, but rather a mound of lightly tempura battered spinach leaves that serve as chips for a tangy 'dip' made from ground chicken, whole cashews, cilantro, carrots, and onions. The leaves are delicate, yet pack a crunch, and the spicy, sweet, loose dip is like a meat-fortified salsa. Sounds a little strange, but it's to die for. The Chicken Ginger Salad is similar to the Spinach Salad, except the spinach is replaced with iceberg lettuce, you get a lot more chicken, and you have the addition of tender julienne ginger ($9).

Skip on the 'Shrimp in Pastry.' Though tasty, and dramatically presented, there is no pastry to be found (just wonton wrappers). The shrimp are overwhelmed by the cream cheese, and the jalapeno and leek don't come through enough. It's also a culinary no-no to put inedible items on a plate, i.e. pineapple rind (see below). What the 'Shrimp in Pastry' lacked in cohesion of flavors, the 'Thai Bouillabaise' made up for, though the mucky color was off-putting. They also use frozen green lip New Zealand mussels, an ingredient I feel there is no excuse for in good places. Though I loved the broth, that was the break in the 'make-or-break' of the Bouillabaise for me.

I love that they have outdoor seating with views of the mountains in the distance, but the best kept part of Nittaya's secret is that you can get a $25 dining certificate on restaurant.com for as little as $1 when you sign up for their email list. Although I'm annoyed by their almost daily notifications, the discount codes are incredible and I save about 80% off their regular restaurant certificate prices on any given day. Plus, it encourages me to try new restaurants I otherwise wouldn't, even if I do defeat the purpose of the discount entirely by over ordering. If you go to Nattaya's make sure you visit restaurant.com beforehand, even if you don't have a code, because it will still save you $15 as a visitor.

Finally, go knowing that the service at Nittaya's is slow. Your food arrives promptly once you order, but everything else seems to take forever. The staff is friendly enough to compensate for this shortcoming, though it is worth taking into consideration if you are short on time or don't particularly like to linger. Hopefully this is just part of their opening pains.

This little place is beautiful, with just the right lighting to make it a special romantic hideaway. That also makes it a little difficult to read the price-gouging wine list, where a glass of Riesling goes for $12 for one brand and $10 for another. I think Nittaya has lost sight of the fact that this is a neighborhood restaurant nowhere the Strip. 

The waitress, whose English made her nearly impossible to understand, did a good high-pressure job of pushing the Tempura Spinach Salad appetizer, and we were glad she did. It was outstanding, though it's now $11, not the $9 previously reported.  Our party of four also ordered the Fried Avocado  appetizer and the Shrimp Patties, but the waitress brought the wrong shrimp appetizer, saying they had similar names.  She changed it cheerily.  The avocado was very good, but the shrimp patties were ordinary and greasy. 

For our main course, my husband and I shared a Chicken Musaman Curry, served with a side of jasmine rice. This was the only dish that didn't have an elegant presentation. It was good - not the best, but certainly not the worst Musaman I've had - but could have benefited from less sauce and more chicken. They didn't offer it with beef, which I like better. 

The other couple had much bigger appetites, ordering Salmon in an Avocado Curry, a Crab Fried Rice, and Catfish in an unidentifiable reddish sauce. She liked her salmon, he hated his catfish, and the fried rice was lukewarm. 

With visions of Yogurtland dancing in our heads, we bypassed dessert here. 

If we were to return, we'd probably order just from the appetizer/tapas menu. But then again, almost everything on that menu is either fried, stuffed with cream cheese, or both. We'd probably be best off leaving that kind of food for the younger set.

I wanted to go somewhere on St. Patrick's Day where I would least likely find beer chugging party goers. I just wanted to go somewhere that served Coconut Soup for my sore throat and some place very quiet because I also had a headache. I wasn't feeling too great as you can tell. When we stepped in it looked very cozy with the brown, gold and brick walls. The tables were draped in white it was very calming. 

I started off with the Coconut Soup it came in soup dish. The dish was a little shallow meaning that there was only one serving. I'm used to places like Thai Barbecue that serves it in a big silver server which comes with more than enough to take home. I was sick so I was hoping for more. I know that this is a Thai tapas place but my soup wasn't on the tapas menu so I thought it would be bigger. The soup still had a nice taste and the chicken pieces were not too big which was perfect. The only thing is I wish the soup was served hotter. 

My husband had the Citrus Steak Salad which had cucumbers, tomato, red onion and spicy lime dressing . That was really good and the meat was nice and tender. 

I tried the Grilled Mango Shrimp that was served with a Spicy Mango Sauce. I was afraid the dish might be too salty because of the bacon wrapped shrimp but it was a perfect balance of salty and sweet. It reminded me of the shrimp I used to order at Tom Ham's Light House in San Diego years ago! It was delicious! 

We also ordered some fried rice. It was good but I don't recommend taking it home because it doesn't taste good the next day . The rice is too mushy that it just doesn't keep well. 

My husband and I shared the Thai buttermilk donuts with Coconut Rum Caramel sauce . It was a sweet ending to a great meal.

Joy and Josh were amazing! The spinach tapas was a fabulous starter.  The lunch specials... Drunken noodle, chicken pad tai and basil chicken were all delish... Our team celebration was a huge success at our new find.  Thank you Yelp for leading us to our new yummy restaurant.

This truly is a hidden gem. We went for Valentine's Day dinner and would go back again and again.  The atmosphere was quiet and romantic.

The spinach salad was fantastic! I can appreciate the amount of time between appetizers and meal. We were given plenty of time to finish our appetizers before our meal came out. The menu was unique. This is first place that I have seen that offers curry avocado. 

The sangria looked amazing. It will be on my "to order" list.

Wow, what a wonderful surprise right in my neighborhood. This is such a charming and welcoming little restaurant. The atmosphere is so cozy, and the staff so friendly, I can't believe it took me so long to break away from my favorite Thai restaurant on Durango and give this place a try.
I know this echoes most all of the other reviews on Yelp for Nittaya's Secret Kitchen, but the "Secret Spinach Salad" is a must!!!! It is delicious, and now one of my favorite salads!
I also will highly recommend the Volcano Shrimp. The spices were fabulous!
The Short Rib Curry was a special, not on the regular menu, and very good. Just the right amount of spice to not overwhelm the flavor of the beef.
I will definitely be returning to Nittaya's very soon, gotta add this to the regular rotation!

This is a beautiful little restaurant with delicious food! Everything our party ordered - including the vegan dishes my husband and I chose - was excellent. The servers were quite knowledgeable about what menu items are vegan, and were happy to find out for me when they didn't know. The food presentation was also lovely, though I'm used to less expensive restuarants, so the menu seemed a little pricey to me.

Food is delicious as always but waited one hour 23 minutes to get our food. When we inquired at an hour and fifteen they said the chef said it's coming. Acted like it was no big deal. An off-hand apology that wasn't convincing. For the price wen paid for dinner I expect more! 
Very disappointed tonight. Can't decide if it's worth coming back.

The food was very tasty and I was happy to find that when they advertised that the food was going to be a spicy it actually was! I ordered the spinach tempura salad as an appetizer which was wonderful, the dipping sauce was flavorful and sweet. As an entree I ordered the kao soi which was absolutely delicious! The pork shoulder was tender and flavorful and the curry was spicy and plentiful! My only complaint was flat is seemed that everything we ordered had some ingredient that was deep fried.

I live in Chicago now but used to go here often when I lived in Vegas. It's truly a hidden gem. Every time I come back to visit my parents, who still live in Vegas, the trip is not complete without an amazing meal at Nittaya's. Simply put, amazing.

Went here after this place was highly recommended, we ordered the following:
1. Duck curry with Lychee: good sauce so I enjoyed that but the duck was so hard. 
2. Coconut soup with noodle: Bad, it was sour
3. Pad Thai : Really good probably the best thing we ordered 
4. Bacon wrapped shrimp; it was decent too
5. Cashew shrimp: Ok, too much soy 
6. Chocolate mousse: average
7. Banana chocolate Bignet ; good
8. Coconut ice cream: good
9. Egg rolls: good
I probably would not return, hope this helps :)

Wow. I've been here so many times in such a short time and it is my all-time favorite restaurant. The service is always amazing and the food is out of this world. I've tried many thai restaurants in Vegas and this has by far the best food. Try anything here, and you will not regret it! 
Everytime I come, I always make sure to order the chicken pad thai, crispy pork belly, and of course, the mango sticky rice. 
The chicken pad thai is very flavorful and it is bottom line AMAZING. The flavors really come alive once you squeeze the lemon on top. The noodles are always well cooked so there is a little chew to it. 
The crispy pork belly is a hit or a miss with the portions. The difference in sizes vary with a big difference depending on the chef. But regardless, it is soooo good. I usually don't like foods with a lot of fat, but my goodness.. It just melts in your mouth with that very light crispiness. The sauce that it comes with on the side complements it very well. It is a tangy spicy sauce. 
And my favorite... The MANGO WITH STICKY RICE! This place was the first place I've ever tried this dish. I will not eat this at any other place because my taste buds are spoiled!
When I went a couple weeks ago, there wasn't any mangos ripe yet because it's not the right season, so we got the deep fried banana and it was just as delicious. The outside of the banana is not your typical tempura; it's coconut shavings! It added a crispiness that's almost like a chip. The banana is also topped with coconut ice cream, which has actual coconut in it! I asked for a side of sticky rice and it paired well together with the banana and ice cream. 
Definitely recommend this place to anyone and everyone! Don't miss out on this gem!!!

I just ate this place looks kinda small but i think i didn't really look at the other part of the restaurant i think We came at the end of happy hour literally minutes And was offered dinner was a little out of budget cause we only go out for lunch cause of the prices We let the server know that we were going to leave But then was offered a lunch menu which made us stay The service was really good  and nice But the main entree was real bland I had the same dish at another place and tasted exactly the same So maybe its just the type of food Or i should try something different
Such a fun and different taste. I highly recommend a reservation as it is very small. Perfect for dates. Cilantro steak skewers are a must and literally the best curry puffs ever.
exceptional to say the least. very relaxing atmosphere. love it. be specific as to how spicy you like it. this is a keeper. janet s.

LOVE this place! We are regulars here and visit for a nice dinner or sometimes lunch. The food is so amazing, authentic, fresh and delicious! Service is usually great as well. You have to try papaya salad or the spinach salad. Everything on menu is delicious so you can't go wrong.

We originally booked for 7:30 but got a call that the table won't be ready until 7:45pm. When we got there at 7:42, we were told there will be another 20-25 minute wait. If that was the case, they could have just booked us at 8:15 instead of promising a table at exactly 7:45. The servers obviously didn't want to be there, they looked so miserable that empty plates were not cleared until you point them out to them. The lady who took the credit card payments also had some attitude problem (even if it was her fault), she charged the wrong amount for the credit cards. So we told her why was that the case? Instead of her being apologetic she raised her voice at us and even moving her arms about to make herself heard. I was a little uneasy when that happened since I've never had that kind of experience before especially from an establishment such as this. Overall the food was good, except that the curry was really dry and the sauce was like eating sea water. But other than that dish the catfish came out well. After such a long wait, we would have expected a really good service at least, but nothing, nada! Not even a good explanation. Don't know if I wanna come back and definitely not recommending this to peers. Too bad! It was our first and most probably our last time as well! Don't come here if you have hypertension, you're highly likely gonna get some serious issues! Ha ha!
Amazing! Very good food! Service was fast and friendly and very attentive. Spinach salad is a must have!!! First time here and definitely won't be my last.

Never wrong! Always the right choice for an intimate dinner or a small group of friends. They changed the decor since I last visited but the food remains consistent and is a little celebration with each bite you take. If you do a little dance with the first (or every bite) it's okay and expected. Try, get addicted and return!

Cute little spot about 20 - 30 minutes from the strip. 

The place is small, cozy, and very cute. Love the design.

The service is excellent. The menu extensive (including vegan options.)

We devoured everything thrown our way and I found myself eating stuff I'd normally never try.

The price was pretty nice considering how well we ate.

I highly suggest trying them battered spinach thingies (forgot the name). They are ridiculously good!

delicious fancy Thai food at a slightly higher price point than traditional Thai fare. But great service, friendly staff, good wine selection (50% off bottles on Thursday!). The infused waters are a nice touch. Fried spinach "salad" and the avacado salmon are my fav dishes!

Nittaya's was the perfect backdrop to a rendezvous with an old friend. The decor is quaint and quirky, the venue itself as small as the waiting area of a Cheesecake Factory. But these qualities were what made it a memorable experience to share an intimate gathering with.

We split an array of seafood-based tapas, as well as the tempura-style spinach, with white wines of our respective choosing. Their vino selection was so pleasing to the palate, and the bartender, an interactive treat of a host.

Left so satisfied, so full and so relaxed that I'm thinking about it a whole week later!

Surprisingly very good food in a casual but almost upscale atmosphere. The food was plated nicely and brought out super hot (temperature), which I really appreciate.  I'm giving it 5 stars because the extra service I got. I forgot my credit card and called from the airport on the way back home to CA. They agreed to put it in the mail for me the next morning, which saves me the hassle of requesting a new corporate credit card. Thank you!

We come here often. This is our favorite Thai place in town. Small and intimate. I suggest reservations. If you ask for Thai hot, you will get Thai hot. That's hotter than their 5 on the 1-5 scale. If you are really brave you can ask for it to be as hot as the employees get when she cooks for them.
Amazing place. Great green curry and their desserts are unreal. Highly suggest the green tea Crème brûlée.

Sometimes you miss the hidden gems in your own back yard.  Nestled in a small plaza on lake mead and rampart this restaurant offers a casual but intimate with a bistro style ambiance.

Menu items include tapas which are well priced and amazing flavor. The garlic edamame is wonderful with roasted garlic and Shoshito peppers.  The vegetable potstickers were also very good.

They serve cucumber water and have a superb wine list - with half price (select) wine on Thursdays! 

They have vegetarian options as well as great dinner entrees with meat and seafood made  with fresh ingredients and sauces.  Staff was all very friendly and attentive which made the Experience well worth the visit. Would definitely recommend it and will add to my list of regular places to dine!

This neighborhood gem offers a great bounty of Thai favorites. I recommend the spinach salad if you've not tried it yet! If you enjoy spicy, the volcano shrimp also makes a great starter.
My favorite noodle dish is the drunken noodle. It's also known as pad kee mow. I substitute noodles for the chicken to give it the flavors I had while traveling in Thailand. The coconut curries are delicious and you can adjust your spice level to your liking.

This place was fantastic. Everything we had was prepared with great flavor, and presentation. The service was on top if its game too. I suggest trying everything especially their dessert. I love pad thai, and this place made a wonderful pad thai too. Will defiantly be back again.

Their curries are really tasty. I think they do a great job in keeping the authenticity. I really enjoyed the choice of wine and my favorite the pad kee mao.

Will definitely return here for some delicious Thai cuisine.

This recently opened Thai restaurant specializes in small plates though regular sized entrees are available.  We started off with the tempura spinach salad with ground chicken, shrimp and lime dressing (4.5 Forks) and white fish cake with lettuce, Thai spices and a sweet chili sauce (2 Forks).  Our second order was a stuffed chicken wing (4) and a crab cake in shell (3).  For dessert we enjoyed the housemade coconut ice cream (4).

After many friends have recommended this place, my husband and I finally decided to come here for dinner earlier this week. The food was so good we came back today for take out. The drunken noodles are by far the best I've ever had. Switch out the chicken for shrimp. It's perfectly sautéed and tender, not rubbery. My husband ordered the rain forest fried rice, which was lightly flavored and full of veggies.

This place is so flipping awesome. In December, Ruben and I took our friends visiting from England based on a recommendation. I called for a table and all they had were four seats at the bar, which was more comfortable than we expected. It was a rounded corner, so it still allowed us to be facing each other and it was still intimate. We enjoyed everything we tried and the service was wonderful. Great atmosphere!

We tried the Lettuce Wraps, Fried Avocado, Curry Puffs, Esaan Sausage, World Famous Spinach Salad, Five Spice BBQ Ribs with Citrus-Ginger Glaze, Emerald Fried Rice, Calamari, Housemade Coconut Ice Cream, and Thai Donuts. My favorites were the EMERALD FRIED RICE (I mean, phenomenal), SPINACH SALAD (they'll warn you that it's not really a salad, but it really doesn't matter because the flavor of the lime dressing and the tempura spinach is amazing), ESAAN SAUSAGE (the flavors that they manage to pack in here is so great, you'll be wanting more than the three served), and CALAMARI (wonderful batter and delicious dipping sauce).

All of us truly enjoyed our meal and had so much fun with all the dishes. Because it's such a small space, definitely plan ahead and come with a large group to take advantage of trying a little of everything! They're very accommodating and I'm so happy we were able to dine with them. I can't wait to go back!

Edit (03/01/13): Ruben and I went back for a date night and made a reservation earlier in the day. We had a rocky start; they were really busy and since we were in the back, we felt ignored. No one even acknowledged us when we walked in the door, actually. It took a while and when I said we had a reservation, they just pointed to the table in the back. Once our order was taken, it was smooth sailing (well, it also started to die down from when we first arrived) and everyone was attentive throughout our meal. It's a hard restaurant to be in if you're claustrophobic because you're in extremely close quarters to EVERYONE seated around you. I didn't enjoy being sandwiched between two other parties and unfortunately, hearing their entire conversation. So although it's an intimate space, it's definitely not for an intimate evening. I will probably request the corner bar seating next time since we had a much nicer experience there.

The food was phenomenal again and that definitely solidified my love of Nittaya's. We ordered the same four dishes that stood out last time and it was just as good as I remember. We also ordered the Coconut Soup and Spicy Basil Eggplant as well. Both were delicious, but neither favorites of mine. Since they were out of their bread pudding (I really want to try this!), we opted for the Creme Brûlée trio of Green Tea, Coconut, and Ginger Lemongrass. YUM! We're not big fans of creme brûlée, but these weren't overly sweet and the unique flavors were fun. Oh, and their Sangria is great! I'll need to go back to redeem my free glass!

Nittaya's is a diamond in the rough. I've been here twice and have had a sampling from the tapas and happy endings (dessert) menus. I would recommend particular dishes, but so far everything has been delicious...so try everything! The service is top notch, the decor is beautiful, and the aroma of fresh flowers only adds to the ambiance.  This is the type of place to have a relaxing dinner with friends, to bring a date or out of town guests, or to go just because.
 
P.S. Half price bottles of wine on Thursdays!
This is by far my favorite neighborhood restaurant!  It is so cute and intimate!  The presentation of the food is beautiful!

I've always come here for work events and during lunch time. I was recommended the "world famous spinach salad" this was really world famous. When people say deep fried things are amazing they weren't lying! This deep friend spinach is crunchy and filling as far as the sauce that comes along with it it's amazing. I always stick to the drunken noodle which I really recommend. I feel like lunch time sizes vary from dinner sizes and that there may also be the price difference. My boyfriend decide to get the Duck curry I believe and I'm not a huge fan of curry but he said it was delicious, the meat was definitely soft tasted really good.

I didn't try any drinks this time but they have a wide range of wine options and some unique beers, my boyfriend decide to order the Lucky Buddha beer which comes in this really unique glass. 

 It's a small place yet the service is great. I can honestly say that my glass was always refilled with water and someone always came to check up on us and not in an annoying overbearing way either.

If you're in the Summerlin area definitely check out Nittaya's Secret Kitchen.

Great food, but was a little slow on the service and a tad expensive for what you get. i think there are better places in town that have the same menu or close. If you live in the Summerlin area and want to a short trip with good food, Nittaya's is a safe bet. But if you live elsewhere, use the gas to hit up other places around town.
great thai fusion cuisine. very inventive and flavorful. great atmosphere and friendly service. definitely worth trying.
This place sucks horrible service and that's the secret I had to open a yelp account just to post this

Wow I'd have to say that this place is a hidden gem! Romantic ambience and authentic Thai food is the theme. I started off with a beautiful white sangria that had a flower in it. Be careful, these are dangerous! They are very sweet and go down very easily. We tried multiple tapas including the golden pouches, fried avocado, and Siamese corn fritters. My favorite of these were the corn fritters. They had a crunchy exterior with a soft stuffing including kernels of corn, pork and spices. The sauce that came with these was delicious! It was sweet and had peanuts floating in it. The golden pouches were also very tasty. I got these to try their curry sauce which was excellent. These pouches were so pretty I didn't even want to eat them! The fried avocado was also very tasty and an interesting concept. At last I tried the chocolate banana beignets. OMG these were divine. They were stuffed with a deep dark chocolate and bananas in the inside. They were then drizzled with chocolate on the outside. They came hot and freshly fried. This place serves a multitude of wines and had two beers on tap.  It did not appear that they serve any type of mixed drinks or hard liquor. This secret place is definitely a restaurant that should not be kept secret!

ooo I think about this place all the time. It is pricier than I would want thai food to be but I just crave the spinach salad. It is not what you are thinking... this is actually no salad at all. It is lightly tempura battered spinach leaves served as chips with this delicious dip made from ground chicken, cashews, cilantro, carrots, and onions. mm mm good! That is a MUST order when going here. I love the feeling of being in there too, they set the mood for Thai perfect.  Get off yelp & go!
Restaurant is very small. I suppose that's the new fad. The food is superb. It is very pricey so be prepared to spend about $20 per entree.

What a great concept, my husband and I enjoyed the small plates Nittayas has managed to put a fun and creative way to eat authentic Thai food. The place is very pretty nice atmosphere, the owner and chef happened to stop by are table we  where telling her we are enjoying the taste treats, she said she uses her mother's recipes and also adds her own style to the dishes. I would definitely be going back maybe bring some of my friends on girls night out!!

I have loved Nittaya's for years! Of course, the spinach salad appetizer is AMAZING, and everything else is perfect, too. I usually get the pad see ew, and it is great. I am happy they expanded into the space next door and there's more space to move around now!
Great little find. The food is always amazing. My favorite is the Spinach Salad. Tempura spinach leaves with a flavorful dip.

The food was absolutely amazing and so delicious. Service was great. Food came out quick and hot. The coconut shrimp soup is a must. Highly recommend this place. The place is also decorated nicely and feels very homey.

We ate here twice and both times it was excellent. They had no problem converting dishes to our vegan preferences, replacing chicken with tofu in the spinach salad and making things without egg. You definitely want a reservation though. We stopped by on a random day of the week and there was a line out the door and they were unable to serve us.

Went there tonight for the first (and last) time and the first dish (Thai wings) was so bad, it ruined our night. See pic below - a feather in the skin! My fiancé tried to return them at first because she saw chicken HAIR. They claimed it was lemongrass - really?! So we each had one wing and then the feather. We promptly returned them and were able to get a refund.

The main dishes weren't so bad - Shrimp Pad Thai and Seafood Madness. But the price - $19 each?! There's better Pad Thai for half that price at a dozen other places around town.

Surprisingly this place was near-packed, though it's also quite tiny. I can mainly attribute the crowd to the fact that there are few other quality restaurants in the area.

Which brings me to my conclusion. We have basically a South Summerlin and a North Summerlin. Both have wonderful homes in beautiful neighborhoods. But a big difference - FOOD. We live in the South and are truly blessed to have a ridiculous amount of tasty restaurants in our area. Down the road from us (near Ft Apache) there are THREE Thai restaurants that are all a better value than Nittaya's.

To you North Summerlin folks - I feel sorry for your limited food options - please feel free to drive out to the South side for some REAL food!
Oh my goodness... So enjoyed everything on this little Thai gem, place is small but very nicely decorated,   Food was amazing I had spinach salad and steak avocado curry for lunch and it's delicious!

We just thought this place was just the same old Thai Food but... when we tasted this place. OMG!It was the best place ever. All 8 of us had a huge table, no kidding, the whole table was full of AWESOME food. Like I think this place is the best Thai food ever!! My favorite here is the Papaya Salad. We got in total: Steak Curry, Salmon Curry, Basil Lamb Chops, 2 Sticky Rices, Papaya Salad, Pineapple Fried Rice, Shrimp Fried Rice and lots more! Emoji Style:

The food and service were both very good, but definitely overpriced.  We had the secret stickers, angel wing and volcano shrimp.  All were excellent, but we didn't like that the sauce for the volcano shrimp was all the way at the bottom of the almost enclosed bowl.  You had to dig through the rest of the shrimp to get any sauce.  The drunken noodles were very good, but I thought the seafood madness was overly sweet.  Very nice place to come with great service, but you pay a bit too much for the food.
The most amazing Thai food!!! Great ambiance , music and staff is amazing!! Josh was our bartender and he rocks too!

Excellent service by Leah, she was very nice and had great recommendations. I had the green curry and gf had the Massaman chicken curry served with brown rice. Both were fantastic! I wish I lived in Las Vegas to come to this spot. They will make any dish with Tofu for vegetarians. The lunch special includes the brown/white rice, a salad and fried vegetable dumpling.
Went here to try for lunch today. Going through Yelp photos just now at home, I realized the wait staff deliberately did not give us the lunch menu.   What a shame. So deceitful.
Great food. Great ambience. Great presentation. Great staff. Be sure to try the eggplant panang!

Transported upon entry, this cozy dining room with a wine bar suggests a more European feel than a Thai restaurant.  Two menus are presented - one a conventional Thai listing with adapted names for American tastes, like "Pad Z-U".  The other is a tapas menu with an Asian bend.  The papaya salad with prawns tasted authentic but a touch spicy for my dining partner.  We were not offered the '1 to 5' spicy range, but notice the reviews include such a choice.  Nonetheless, I enjoyed the salad 'kick' without complaint.  The catfish was presented with a tasty curry-like sauce that worked very well.  We considered tapas, but our two dishes satisfied.

The wine list demonstrates a competent selection with an adequate variety by the glass.  However, our Pinot Noir must have sat in the bottle at least overnight and lacked character.  It's truly awkward to send back glasses of wine during a first visit as these glasses were "borderline" in my opinion, so we shifted gears for 2nd glasses and commented politely to the waiter about the 1st.  I suggest tasting before committing until they cycle their by-the-glass bottles properly.

Service was capable and polite.  Reservations are recommended as the size of the dining room is limited for your pleasure and comfort.  I'll be back.

This place is a hidden gem. I have seen this place while driving by so many times and the sign was just intriguing right off the bat - Thai * Tapas * Wine.... 3 of my favorite things!! Well how stupid am I for waiting so long to try it? This place was SOOOOO good. It was unique, very small dining room, cozy feel... We tried everything that was recommended to us for our first time and we were not disappointed. We did the chicken skewers with the peanut sauce, salmon avocado curry (which I wasn't too keen on from the description, but once I actually tried it I was so thankful I listened), we did the world famous spinach salad.... Not a salad at all, but the sauce was to die for. I checked in on Yelp to receive a free sangria... DELICIOUS and beautiful presentation! This place is a MUST GO TO! Recommending you make a reservation because we showed up at 5:30 and we were the only ones in the dining room - but 30 minutes to an hour later there wasn't a table available!! LOVE this place.
Just all around awesome. My friends and my favorite spot. Hidden and hopefully not everyone finds out about it. Will definitely keep it our secret.

My friend girl has been raving about this small intimate dining experience so naturally I had to give it ago!!

Reservations are highly recommended because Nittaya's Thai Kitchen is pretty busy (at least it was Friday 7/10)

We ordered Red & White Sangria for starters which I recommend! Delish...

*Siamese Egg Rolls (veggie) $9 were excellent
*Garlic Edamame
*Chicken Ginger Salad $16
*Calamari 
*Shrimp, Jalapeño, Cream Cheese Puff

$80+tip

I look forward to returning in the near future and thank you Pum for you phenomenal service!
Absolutely amazing. Everything i had tapa style was to die for. And that bread pudding with coconut ice cream. Ohhhhh heaven in your mouth. So good. I'll be back to this gem.

#latereview 08/09/2015

I enjoyed my time more being with friends than being here. I will give them a chance again but for now I have other go to places for Thai.

Now I know going in that I should be more prepared and check to see if reservations were needed. My friend suggested this place without a reservation. So we ended up being sat at the bar. No worries there. Completely our fault.

To start off the dinner with friends I ordered my usual papaya salad. Theirs had shrimp so I said why not? I enjoyed the flavor more than the dish itself. The dressing was on point, but the usual crispness that you would expect from a green papaya was just not there. The peanuts did lend to the crunchiness but it was not the same. I appreciate seafood but for some reason to me it did not pair well with the salad. I don't know how the shrimp was handled during preparation but it did not have a good texture. Like it sat too long in the dressing maybe? It was just off putting. I didn't get sick after the dinner so I'm not saying the shrimp was spoiled, but it did not have the usual characteristic of something fresh. 

The Duck Breast Curry was okay. Well, better than okay. I appreciated the fact that it was a duck breast which meant no bones to pick through, but it was just not the same as other duck curries I've had at other restaurants. 

By the time I got to the dessert, I was impressed by the presentation... Then this happened. This is more of the chef in me so I don't know if it goes unnoticed by most people, but seeing that same garnish (purple edible orchids) throughout all my courses... I think it's enough. Yes there's a time and place for it but not through every single course. 

All in all, I felt the food was okay. Would I go back? I would not actively do it but if friends suggested it I will still go.
Delicious and fresh Thai food! The fried spinach salad is a speciality of the house-- it is very unique and delicious! Highly recommend the chicken lettuce wraps and Bangkok fried rice as well

Thai food in vegas can be quite difficult to find.  Next to Lotus of Siam, Nittaya's is my favorite.  They have some interesting dishes such as the spinach salad and the charred peppers and are also willing to account for those of us with dietary restrictions.  In addition to the above mentioned dishes I also had the basil eggplant with tofu.  I wish I had ordered it a 5 spicy, as I got the 3 and tasted no spice at all.  The flavor was great, and would get it again, just order a higher spice level.

The decor is great, the waitstaff is nice.  The place is tiny so reservations are recommended it was packed when we went.

I have never been treated quite this way at a restaurant. We first ordered two beers and 30 minutes later the waiter told us it would be another 5 minutes before we would get our beers. Ten minutes went by and we didn't get even a glass of water. We ordered two appetizers and one came out after an hour and the other didn't arrive after an hour and a half. We didn't even bother to order a dinner as we didn't feel like being there for an additional 2 hours. Then they tried to charge us for the beers that we never did get. I checked my credit card statement a week later and I found that the waiter double charged my credit card on accident. When I called to speak to Nattaya she was "too busy" to call me back and I had to keep calling until I finally spoke to her. She told me she just didn't have time to look through her statements and she would call me back in a few days. A few days went by and a waiter ended up calling me back telling me that he would have to be responsible for the additional money that was charged on my credit card. I will never go back to this restaurant again and Nattaya should check the labor laws as she doesn't treat her staff right. Mistakes happen, but you don't make your customer feel guilty for them. Avoid this restaurant at all costs.

My first time dining at Nittaya's Secret Kitchen and it is a beautiful place.  I love the different vegeterian dishes.  The spinach salad is great.  This place is tucked away and is truly a secret.  I can't wait to share Nittaya's Secret Kitchen with others.

Just got a take-out order from here, was recommended by a friend and definitely realize why, besides loving every dish We tasted, when we got home the pad Thai was missing from our order so we called them up, apparently they didn't have that we ordered it....  So they delivered the dish to our house, free of charge!   We kinda expected to pay for the dish and was just happy they were delivering it, so that was a pleasant surprise....   Not just going out of their way to make customers happy, but this food is awesome, try it if your nearby

Wow what a treat! A friend recommended I try this place and I'm glad I did. I ordered the seafood medley but in Penang curry. The dish was beautiful with the clams, mussels, shrimp, fish etc. spice was good. I prefer so hot that it makes me cry. Not quite that but just right to taste it without over powering the other flavors. Friendly staff, great atmosphere, wonderful food. What else would you want.

I am slightly hesitant to give such a great review because the place is so small that if it gets too popular i will not be able to get a seat, but with this many great reviews, i would say the secret is out. Absolutely wonderful. I am always pleased when I eat here. By far and away the best item is the famous fried salad. It has a tangy vinaigrette with cashews and even a little bit of savory cheese. I really like the Panang curry, a little spicier than many places but by no means Thai spicy. This is a really small place, I recommend reservations. Highly recommend.
Loved the spinach tempura salad and wine list. The tapas portions are large. Will be back!

This is such a cute little date night spot! Very intimate and inviting. I didn't want to cook tonight so I ordered take out but now that I've been this is definitely a higher end Thai food place than I usually go for take out. I ordered beef pad se ew and chicken pad Thai. This cost $40 where my usual place would of been $20. The quality of beef was a noticeable difference. Both dishes were delicious but next time I'd prefer to eat there to take in the ambiance. I'll take the hubby on the next date night.
One of my favorite places. Innovative. Scrumptious. Always fresh and served beautifully and with a smile. Just great in every way.

Treasure in Summerlin!  Cozy atmosphere.  Authentic Thai cuisine served by very friendly staff.  Thursday night is half of wine bottle night.  The menu is extensive enough that you can eat there regularly and always have something different.  They did this place right!

Great ambience; contemporary and cool. Plates beautifully presented. The food vibrant and fresh. Truly representative of an eatery in Summerlin (Hawaii yeeps, think Kahala)

Authentic Thai? No. Unless you think people in Thailand eat orchids.  But a prettied up example for Western palates.

Every dish I've ever sampled has highs and lows. For example, the spinach salad that so many rave about. The tempura spinach is excellent. Crispy with just the right salinity. Perfect fresh out of the clean oil. Unfortunately a dip in the sour, herbaceous sauce muddles the flavor and does nothing but make the dish soggy.

The server recommended marinated crispy pork, very moist with deep five spice flavor, with a crisp breaded coating, tasty. When mixed with the accompanying chili sauce, the crust becomes soggy and the oil becomes pronounced.

Golden pouches, pretty, but the deep-fried wrapper is too thick to bite through, forcing you to turn it upside down and soak it in the curry to soften. All good as the pouches break open and the creamy potato taste great with the curry.

In general Curries are very flavorful. Great coconut taste well integrated spice. You won't see chili oil floating on the surface. Proteins in the curries are well cooked.  Chicken and pork are especially tender and still moist.

Conversely, sauces don't complement dishes very well. All good, it's fun getting the pork into the curry and the spinach into the chili sauce. All better flavor combinations.

Great added touches such as an orange cucumber infused water.

Service is very welcoming and off Strip friendly.

So why four stars? Simple, The food is intriguing. Take the highs of each dish, play with your food make your own combinations.  In the end, a fun dining experience.

Tai do it's for desert they are good and I don't even eat sweets. The order is large and comes with 5 per order. 

My only complaint is all the chicken dishes come with very little chicken. If you don't order extra chicken in the chicken friend rice you get 5 pieces and same with the curry. It's very little chicken and all potatoes. Substitute the potatoes for veggies and order chicken extra.

I have had a few Thai restaurant experiences, but this one was by far excellent. The restaurant's ambience is great,  the staff is friendly and attentive, and the food is delicious. The lamb chops were done superb. The basil and garlic sauce was perfectly done and the meat melted in my mouth. I also tried their pot stickers as appetizer, they were spectacular. The only thing that could have improved the experience would have been bigger tables and chairs. As a guy who is 6'5" the seats were too low and soft and the tables appeared to be below even standard height.
Why haven't we come here sooner? This is the best restaurant we have been to since moving to Las Vegas. We ordered a bunch of small plates and soups. Everything was fantastic! We will be back!

Nittayas is by far the nicest, classiest...and most expensive Thai food restaurant I've visited!  I'm pretty sure this was the first time I've ever been asked if I had a reservation...for lunch...for Thai food lol.  And it was the only time I've ever felt self conscience for my 2 year old Little Foodie Dude eating with me during lunch!

It is very chic, glamorous and date night appropriate! Service was great as well...and food was outstanding...but you'll pay for it!

Coming here during lunch is a great deal! They have $11 lunch specials (yes, expensive compared to others around $5-7 range) but they are packed with flavor and use quality ingredients...you really can taste the difference! The lunch specials also come with a house salad and pot sticker which were both pretty good.  Portions are decent as well, so you should leave satisfied :)

I went with my standard Drunken Noodles aka Pad Kee Mao. This was an excellent rendition, with lots of flavor even with chicken instead of pork! I love chinese broccoli, so I was excited to see it in the dish! I asked for it extremely spicy though, and what I got was a 1/10 on my scale...I should have sent it back, but it was soo good even without the spice! 

Also tried their version of Pad Thai. Surprisingly, this was more spicy than the request for 10/10! I really liked their version of this dish, and is probably the best Pad Thai I've ran into so far, although I don't often order this dish.

But what if you don't come here during lunch? Expect to pay $16 for drunken noodles ala carte. They had $15 desserts on the menu. Yes, there are some cheaper alternatives, but I don't even remember seeing $15 desserts in some of the best steakhouses in town!

But you need to check this place out if you are a Thai food lover...just go during lunch IMO!

I'm not very generous with five star reviews, but Nittaya deserve's each and every one.  From the general atmosphere (intimate and romantic) to the hibiscus lemonade,  the bacon grilled shrimp to the pad thai, everything is done with skill and flair.

Each item on the menu marries traditional with experimental and results in a fusion of pure flavorful bliss.  Nittaya's Secret Kitchen is a secret gem tucked away in Summerlin that I will continue to visit as long as I'm able to.

The signature dish here is the spinach salad, which not really a salad, but fried and lightly breaded spinach that you dip into an addictive dressing. This appetizer is so good you want to rub it all over yourself, but won't unless you want to end up in jail. 

The decor is tasteful and modern reflecting the Thai fusion style of the restaurant. The wait staff and knowledgeable, friendly, and attentive. 

We had the drunken noodles and the  the coconut seafood curry. Both dishes were delicious, with complex, rich, and spicy flavors. The drunken noodles were tasty, different, and unique with the addition of basil and Chinese broccoli. The coconut seafood curry was an amazing combination of fish, shrimp, mussels, clams, and scallops in a sumptuous curry sauce, just flat out fantastic!

Went for dinner on a Thursday night abs had a great experience. First of all, wine is half off the bottle on Thursdays....can't go wrong with that! Outside patio is nice (minus the bench seat very uncomfortable) and perfect when the sun is setting. Overall one word for the food....amazing. The spicy catfish is delicious and the shrimp pad Thai is amazing. Will be back again....and again.

Nittaya's is a Beautiful little secret kitchen. Call and make reservation in order to guarantee your seat in this small intimate dining area.....once you do, you will be pleased you did. They serve so many wonderful dishes that you must return to try them. Some of the must haves are the Spinach Salad and Beef Jerky tapas. The tastes are amazing. Move on to the entrees and you will be pleased with the freshness and the tastes that come. Service is great. Atmosphere is unique and sexy. Food is top notch. My favorite Thai!

All in all, food was excellent...Service was so so. They lost our reservation and we squeezed in at the bar, then 40 minutes later they found it and we finished our dinner at a table. Bar tender was not friendly and seemed overwhelmed. The rest of the staff has nice and hospitable and apologetic. The spinach salad was amazing and the eggplant Panang was excellent.  Pad Z U was above average. I'd go back but make sure they repeat back to you your reservation so you don't have any problem.
The service was attentive and fantastic. The food was great and this is a very nice hidden gem. I found this location by accident while searching for a lunch spot on Yelp
One of mine and my sisters favorites! The staff is amazing and this place seriously got me hooked on coconut soup! It's super cozy and perfect for a date night or just hanging out with friends.

I really really enjoy this secret kitchen... it is no longer a secret as it tends to always be busy every night.

The wine selection is amazing, the food is always so fresh and mouthwatering.
