They always serve infused water, which here in the desert is so nice and satisfying as it refreshes you and cleanses your palate.

I am embarrassed to say that I am one of those that cannot handle too much spice when it comes to food, I have tried and tried to no avail...my friends and family have a running joke that even ice is too spicy :) for me.

Here they always listen to my request when I say p,ease make it a 0 with no spice and I have never been disappointed 
My family likes the 5-8 spice range and they also are always satisfied.. if we share a dish they always split it and make sure that my "ice" spice is separate from the better seasoned (ha ha)
Food.

We always get the same order and then try one new dish.
Our favorite appetizers: chicken lettuce wraps, yummmmmmy .. they come in orders of 4 wraps and yes, the sauce is on the side, I can handle a little bit of it but you really don't need much sauce as the flavors are wonderful.
The crispy spinach and the secret stickers or potstickers.

Main course we get an order of massaman curry Chicken with you guessed it, no spice 
And the Basil chicken.
Pineapple fried rice which is served inside half of the pineapple

They always bring extra spices for the table which is usually kept at the other end of the table.
We also get one other dish to try each time and have never been disappointed with the experience 

I usually pass when it comes to desert, my suggestion here... Don't! Their deserts melt in your mouth, the ice cream is creamy and yummy... the fried banana is done to perfection and the fried donuts are scrumptious.

This is a place that we go to often, yes it's in a strip mall (not a big deal)  but so adorably decorated.. it is a bit on the smaller side, but so worth the crowded feel..they do have patio dining I have never tried that but it looks comfy... they have excellent happy hour items and great offerings for happy hour.

Always a great meal.
I love the spinach salad it's amazing!! The drunken noodles were awesome too. I ordered a 5 heat level didn't really feel like it was that hot but I know I tend to eat spicier than most people.
Beautiful and intimate little restaurant. The service was stellar and the food was delicious. Nice wine list. The only drawback is you are very close to to your neighbors.

We had this for lunch. Excellent food and service. Small intimate place with mellow music and ambiance. 

We had muay thai rice, ginger mushroom chicken, and drunken noodles with potstickers and salad. The drunken noodles were the overall favorite but all were fabulous.
This is a hidden gem. By far the best thai food ive ever had. Cant go wrong with anything starting from appatezier to dessert

Absolutely loved everything!!! There was not one dish that we got that was not delicious. And, the Secret Sangria was excellent, and obviously a favorite because I had four. Definitely a MUST if you're looking for an out-of-the-way spot, with an intimate setting. Perfect for a date. It was date night with my husband, and Nittaya's was totally his idea. I was so pleased with his selection.

Service was awful and extremely slow. We were seated by the front door when every few minutes the door would open and let in the light and heat which was blinding. When asked for extra sauce for the extremely dry chicken satay we were informed that there would be a charge, agreed, the our waiter proceeded to not bring it. We asked several waiters for assistance but nothing happened.  Highly not recommended

I can see why this place has such good reviews and is booked out so often!
We arrived at 5pm for an early dinner without a booking. We were seated immediately and had the table available til 7, which suited us as we were off to a show. The staff were polite and very efficient. Our water was topped up after a few sips every time! The food was absolutely delicious. Very well presented, cooked perfectly and authentic, dynamic, balanced flavors. 
The venue is well stocked with wines and very ambient and cosy. A great location for romantic dates, but also popular for larger parties. The waitresses were very attentive and made sure we were happy with everything. This restaurant is a surprising and impressive hidden gem in Summerlin!
We can't wait to eat here again and will be taking our visiting families here soon also.

Items selected:

Strawberry Lemon Water
Whitefish Cake - Cucumber and sweet Chili Sauce
World Famous Spinach Salad - Tempura with lime dressing and chicken
Duck Breast Curry - Coconut Curry Sauce, Pineapple, Cherry Tomatoes, Thai Basil, Peppers
Island Bread Pudding with Coconut Rum Caramel Sauce and Coconut Ice Cream

Sharing a city with one of the most highly acclaimed Thai restaurants in the United States cannot be easy but with Lotus of Siam's largely traditional menu routinely garnering hour-plus waits for both lunch and dinner it could also be said that Las Vegas is an ideal locale for something small, intimate, and innovative - a description defined by Chef Nittaya Parawong and her Secret Kitchen.  Featuring a style described as "Thai Tapas" alongside traditional curries and noodles with each dish made by Nittaya herself and served by friendly Taiwanese servers in a modern yet elegant space a meal at Nittaya's Secret Kitchen is a relaxed and refined affair beginning with complimentary flavored water and although the menu featured no less than a dozen items I'd have liked to try, the decision was made to start with a variety of tapas, appetizer, and curry plus dessert - each item prepared to order, ample in portion, and served with impeccable pacing.  Intentionally incorporating fish, vegetable, and meat before progressing to dessert and focusing on the more innovative options both the crispy fish cakes and the tender duck breast would prove delicious and well prepared with light sweetness acting to temper the heat and moving on to the "famous" salad I really have no idea how the chef manages to produce a batter so light and a flavor so vegetal but whatever the method it should be embraced, the dish one of the best things I've eaten at a Thai restaurant and without a doubt the most innovative 'salad' I've had in years.  Moving on to the dessert menu there was never really a question as to what I would order and with tender pineapple pudding rife with coconut milk custard topped off with both ice cream and caramel of the same I really cannot think of a better 'Thai' dessert, traditional or not, nor a better thing ever done with a coconut.

Someone let the cat out of the bag, since lots of people seem to know about this hidden gem. 

They were able to accommodate our party, even though I made a last minute reservation on Christmas Eve. Sadly, I did not get one of the white cushy chairs; they brought in an outdoor table and chairs, in order to squeeze us in--literally. By the way, the restaurant was super busy that night, and I was just thrilled to be back.

Our server was sweet and very witty. She made the best recommendations, and made us feel well taken care of.

We ordered Pad Thai, Pad Si Ew, fried tofu, green curry chicken and their signature spinach salad. The salad was the perfect appetizer for our party of four. We enjoyed it so much that I ordered it for dessert (for the entire table of course). Be advised, this is a savory, deep fried salad, with a sweet sauce on the side. 

Normally, we order several desserts and tea, but we were stuffed. Their pastry chef does a fine job, so please don't skip dessert.

Best Thai food I have ever had! I will never go to Archie's again! Service is great and the food is even better. The restaurant is beautifully decorated and it is treated as an upscale restaurant.I highly recommend coming in for lunch because their lunch specials are so much cheaper and they are just as amazing! Even ordering to go is smooth. I highly recoupment the pan fried noodles, the drunken noodles, the spring rolls, and the mango sticky rice!

Was in Vegas for a conference and it had been a long day - 6 hour flight followed by a drive to Death Valley. On the way from Death Valley to my hotel, I called the the restaurant around 9:15pm and they said to come on down, even though they close at 10pm.  

First, the excellent customer service - I got there at around 9:35pm, but they were very welcoming and not for a moment did I feel that they were in a hurry for me to leave. Very nice!

I ordered a green chicken curry but with extra vegetables - they were happy to oblige. The vegetables were actually the star of the show - perfectly cooked, for each type of vegetable they put in - perfect balance of firm and tender.  And they did not skimp  on the quantity or variety   - mushrooms, green beans, carrots, broccoli, egg plant.  

The curry itself was of just the right  consistency-  not too thick and not watery, with just the right amount of heat and deep, complex flavor.  Just to note, the quantities are very generous- enough for two.   

Finally, I ordered the donuts which had just right amount of sweet to end the day.  

Highly recommended and well worth the money.

This place is the BEST! I ordered this to go, but I have eaten at the restaurant and it is just as great. We ordered a ton of food tonight including drunken noodles with tofu, fried avocado, spinach salad, ribs, pad thai, edamame, and chicken fried rice. The drunken noodles were for me, usually it comes with chicken but since I don't eat chicken they were able to substitute it with tofu. My other favorite thing from here is the fried avocado. I really can't think of anything I like more than fried avocados. If you were to dine in the restaurant it is a bit nicer than other Thai restaurants I've been to in Las Vegas. It's definitely a great spot for date night or girls night. The restaurant is pretty small, so I would recommend making reservations if you were to go on the weekend. Also, this place is very vegetarian friendly!

Always crave the spinach salad. Finally tried the garlic rice minus the cilantro.  Nice wine variety. This is my new favorite and must have this at least once a week:)   This is my 4th time here and finally ordered dessert! Fried banana and coconut ice cream WITH caramel rum sauce. Now, the coffee served French press style! 4 stars, place is a bit tight.

Food was fantastic, service was pretty good, but I have never been asked to leave a restaurant because there were people waiting for our table. Unbelievable! Very rude! Never in my life have I had this happen. Our feeling was that once we paid our check we were no longer valued. Very disappointed.

The decor is nice, rustic, Napa Valley-like exposed brick and wood with concrete floors making it seem you are in CA.
The food is outstanding in flavor with just the right seasoning, not too spicy or pungent. Good portions and selection with a twist on traditional Thai flavors.
The service on the day we went was terribly slow and the waitstaff did not pay attention to customers, reacted slowly to requests and seemed to lack a sense of urgency. It's the only reason the review earns 3 stars. Otherwise it would have been a 5 but 2 hours for lunch is excessive.

Thanks to my sister for this recommendation. My fiance and I came here for lunch this time around at 1pm in the afternoon. Only a few others were here, and the perfect time to take  your time to eat. If you plan on coming in for dinner highly recommend to make reservations as they get packed. 

For our second visit, I noticed the menu is more expansive. They do have lunch specials going for $11 with salad and chicken potsticker from 11am-3pm. The rest of the menu has appetizers, tapas, entrees, a huge list of wine, cocktails, and alcohol and desserts. 

What we ordered: the famous spinach salad w/the lime sauce, thai beef jerky w/the green sauce  (beware, this green sauce is soooo addicting), pork belly w/the spicy chilli sauce, shrimp, secret stickers (basil chicken flavored) and the muay thai fried rice. Everything we ordered came mostly off of the tapas menu and the muay thai fried rice we decided to get from the dinner menu. 

Everything we tasted has been the best thai food we have tasted in so long.  Spinach salad is enough to feed a party of 4 to 5 ppl. Spinach also has been perfectly cooked. Adding the lime sauce adds a bit of the kick. Definitely recommend for first timers. Pork belly with the chilli sauce and the pork was tender. This is the thai version of the Filipino version of lechon. Shrimp was on point with the chilli sauce. The chicken basil pot stickers, were different. Crunchy on the outside and juicy, tender when you bite right into it. Last, the fried rice was fluffy and evenly seasoned and enough to feed a whole family.

The service: by far one of the best. They were attentive, suggested other options, on point with refills. 

Overall: we enjoyed our service and definitely recommend if you want to enjoy dinner or lunch. Will be back soon.

A beautiful restaurant in Summerlin.  Great ambience and perfect for date night but but BUT, make a reservation as this place is tiny and has limited number of tables.  I went here for our lunchthey're not too busy for lunch. We got a free sangria with our Yelp check-in.

They have a great lunch special menu which comes with a salad with ginger dressing, pot sticker and entree for about $11.  I got pad thai spicy 3 out of 5,drunken noodles spicy 5 out of 5.  My pad thai came out really spicy and the drunken noodles were milder so we swapped towards the end when I was covering my nose with tissue.  Despite that, I thought the food was delicious.

Service was great.  Our server was attentive.  The food is more expensive here than other Thai restaurants but this is more upscale Thai cuisine.  I'd have to come back here for their tapas and I know I will be back.

Lovely staff. I tasted 3 wines before settling on one. Waitress was friendly, patient and informative about the food. Very unusual selections. Corn fritters made with ground pork, tempura spinach, cilantro steak skewers. All fantastic with individual sauces! Our first time but will be back.

We were pleasantly surprised about this hidden gem. The reason one star is missing is because they were out of each wine we tried to order on their half off night- which was frustrating.  However, the rest of the meal pleased us.  Never would I think a fried spinach salad would taste so good.  We also enjoyed the drunken noodles and  red curry. The dining room is small, so a reservation is highly recommended.

We loved the spinach salad and the soups! The entree were good, but the rice was below average. Could have been an off night for the rice. The service was good and they let us have our dog join us on the patio. There are no patio heaters, so it might be a better to do with your well behaved puppy during the spring. We will definitely return, good wine selection too.

I have been going to this restaurant for several years.  
I moved to other side of town and had not been back for at least a year.  I returned again recently and must say I still love their dishes.  
      It's considered by some as gourmet Thai food! 
You must have the fried spinach and shishito peppers to start.  
    My favorite dish is the avocado curry salmon. I simply can't get enough of this delicious combination.  I also still think it's one of the best Pad Thai in town. 
     They have a great wine selection. 
     One thing I will say and perhaps it was on off night when we went, but service was slow , floors were a bit dirty and setting wasn't as polished as I had remembered it to be. None the less, their food is so very flavorful.

Nittaya's Secret Kitchen is just that (a secret) it definitely is a diamond in the rough in regards to location. It's a little hard to find if you don't know the area well. It's tucked away behind all the buildings on the Southeast corner of Lake Mead Blvd. and Rampart Blvd.
I had to bring the crew here because I've been telling them about it for a while. They were blown away. They absolutely loved it, it was good to see how much everybody else liked it. I feel like I'm always biased because of how much I like my favorite restaurants but this was different, everyone at the table couldn't stop talking about how good the food was. So I knew it wasn't me being biased. The staff is extremely friendly and kind. The restaurant itself is decorated with style and class. It's very clean inside and they pride themselves with running a tight ship. Anyway if you decide to make the trip down to Nittaya's Secret Kitchen just order your favorite Thai dish and buckle up because you're in for a treat..!
Ciao

Checked out the website today, looks like they updated it and it looks great, plus they've taken out the prices and added some tempting lunch specials.   Fully upgrading to the 4 stars that the food deserved.  Everything seems A OK now!

I can't say enough good things about my recent dinner. As a huge fan of Thai food, I was pleasantly surprised to find a nice mix of familiar favorites and wonderful modern new twists. We had the Spinach Salad (of course!), volcano shrimp, Cashew Shrimp and Chicken Masaman Curry. Every single dish was delightful. The flavors of the cashew shrimp were bright and slightly spicy. The curry was creamy, slightly spicy and rich. An OMG the spinach salad was insanely addicting. 
If you are in Summerlin this is a fantastic relaxed date night spot or a great gathering spot with friends. Also, Thursday night is half price bottles of wine and they do have a happy hour from 3-6p, I believe.

I tried this place recently and loved it.  I went there with a group of friends and We usually just go to the same chain restaurants over and over so we decided to try something new.  

We were very pleasantly surprised with this restaurant.  We split several dishes, like Tapas.  The food is amazing.  Each dish was unique and we enjoyed trying a number of different dishes.  The prices were also reasonable. We will definitely be back.

Tip: make a reservation.  The restaurant is small and popular, so it fills up quickly.

All I can say is WOW is this place good!!  My husband and i stumbled on this spot and we are hooked.  It is VERY small inside but it lends to the cool vibe.  Service is EXCELLENT and very attentive.  The food is off th ehook.  Be sure to ask for specials, we learned that trick on visit #3.  ALso, you should try the tempura fried spinach salad, it is remarkable!!
Several unique dishes we loved - Kao Soi noodles, shrimp pad Thai and chicken satay. All very good. Excellent home made coconut ice cream. Highly recommend.

The restaurant is small and intimate.  The service we had was excellent. Very attentive but not to the point where we felt they were interrupting us.  The food was fresh, hot and very tasty.the Tapas selection is great and Curry dishes are delish.  Great wine selection.  The first time I've been to a Thai place. Very enjoyable time. Looking forward to a return visit

I am giving this place 4 stars based upon the quality of the food.  It was very good. However,  the prices are ridiculous. I understand that it is supposed to be an upscale Thai/tapas/wine place, but no Thai restaurant should charge $16 - $24 an entrée.  I ordered drunken noodles & the Angel wing, and my bill was $26, and the potions were small. I got 1 stuffed wing for $8.
While the food is good, I will not be back.

I've eaten in plenty of Thai Restaurants, here and even in Thailand. This was some of the finest I've had. We had Drunken Noodles, a spinach salad that was done as tempura and a Cornish hen....excellent!!! I definitely recommend this establishment

It was my mine and my husbands first time here and we absolutely loved it. The atmosphere was so nice. It was very clean and the service was amazing. The food was very high quality. We have the beef jerky, panang with chicken and the red curry and for desert we got the mango and sticky rice. It was all so good and so fresh. Probably the best Thai restaurant I have ever been to.

My gal pal who knows all the hot spots in LV brought me here one night and it was an authentic experience.  We started with the papaya salad which was spicy and tangy sort of like biting into a freshly rained on Thai jungle.  

The fried avocado was tempura style so very light and came with the most mysteriously delicious green sauce.  The shrimp skewers were seasoned in light curry and presented atop a fresh pineapple slice.  Peanut sauce seemed homemade.  The tropical chicken rice was an earthy delight.  All the ingredients were fresh and colorful without feeling heavy.  The coconut ice cream was like an angelic glimpse into what could be if I lived inside a saccharine coconut.  Still thinking about it.
4 stars doesn't do this place justice. This is a 5 star place!!!! The ambiance, quality of food, and prices are unbelievable!!!! Better than high end places in downtown Las Vegas

First time here.  Food and server James were excellent. However we almost left before we were even seated....  made a reservation as we knew that was a must.  Arrived at 6:15 for our 6:30 reservation. Hostess offered us a high top table next to the bar.  We would have had everyone standing and waiting to be seated practically on-top of us. So we asked for another table.  She told us that we could have another table however we would need to finish by 7:15.  .  It was 6:15. When we questioned that she left to ask someone else. Came back and pointed to a corner table across the room and stated " you can go sit in that corner". Never walked us over. Just pointed.  We almost walked out at that point. Glad we didn't as James apologized numerous times and provided a great dining experience. He inquired what we liked and made some wonderful recommends. James saved the day.  Would have been a 5 star except for experience with hostess.

Very good Thai place in Summerlin 
Got the Thai seafood bouillabaisse in a coconut curry broth 
Pineapple fried rice 
Fried tofu 
Will definitely come back again and try other dishes on the menu

It took us a year to get here but we finally did and loved our lunch experience. We love the decor and sat in the main room. There is a quieter room in the back which also looked inviting. We ordered two appetizers based on reviews and were not disappointed: the spinach salad and the spare ribs. The spinach tempura salad was perfection with an ideal lime dressing. I would say that it was the best tempura dish I have ever had. The five spice sauce on the ribs was also perfect. Both had excellent after tastes that lingered on. The lunch salad was ample with a wonderful light rice vinegar based dressing. Our main dishes were also delicious and of course, we were too full to eat them all. They tasted great the next day. One was a glass noodle dish with lots of veggies snd the other had flat rice noodles with chicken. Standard fare but very tasty sauces. We cannot wait to return to try other dishes.
Nittaya's is always one of our go to places! Love their food and the service is always great!

Excellent!
A hidden gem. 
After our awesome meal, we had the thai donuts and paired it w the coconut ice cream. It was great!

Almost everything we got was great!  The dough on the Curry Dumplings was just a bit to heavy and seemed to suck in all the oil.  They were kind of thick and the presentation was a bit odd with them served on a very skinny dish all in a row.  Maybe a different serving presentation, dough and a sauce of some sort would help.  The seared tuna tapas was wonderful and dinner of skirt steak avocado curry and garlic saffron rice was amazing!  The place is a bit small for the type of seating they use so when its crowded you really have to plan your exit.  Would I go back?  Yes, there are many more items i can't wait to try!

What ever you do you must order the spinach salad!!! Thank goodness my mom lives down the street... I always have reason to visit this gem. One of the best Thai restaurants I have eaten at. Don't expect to leave with a left over bag, you will probably eat everything on your plate since the portions are just right.

Tried Nittaya's last night on the recommendation of a friend. So GOOD! After reading Yelp reviews, we called ahead to reserve a table for four, which turned out to be a good idea, even on a Monday night. Great service, great food. Fried avocado, beef salad, angel wings, duck breast curry, combo pad thai, coconut ice cream. I look forward to the warmer weather so we can sit outside and sample more delicious dishes!

Best Thai food I've ever had, and I've had a lot of Thai food! 

Perfect pot stickers. The pork red curry noodle dish was my heaven. My husband had a basil pork dish with rice and devoured it.

It's a lovely little restaurant tucked away in a shopping center. Open for lunch and dinner. Depending on the night, you might still need a reservation.

Happily we live close to it, because while this was our first visit, it won't be our last!

Fast and friendly service. Get the friend spinach (it's like spinach tempura). You dip it in this tangy vinegary dip that has cashews, ground chicken, green onions...it's magical just order it. 

The drunken noodles are a must also. Perfect every time.

Consistently delicious. Nice atmosphere. My family and I love it.

4 stars only because I'm not sure if I would go out of my way to go back. The restaurant is very cozy and clean. Service and food was good especially the spinach tempura salad! I'm glad I tried it and it was definitely worth it so now I can move on. The other dishes were pretty much typical in flavor of any other good Thai restaurant.

If you are looking for an intimate setting for a  date night with your significant over or just a fun girls night out on Thursdays for half price wine night and LOVE Thai food, this is the place. 
I've heard nothing but fabulous reviews about this little restaurant, and Nittayas did not disappoint. They offer an array of tapas and thai entrees. The Ahi tuna was fresh and melt in your mouth delicious. The soft shell crab and green apple salad was refreshing and a new dish for me, but I loved it. I also had to try the fried avocado which left me wanting more with its creamy, crunchy texture. By the tune my spicy basil eggplant entree came out I was stuffed and only able to eat a few incredible bites before throwing in the towel. 
I cannot wait to go back to this little gem. Oh and did I mention their staff is delightful?!

The food here is very good, portions are large, but it's pricey for a single diner.

I had the eggplant dish with chicken added.  (24.00)

Not many peppers, would have liked more, but tons and tons of eggplant--best tasting eggplant I have ever had at an Asian restaurant.  Sliced chicken breast was OK, but nothing special.

Really could have shared this dish it was so large and I am a tremendous eater.

Don't think anyone will have a bad meal here.

Service is very friendly and efficient. 

Nice place--fine for a romantic diner. 

Give it a shot.

Awesome little secret place. When we walked in it was dark and we noticed it was super nicely decorated. It looks more like a romantic place where you can get a little privacy. Food was good and the owner was around making sure everyone was happy. My husband wanted a lemonade and she heard when he asked the waiter. She quickly came to let us know they had their own home made lemonade (I think lavender) and we decided to go for it - it was delicious. They had no high chairs (I guess it is not really a kids place) but the tables are ok to sit kids at. We had both our kids in and while we were dining another family came in with 2-3 kids. We did not get any dirty looks :)
Overall great experience and I hope to make it back soon without kids for more of a romantic meal.

The food here is absolutely incredible!  I have been here a few times, and made a reservation for Valentine's Day.  We were seated quickly, and the service was well-timed and unobtrusive.  The waitstaff have always made excellent recommendations on wine every time I have been here, prices are very reasonable for the serving sizes and quality of food, and extra steps are taken on presentation.   A perfect date night thanks to Nittaya's.

truly the best thai food in las vegas!!!  that atmosphere is fabulous - the service incredible!  nittay the owner is absolutely adorable and takes such pride in her cooking!  she sent a plate of her special fried spinach - so we have everytime we go there - which is now about 3x a week!  a definite must if you have not been there!!!
make sure you make reservations at dinner time!

This little place has been a couple of different restaurants that haven't made it, but I sure hope this latest reincarnation lasts.  It's another place right in my neighborhood and I'm happy to report that it was a fine dining experience, as in great!  I had the spinach salad, which, as other reviewers have said, is a must:  it's tempura spinach--where else can you get that?  I also ordered the grilled mango shrimp, which is shrimp wrapped in bacon with a mango sauce: I did not share this dish.  My date had the  grilled salmon-avocado curry, which he loved and ate all by himself because I'm allergic to fish, but it gave me a good excuse to hoard my shrimp.  We finished off the meal with the fried bananas with coconut ice cream--wow!  Service was excellent throughout, but it's hard to be neglected in such a small space--I would recommend reservations if you go.  This place shouldn't be a secret because I want it to stay--check it out for yourself soon!
Hands down! the best Thai Restaurant in the city. The service and food is exceptional, very high standards.
I like this place when I go to Vegas. It's the bomb. The quality is amazing and they care about their customers. I get the pineapple fried rice with gf sauce.

I and my friend came here for lunch. At first I thought we went to a wrong place because I didn't realize the tables and chairs I saw in the pics were back in 2012. Haha. Anyways, this place got good reviews (That's why I picked this place) so, I had a high expectation of customer service & quality of food. It turned out that the food wasn't as expected. I was surprised Tom Yum wasn't listed on the menu. I asked the server who told me it was called "Lemon Grass soup" in the appetizer section.

Anyhow, the server could have been more pleasant. He looked like he didn't want to work there.

The Seafood Madness I ordered was way too salty. I didn't feel it was worth the price. Surprisingly, they brought a (small) bowl of rice for me & my friend to share. I would have preferred to have my own bowl of rice instead.

Not sure if I'd return......

Not going to lie. Very disappointed. I don't know if they changed staff but this visit was very bad. Ordered the fried rice but asked for no egg, and it was so bland, no taste at all. So switched it for the pad Thai. And waiter then said that chef couldn't comped it because we asked for no egg. But I don't understand why that's enough of an excuse for the rice to still be bland. I go to le Thai all the time and ask for no egg on top of my fried rice and it's still Amazing!!! If I would recommend Thai food I would say le Thai there is a long wait BUT there's a reason there is !!!!! Never leave yelp reviews until now. I had such a bad experience I felt like I needed to share it.

I found this place on Instagram. And when I checked the reviews, they were all good. This place is a very cute hidden gem. It is beautiful on the outside with the vines. And, it is very elegant & intimate on the inside. It is dark but not too dark. There were candles on the table and dim lighting. The bar was very pretty also. 

The food was good. We asked for the shishito peppers as an appetizer, but unfortunately, they were out. So, we got the spinach salad as an appetizer. I still don't know if it was fried or dehydrated spinach, but it was pretty good. 

He got the tiger steak which he liked and I got the Pad see yew with shrimp. My Pad see yew was pretty good. I have had better, but it was still pretty good. For dessert, we shared the mango sticky rice. It's a very simple and refreshing dessert. Basically, sliced mangoes and rice. It's very pretty to take a picture of it. I like the way that they put flowers on every dish. Orchids, I believe.

Overall, I like this place. The atmosphere was just perfect. I will definitely have to come back to try their shishito peppers. And, I would try a different entrée.

Best hidden secret in Las Vegas. This is by far our favorite place to eat out. We are always treated to kindly by the staff and the food is beyond amazing and excellent. 

The meals taste fresh and you can tell are made to order, with everything having it's own unique twist to it, and it works. 

Thank you Nittaya for giving us years of enjoyable dinners and evenings !

The only reason I'm not giving this place 5 stars is because of the service. The food: OUTSTANDING! The atmosphere: Cute and Comfortable. The wine list: Lots to choose from. The staff: Friendly. The service: Really slow...... We shared a bottle of Sauvignon Blanc and 2 starters, the Tempura Spinach Salad and the Calamari. Entrees were the Spicy Green Bean Pork and the Grilled Skirt-Steak Avocado Curry. I'll definitely go back (and probably order the same thing because it was so damn good). I just hope they consider hiring more staff to accommodate when the restaurant is busy. We dined at 8:45pm on a Friday.

I eat here a lot. I can't resist the spinach salad. I admit sometimes I come here at lunch just to have that spinach salad. The sauce that accompanies it is spectacular! I love the assortment of wines. I have not been disappointed with any of the wines. All of the food I've ordered has been delicious, full of flavor. I recommend this place for some home made Thai food that isn't commercialized.

This place designed very nicely, but the best part is not only the design, their food is great!
Until now it's the best Thai restaurant I ate, especially in Las Vegas.

I love their "happy nooners" menu, great value for your money!
The service was good, restaurant was clean and because of yelp - another great find (I found this restaurant few months ago).

For desert I tried the mango coconut rice, I enjoyed it :)

Love, love the decor. This is definitely a perfect place for a date or someone to impress, it's very serene and tranquil and was just a complete relaxation from the usual (but I'm probably saying this because I went right when they opened so it wasn't overly crowded with noise and chatter.) The service was excellent, they were friendly, professional and had immaculate timing with food, refills, etc. (probably because I was one of the few there at the time but still you'd be amazed at how many restaurants suck at this). I also really liked the bathrooms, they weren't the usual dingy bathroom, it kind of felt like a hotel bathroom. I know ... a bathroom review is weird but sometimes it's just good to know. 

I had the E-Haan Sausage, Calamari, Spinach Salad, Drunken Noodles and the Salmon Avocado Curry. The curry was recommended as the "best dish ever in the city" by the server and with that bold statement I knew it would fail to live up to expectations. It was good, not a standout but still good. The calamari was actually really good much to my surprise. It wasn't over breaded, had the perfect consistency and the sauce was spicy but sweet, a good complement. 

The E-Haan Sausage was different, you wrapped it in a lettuce wrap and it had different toppings, original, good and different. The drunken Noodles tasted like...drunken noodles. Nothing outstanding, they tasted exactly what they were supposed to taste like. 

I was a little confused about the hype over the spinach salad. The lime dressing is actually amazing, I love lime and I could drizzle that stuff over anything but the actual salad is just fried lettuce or tempura battered lettuce. I have an inner fat kid so anything fried tastes good, I'm not a fan of carrots but guess what's good? Fried carrots. Almost anything fried can be good so I'm not sure why this dish is overhhyped.

All in all not a bad place to check out, good environment, good wine selection, but not five stars because the food was good, but I can't see myself ever craving it or telling someone they have to go here to try a specific dish.

In a city of many fine Asian restaurants, this one is a gem for Thai food.  The food is original and delicious.  Pad noodles, salmon in green curry, lamb chops, appetizers--all good.  Service and ambience are fabulous.  Small intimate dining in a hideaway location.

My only regret here is that i wasn't able to try more of the menu. My personal favorite is the fried avocado wedges. Theres also a great wine menu too. All in all a good place to take friends or someone special.

I had the pleasure of dinning at Nittaya's Secret Kitchen last night after hearing great reviews from three other people. I consider myself a foodie and thought the secret is out now. You may want to make reservations. This small and intimate place has limited seating and fills up fast. This is not your ordinary Thai restaurant.  Each plate is a work of art served in a progressive style of unique combination of food to tantalize the taste buds.  I shared several delicious plates, tender Lamb Chops, a tasty and colorful Salmon-Eggplant with Avocado dish, a crunchy and clever Spinach Salad, and a tapas Golden Pouch that looked like a wrapped gift.  Everything was a culinary delight.  By far this is one of my favorite Thai restaurants.

DELICIOUS! Been here 3 times now...twice for dine in and once for takeout.  To name a few dishes...drunken noodle, volcano shrimp, and fried avocado. Flavors for all were spot on, the tempura batter was perfect.  For the take out we just reheated a little in oven for a few minutes on the avocado and shrimp and it did not ruin the tempura.  We also microwaved the drunken noodle just a little bit and did not spoil the texture of noodles. Just noting here in case you live a little distance and are concerned on reheating. Looking forward to trying some other dishes.  Thank you Nittaya for creating great dishes!! You are a gem!

This place is about 20 minute or so away from the strip. I been searching and wanting to try something different in Vegas. This came up in my search and decided to bookmark it to try. I ended up making reservations about two weeks in advance. It was really busy when we got there so it is better to have one than have to wait. 

The parking was super easy. I really like the feel of the place. Nothing too fancy, kind of remind me of a regular Thai place. 

What we ordered: 
World famous spinach salad-this thing was so good. It was just spinach tempura but the sauce is so good. It has a little kick to it. The spice and the limey taste really made the dish stand out. 

Crab roll-these were good. I thought the price was kind of high for the four rolls we got, however, they were yummy. 

Salmon-Avocado Curry-I really enjoys this dish. It had a green curry with a big piece of salmon with eggplant, zucchini, and avocado. You can change it to any protein you like. I decided to stick to the salmon cause that's what they are known for. This was worth the $24 price tag. 

Crying Tiger Steak-grilled rib eye steak was just okay. We would pass on this dish next time. 

Service-Great 

Overall, I would come back for the spinach salad again!
Made a reservation here.  When we arrived no one acknowledged or greeted us.  Stood at the front by the bar for 5+ minutes with no acknowledgement.  Left without eating.

Great restaurant. Very cozy. Excellent service especially Josh. The food was amazing. Our waitress recommended the spinach salad. It is tempura spinach (how do they do that) and it has great flavor and the dipping sauce was perfect with it. We also tried garlic ribs, potstickers, pad Thai, cashew shrimp all were excellent. Desserts were just as amazing. Try the Thai donuts and the crime brûlée trio.

Went here for dessert one night ... It was a small little place , cute inside , took a look at the dinner menu as well as we were seated and it looks just crazy pricey for Thai food! We had the bread pudding and the doughnuts ... Very tasty!!! But also very pricey... Won't be returning because of the prices unfortunately

I can't believe it's taken me this long to write a review of Nittaya's secret kitchen. This is absolutely, by far, the best Thai restaurant in Las Vegas. My favorite meal here starts with the lemongrass coconut soup with shrimp. It's a flavor explosion in your mouth. Then I follow it up with the panang catfish. The baby bok choy are super tender and the sauce on the catfish is terrific. Last time I was there I switched it up and got the salmon with the avocado sauce. Avocado sauce turned me off at first but I tried it anyway. It was spicy and delicious. The only thing that reminded me of avocado was the color of the sauce and a sliced fresh avocado on top. The Thai Michelin star cheff over on the east side is not even close to as good as this restaurant. Well Don Nittaya!
We love this place. Order a ton of different things. The noodles, the shrimp, the fiery noodles. Can't stop eating!!!
Quaint and cozy little restaurant. Excellent food, reasonable prices, lovely atmosphere, attentive staff who were readily available for recommendations. Enjoyed our time here and we will be back!

I don't usually give out 5 star ratings but this one kind of deserves it. We got 4 different dishes and I loved them all. 2 tapas, 1 curry, and 1 dessert. I've been to a few tapas joints but none are worthy of my 5 star rating. This is as best as it gets for both Thai and tapas :)! It's also definitely 2 $$s.

Absolutely no complaints about service either. This is also a very cozy little place so there's not a lot of room. It'll be a lot more busier during dinner time because of the small space. It's got dim lighting but it's a very peaceful environment especially with the soft music. The servers are ultra polite, professional, and friendly. You also get a special type of water but not sure if you can really taste it. If they didn't tell me at the beginning I don't think I would have noticed it at all. Ours had apple and something else (not sure) but I really couldn't taste it -- but that's not really important, I suppose :b.

WHAT WE ORDERED:
Cilantro Steak Skewers
(BBQ) Thai Wings
Duck Breast Curry
Family Style Coconut Ice Cream (has sticky rice)

THEY'RE ALL GOOD :)! So feel free to try them. Good as in I'd totally get them again. Heard some good things about the mango shrimp so I'll give that a try next time!
Good food hidden off of Lake Mead!  Big variety of food to please everyone.  Make a reservation on the weekend, it is busy!

More than excellent......superb!
The salad was a pleasant surprise and the veggie pot sticker a real bonus!
Can't wait to return .....

Food was delicious. I didn't try any of their wine, but the flavors of everything else were spot-on. Be aware, however, it's a tight space, and rather classy, so it was awkward having our toddler there with us. It's rather far from our house, so we probably won't be back anyway.

The definition of a hidden gem.  When my friend and I walked in, he immediately said he felt like he had been transported to a different place than Las Vegas.  The atmosphere is great.  Very dark, chic and kind of romantic.

The service was pretty good.  We ordered fairly quickly and we were never lacking for water.  The food came out quickly with the exception of one dish that basically came after we were done eating.

Now lets get to the food.  Very high quality with intense flavors.  The entrees and tapas are expensive but you get quite a bit for your buck and seriously the flavor is so good you won't care how much it costs.  The spinach salad is a must have.  YOU MUST GET THIS.  The sauce it comes with I could drink.  The mussels are pretty good too.  We added the coconut sauce it comes with to our soup, it was so good.  I did not like the homemade ice cream.  It was flavorful but very icy and grainy.  

Definitely worth a try.  You won't be disappointed.

This place is absolutely amazing! The ambiance is suitable for a causal dining with friends after a day of shopping or it's perfectly romantic for a nice date night. The food is also amazing! The Manfriend and I (the man in the picture stuffing his face on my profile) LOVE the noodle dishes, emerald rice, and the basil chicken pot stickers called the secret stickers. We used to go once a week but toned that down a bit to twice a month. Honestly I've never tried anything terrible - well except I was not a fan of the shrimp dishes (bacon wrapped shrimp or the shrimp tom yum soup).

Spinach salad is a must try.  Pad thai is good, not as good as Lotus of Siam.  Pad see ew tastes similar to Pin Kaow.  Really good thai iced tea.  Pricier than most thai restaurants.

Service is good and fast.  Decor is lovely.  I will probably go once in a while but since Pin Kaow is nearby, this will not be a regular place for me.

Only two words can describe my latest experience here... Oy & Vay. 

The food that I had was quite delicious (lettuce wraps, pineapple fried rice, chicken skewers, garlic edamame) so that's why they earned 3 stars. 
The deduction, however, comes from the HUGE communication problem with the chefs when it comes to making changes due to food allergies. Lost in translation, maybe? 

Listen carefully, if you can not eat shellfish, dairy, gluten, etc. you may want to pass on dining here. Two of the friends I came with have severe (life threatening) food allergies and have never felt so frustrated, annoyed and disappointed while dining out before. It was made crystal clear about the allergies and yet two dishes were still served to them with the allergic ingredients in them. The server seemed to think it was funny, but we didn't find the humor in it. Then our food was cleared away before we were even finished eating it. To make matters worse, when I mentioned it to him, he just laughed it off again. Sadly, nothing was ever compensated from our bill, and two of the girls ordered pizza when they got home. Dinner fail.

OMG where do I start!  Cute little place.  The staff was great!  I am a rigid Pad Thai girl but the menu was very interesting!  We started with the Spinach Salad (tempura spinach), then the crispy pork belly, next the phuket  poppers and finally the drunken noodles!  Everything was awesome...in the order I listed :)  I really liked the infused water as well.
Great Thai in a romantic setting. Perfect for a date night! Make sure to call ahead for reservations, this place isn't very big and it's popular! The Spinach Salad was GREAT!
Wow that is so good .. Amazing food .. No wonder a lot people here to get a table ... Thank you for food ..

This place is too cute. It looks like any old restaurant in Vegas from the outside. Once you step in, it is such a cozy vibe! We ordered mostly appetizers and they were all delicious! Great place for an intimate date or just a place to drink wine, eat and hang out with your girls.

One of my all time favorite spots! You just can't go wrong with the exotic mix of flavors! We try to mixing up every time but the spinach salad and the avocado curry are just a few of our favorites! You won't be disappointed! Ever!

TL;DR Don't get the drunken noodle. Don't get any noodles. Stick to fried rice or curry. Get the world famous spinach salad, but stay away from the thai ice tea.

This place for me was meh for me. Everything was great until I had the thai ice tea then it started going downhill.  

World Famous Spinach Salad: Rating: 5/5 The best part of the meal. Really good. If you com here, you have to get the world famous spinach salad. Come with an appetite as it will fill you up. Who knew spinach would be so good deep fried. 

Thai Ice Tea Rating 2/5 I expected better. It came in a wine glass instead of a tall glass. Honestly it wasn't that great, but at least it wasn't fake thai tea made from powder. I always get thai ice tea as it is a staple drink for any thai place. Meh #1.

Crying Tiger Steak Rating: 4/5 The sauce was very good with the steak. Medium rare. I feel like one of the best thing here is the sauce.

Drunken Noodle Rating: 1/5 Honestly this ruined my entire dining experience. Not only did it come out last and late compared to the crying tiger steak, but it was soggy and falling apart. I would stick a fork into the noodle and it would fall apart from it's own weight. Not only that, it was too salty, and the sauce flavor destroyed the entire dish. The only thing you could taste was the salty sauce. I talked to a waiter about it and he said it should be like that. What it tastes like is like leftover drunken noodle plates were recycled and recooked into my plate with some extra sauce to cover up the recooking process. I wouldn't even feed that to my dog. He might die from the sodium overload.
Nittaya makes the best Thai cuisine I've ever had. I used to go to Pin Kaow until I found Nittaya's secret kitchen. Reservations are recommended. This place fills up fast!

Love love love Nittaya's kitchen. It is wonderful to have such a good place that is close to home and convenient! The food is delicious and the service has always been great. The atmosphere is pretty and cozy, definitely feel like staying awhile and sipping a cocktail or a glass of wine! It's a must if you love Thai food and it's a great date night spot.
Great food and at a reasonable price.  Pretty amazing, considering the atmosphere is so fancy.
I went to this restaurant for lunch and found it to be very cozy and warm the food was delicious and the service was very good.

We sat out side for 15 mins with our mom and wouldn't let us even sit inside to stay cool
I would not go to this place

What a great place! I can't believe I've been living in Summerlin for 3 years, and just started coming to Nittaya's... 

The food here is not exactly authentic Thai, but the flavors and the dishes are incredible! The noodles are delicious, but come here for the appetizers/tapas! Tapas are good for sharing, and I've heard their potstickers and wings are delicious!  I ordered the Secret Spinach Salad....which, despite the name, is not at all a healthy dose of spinach. It's crispy fried spinach with an awesome tangy light dressing that is just a tad bit spicy....it's incredible. I also ordered the Crab Meat Fried Rice, which was very tasty and had some good chunks of crabmeat :) 

I will definitely be back to try some more dishes.  Decor is dark & romantic. Service is solid. Only thing is they don't really like to make substitutions/changes to the menu (ie we asked to remove the fried egg from the bangkok fried rice, but the waitress said no).

We came here for New Years and was not disappointed .. We expected to have to wait since it was a holiday but they were able to seat us right away! The food was delicious and the service wasn't bad either .. The server assistants were very quick to refresh our waters and food came on a timely manner and was very fresh.. Will definitely be back!

I have been to Nittaya's on a number of occasions after my first visit and it's as good as it's always been.

My first few visits were exclusively for dinner and they serve great options, but recently I've tried their lunch menu and they offer some exceptional meals at a good value. My favorites are the drunken noodles and any of their curries but I haven't had one thing at Nittaya's. The fried spinach salad is always a favorite and despite not usually liking deep fried food, this dish is always a treat.

The restaurant is small so reservations are always suggested.
This was a rare find. Loved every little bit of this place. The Servise was impeccable. The food was five stars. They even put the napkin on your lap

I LOVE this place! I have been there several times, and I have never had a meal I didn't love.  They have small plates as well as full meals, but I am a fan of the small plates... that way I get to taste more things! Their Spinach Salad is really fun - it is actually tempura battered spinach leaves. They also have this yummy dessert with mango slices and sticky rice... very simple, and the perfect end to a perfect meal. 
Anyhow - I recommend this place - I think you'll enjoy it!

Shhhhh...don't tell anyone because this is a secret kitchen.  I have had this restaurant bookmarked for awhile because I kept reading about the world famous spinach salad.  I love spinach.  And I love anything deep fried.  It is a match made in heaven.  

I met a friend for lunch here and upon entering we were impressed with the elegant and serene atmosphere. We decided to start off with the spinach salad to share, and each ordered from the $11 lunch menu.  

I now understand why this spinach salad is "world famous".  It was delicious.  Perfectly crispy, and the larb/lime dressing that accompanied it was fantastic.  I would eat salads (even non deep fried ones) everyday if I could pour that dressing on it.  

I ordered the Basil Eggplant and it also came with a small salad a potsticker, and my friend went with the classic Chicken Pad Thai. Everything was beautifully presented. And more importantly, tasted delicious.  I had stuffed myself silly with the spinach salad, but could not resist licking my entree plate clean.  My dish automatically comes at a spice level of 1 (on a scale of 5) and I upped to a 3 to give it that perfect kick. 

The service was sweet and friendly. Our fruit infused water glasses were never empty. 
Thanks Nittaya! I'l be back! Can't wait to come back and try the tapas and wine!!

First time visitor, lifetime customer. Crying Tiger! Crying Tiger! Crying Tiger! 
If you love Thai food, if you've been to Bangkok or Phuket or Thailand at all, you will love this place. Smaller dining room, friendly servers. I have to remember to set aside 1 hour lunch time. Love it.

This place was cool , cozy, mood lighting was awesome... The food by far was amazing.. AVOCADO FRIES ARE YUMMMMMMMMM AND SECRET DUMPLINGS... The waitress was cool and nice.  
The only problem was the couple nxt to us, they were arguing about non-sense and making small scenes (go home and do that) 
Overall i will def. go again.

When I am sick, their coconut milk broth is the only thing I want.  Owner is always there, cooking, placing fresh flowers.  Food is great, a little higher priced for the portions but sit at the bar, there is always someone nice and interesting to talk to.  They are closed on Sundays, and do zero advertising - it is all literally word of mouth so that tells you a bit about the place.  Great place to take family in from out of town or just get out for a night.  Nittaya makes the best mango sticky rice, but only when mango is in season.

Great place. Probably offers the best Thai food in Las Vegas. Mr. Wynn, one of our senators, zdogMD (sorry zdog, but I've seen you there twice), and other famous locals like to dine at Nittaya's. My favorite dishes are: tuna tartar, basil eggplant, catfish, and naked shrimp. Thai doughnuts is a good dessert choice.

Stopped here for grabbing a quick lunch. Ordered two appetizers recommended by our server, the tempura spinach was good while the volcano shrimp was way too sour. I wanna try their duck curry dish but unfortunately they ran out of duck that day. They have a lunch special menu so we opted for pineapple fried rice and massaman curry chicken. Both weren't impressed. Service was good.
